member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine
member.summary: Represents a sub-routine animation embedded within a canvas animation. Allows tile animations to be imported and played as nested animations with transform interpolation.

remarks.para: Animation sub-routines enable complex animations where a tile animation (like a walking character) can be embedded in a canvas animation with additional transform effects (position, scale, rotation) applied over the duration of the sub-routine.
Example Use Case: A character walks across the screen using a tile animation while the position is interpolated from left to right, creating the effect of movement across the canvas.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for this sub-routine.

member.summary: Gets whether a tile animation reel is loaded.

member.summary: Gets the reel file name (without path) for display.

member.summary: Gets the loaded tile animation reel, or null if not loaded.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.RenderedFrames
member.summary: Gets the pre-rendered frames from the loaded reel. Key = frame index, Value = pixel data (BGRA bytes).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.FrameWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of the rendered frames in pixels.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.FrameHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of the rendered frames in pixels.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.IsLoaded
member.summary: Gets whether the reel is loaded and frames are rendered.

member.name: E:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.ReelLoadedChanged
member.summary: Raised when the reel is loaded or unloaded.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.StartFrame
member.summary: Gets or sets the start frame in the canvas animation timeline where this sub-routine begins.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.DurationFrames
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration in frames for how long this sub-routine plays.
member.remarks: If the tile animation reel is shorter than this duration, it will loop or stop depending on the reel's settings. If longer, only the portion within this duration is played.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.EndFrame
member.summary: Gets the end frame (exclusive) where this sub-routine ends.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.PositionKeyframes
member.summary: Gets or sets the position keyframes for interpolation over the duration. Key = normalized frame position (0.0 to 1.0), Value = position in pixels (X, Y).
member.remarks: At frame 0 (StartFrame), position is interpolated from the first keyframe. At frame DurationFrames (EndFrame), position is interpolated to the last keyframe.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.ScaleKeyframes
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale keyframes for interpolation over the duration. Key = normalized frame position (0.0 to 1.0), Value = scale factor (1.0 = 100%).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.RotationKeyframes
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation keyframes for interpolation over the duration. Key = normalized frame position (0.0 to 1.0), Value = rotation in degrees.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.PositionInterpolation
member.summary: Gets or sets the interpolation mode for position keyframes.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.ScaleInterpolation
member.summary: Gets or sets the interpolation mode for scale keyframes.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.RotationInterpolation
member.summary: Gets or sets the interpolation mode for rotation keyframes.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.ZOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the Z-order for this sub-routine relative to layers. Lower values render first (behind), higher values render last (in front). A value of 0 places the sub-routine at the bottom of the layer stack. Use negative values to place behind all layers.
member.remarks: The Z-order determines where this sub-routine appears in the timeline and in what order it's composited during rendering. Sub-routines can be interleaved with layers to create foreground/background effects.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this sub-routine is active and should be played.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AudioTrackSettings
member.summary: Settings for an audio track in the animation timeline. Stores file path reference and playback configuration.

remarks.para: Audio tracks provide reference audio for animation timing (lip-sync, sound effects, music). The audio file is referenced by path, not embedded, to keep project files small.
Supported Formats: MP3, WAV, OGG, FLAC (via Windows Media Foundation).

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.CanvasAnimationState
member.summary: Manages canvas-based animation state for a document (Aseprite-style animation). Handles timeline, tracks, keyframes, and playback.

remarks.para: CanvasAnimationState provides layer-based animation where each layer can have keyframes that define its state (visibility, opacity, blend mode, pixel data) at specific frames. Values are held between keyframes (no interpolation).
Each has its own CanvasAnimationState that stores all tracks and frame data. This is serialized with the .pxp file.

member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of frames in the animation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the playback speed in frames per second.

member.summary: Gets the duration of a single frame in milliseconds.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.CanvasAnimationState.Loop
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the animation loops.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.CanvasAnimationState.PingPong
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the animation uses ping-pong (reverse at end) playback.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.CanvasAnimationState.AudioTracks
member.summary: Gets the collection of audio tracks for reference audio in the timeline.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.CanvasAnimationState.AudioTrack

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.CanvasAnimationTrack
member.summary: Represents an animation track for a single layer or folder. Contains keyframes that define the layer's state at specific frames.

remarks.para: Each layer/folder in the document has a corresponding CanvasAnimationTrack that stores its keyframes. Keyframes are sparse - only frames with explicit changes are stored. Between keyframes, values are held (no interpolation).
The track is identified by a LayerId that corresponds to a layer's GUID or index in the document structure.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData
member.summary: Stores the state of a layer at a specific keyframe. This captures all properties that can be animated: visibility, opacity, blend mode, pixel data, effects, and mask state.

remarks.para: LayerKeyframeData represents a snapshot of a layer's animatable properties at a specific frame. Between keyframes, the values are held (no interpolation) - Aseprite-style behavior.
Pixel data is stored as a reference to allow efficient memory usage when frames share content. The actual pixel data is managed separately to allow deduplication.
Effect states are stored per-effect, capturing IsEnabled and all animatable properties. Mask state (enabled/inverted/pixel data) is also captured for layers with masks.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData.FrameIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the frame index this keyframe is at.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the layer is visible at this keyframe.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the layer opacity at this keyframe (0-255).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData.BlendMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the blend mode at this keyframe.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData.PixelDataId
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier for the pixel data snapshot. This references a stored pixel buffer in the animation's pixel data storage. -1 means no pixel data change (inherit from previous keyframe).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData.HasPixelData
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this keyframe has pixel data changes. If false, the layer uses pixel data from the previous keyframe.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData.MaskEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the layer mask is enabled at this keyframe. Only applies to layers with masks attached.
member.remarks: When false, the mask has no effect on the layer (fully visible). Animating this property allows for mask reveal/hide effects.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData.MaskInverted
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the layer mask is inverted at this keyframe. Only applies to layers with masks attached.
member.remarks: When true, white areas hide and black areas reveal (opposite of normal). Animating this property allows for mask inversion effects.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData.MaskPixelDataId
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier for the mask pixel data snapshot. This references a stored pixel buffer in the animation's pixel data storage. -1 means no mask pixel data change (inherit from previous keyframe or no mask).
member.remarks: Mask pixel data is stored separately from layer pixel data, allowing independent animation of the mask. This enables effects like animated reveals, wipes, and dynamic masking without affecting the underlying layer content.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData.HasMaskPixelData
member.summary: Gets whether this keyframe has mask pixel data changes.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData.EffectStates
member.summary: Gets or sets the effect states at this keyframe. Each entry captures an effect's IsEnabled and property values.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty keyframe data at frame 0.

member.summary: Creates a keyframe data with specified values.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData.Clone
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of this keyframe data.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData.HasSameValues(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.LayerKeyframeData)
member.summary: Checks if this keyframe has the same property values as another (ignoring frame index).

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageAnimationTrack
member.summary: Manages keyframes for the stage (camera) animation track. Unlike layer tracks which hold values between keyframes, stage tracks interpolate.

remarks.para: StageAnimationTrack provides smooth camera movements by interpolating between keyframes. This allows for panning, zooming, and rotating effects during animation playback.
The track supports multiple easing functions per property (position, scale, rotation) for fine-grained control over camera motion.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageKeyframeData
member.summary: Stores the state of the stage (camera) at a specific keyframe. Contains position, scale, and rotation that can be interpolated between keyframes.

remarks.para: StageKeyframeData represents a snapshot of the camera's transform at a specific frame. Unlike layer keyframes which hold values, stage keyframes support interpolation for smooth camera movements.
Position is relative to the canvas origin (0,0). Scale is a multiplier (1.0 = 100%, 2.0 = 200% zoom in). Rotation is in degrees, positive = clockwise.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageKeyframeData.FrameIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the frame index this keyframe is at.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageKeyframeData.PositionX
member.summary: Gets or sets the X position of the stage center within the canvas.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageKeyframeData.PositionY
member.summary: Gets or sets the Y position of the stage center within the canvas.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageKeyframeData.ScaleX
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal scale factor (1.0 = 100%). Values greater than 1.0 zoom in, less than 1.0 zoom out.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageKeyframeData.ScaleY
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical scale factor (1.0 = 100%). Values greater than 1.0 zoom in, less than 1.0 zoom out.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageKeyframeData.UniformScale
member.summary: Gets or sets whether scale is uniform (ScaleX = ScaleY).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageKeyframeData.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation angle in degrees. Positive values rotate clockwise.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageKeyframeData.PositionEasing
member.summary: Gets or sets the easing function for position interpolation to this keyframe.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageKeyframeData.ScaleEasing
member.summary: Gets or sets the easing function for scale interpolation to this keyframe.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageKeyframeData.RotationEasing
member.summary: Gets or sets the easing function for rotation interpolation to this keyframe.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageKeyframeData.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty keyframe at frame 0.

member.summary: Creates a keyframe with specified values.

member.summary: Creates a keyframe with uniform scale.

member.summary: Creates a deep copy of this keyframe data.

member.summary: Interpolates between two keyframes.
member.returns: Interpolated transform values.

member.summary: Interpolates between two angles, taking the shortest path. Handles the wraparound at 180 degrees correctly.

member.summary: Applies an easing function to the interpolation factor.

member.summary: Nearest neighbor - preserves pixel art sharpness.

member.summary: Stage can move freely, may show content outside canvas (transparent).

member.summary: Linear interpolation - constant rotation speed.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageRotationInterpolation.EaseInOut
member.summary: Ease in/out - smooth acceleration and deceleration.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageRotationInterpolation.Step
member.summary: No interpolation - snap to keyframe values.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.StageSettings
member.summary: Settings for the animation stage (virtual camera/viewport). The stage defines the visible area of the canvas for final render output.

remarks.para: The Stage acts as a virtual camera that can pan, zoom, and rotate within the canvas. This allows for dynamic camera movements in animations, where layers can "enter from off-stage" or the camera can follow action.
Stage dimensions define the final output resolution. The stage area within the canvas is rendered to this output size using the specified scaling algorithm.

member.summary: Gets or sets the output width in pixels for the final render.

member.summary: Gets or sets the output height in pixels for the final render.

member.summary: Gets or sets the X position of the stage area within the canvas.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Y position of the stage area within the canvas.

member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the stage area within the canvas.

member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the stage area within the canvas.

member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling algorithm used when rendering the stage.

member.summary: Represents a single frame in a tile animation reel. Each frame references a tile position on the canvas (tx, ty). The pixels at that grid position are the frame's content.

member.summary: Gets or sets the tile grid X position for this frame.

member.summary: Gets or sets the tile grid Y position for this frame.

member.summary: Gets or sets the duration of this frame in milliseconds. If null, uses the reel's default frame time.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.ReelFrame.EmbeddedPixels
member.summary: Gets or sets the embedded pixel data for this frame (BGRA format). If null, pixels must be extracted from the document at runtime. When saved in PXPR v2+ format, this contains the actual frame pixels.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Brush.BrushDefinitionService
member.summary: Service for managing custom brush definitions loaded from the user's AppData directory.

remarks.para: BrushDefinitionService provides centralized access to custom brush files (.mrk format). It automatically scans the brush directory on initialization and caches loaded templates for efficient runtime access.
Brushes are identified by their full name in "author.brushname" format. This prevents conflicts between brushes from different authors.
Brushes are stored in: %AppData%/PixlPunkt/Brushes/*.mrk

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Brush.BrushMarkIO
member.summary: Handles serialization and deserialization of custom brush files (.mrk format).

remarks.para:
The .mrk (PixlPunkt Mark) format stores custom brush definitions with:
Author and brush name for identification
Single 16x16 mask (32 bytes, 1-bit packed)
Pivot point for brush alignment
Icon preview for UI display
remarks.code:
Header Magic: "PXMK" (4 bytes) Version: uint16 (2 bytes) = 3 AuthorLen: uint16 (2 bytes) Author: UTF-8 string (AuthorLen) NameLen: uint16 (2 bytes) Name: UTF-8 string (NameLen bytes) PivotX: float (4 bytes) PivotY: float (4 bytes)
Mask (32 bytes) 16x16 1-bit packed mask
Icon Width: uint16 (2 bytes) Height: uint16 (2 bytes) DataLen: uint32 (4 bytes) BGRA: byte[] (W*H*4 bytes)

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Brush.BrushMarkIO.Magic

member.summary: Current file format version (3 = single 16x16 mask).

member.summary: File extension for custom brush files.

member.summary: Saves a brush template to a file.

member.summary: Loads a brush template from a file.
member.returns: The loaded .

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Brush.BrushTemplate
member.summary: Defines a custom brush with a single 16x16 mask for pixel-perfect painting.

remarks.para: A contains a single 16x16 brush mask that is scaled at runtime to match the requested brush size. This provides a simple, consistent brush system where the 16x16 mask serves as the "master" definition.
Brushes are identified by their full name in the format "author.brushname" to avoid conflicts between different creators. For example: "PixlPunkt.Star", "JohnDoe.Splatter".

The 16x16 mask is scaled using nearest-neighbor sampling:
Size 1-16: Scale down from 16x16
Size 17-128: Scale up from 16x16

The pivot (PivotX, PivotY) defines the brush's anchor point as normalized coordinates (0.0-1.0):
(0.0, 0.0) = Top-Left
(0.5, 0.5) = Center (default)
(1.0, 1.0) = Bottom-Right

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Brush.BrushTemplate.Author
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush author/creator name.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Brush.BrushTemplate.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the user-visible brush name (without author prefix).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Brush.BrushTemplate.FullName
member.summary: Gets the full brush identifier in "author.brushname" format.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Brush.BrushTemplate.PivotX
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal pivot position (0.0 = left, 0.5 = center, 1.0 = right).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Brush.BrushTemplate.PivotY
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical pivot position (0.0 = top, 0.5 = center, 1.0 = bottom).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Brush.BrushTemplate.Mask
member.summary: Gets or sets the 16x16 brush mask (1-bit packed, 32 bytes).
member.remarks: The mask is stored as 1-bit per pixel, packed into bytes (8 pixels per byte). Total size: 16 * 16 / 8 = 32 bytes. A set bit (1) indicates a filled pixel, unset (0) indicates empty.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Brush.BrushTemplate.IconData
member.summary: Gets or sets the icon image data (32x32 BGRA outline) for UI display.

member.summary: Gets or sets the icon width (default 32).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Brush.BrushTemplate.IconHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the icon height (default 32).

remarks.para: CustomBrushIcons generates 32x32 outline icons from 16x16 brush masks. These icons follow the naming convention "Brush_Author_BrushName".
The 16x16 mask is scaled 2x to 32x32, then the outline is traced as white pixels.

remarks.para: Advanced templates are stored as .pxpt files (PixlPunkt Template) in %AppData%\PixlPunkt\Templates\Advanced\ They use the same binary format as .pxp documents but are intended to be opened as new untitled documents.
A companion .json metadata file stores display information like name, description, and preview thumbnail.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Coloring.Helpers.ColorUtil
member.summary: Provides static utility methods for color conversion, manipulation, parsing, and interpolation.

remarks.para: ColorUtil is the central color mathematics library for PixlPunkt, handling conversions between: - Packed BGRA (uint32) format: B[0..7], G[8..15], R[16..23], A[24..31] - WinUI Color struct - HSL (Hue, Saturation, Lightness) color space - HSV (Hue, Saturation, Value) color space - Hex strings (#RGB, #RRGGBB, #ARGB, #AARRGGBB)

Key operations: - **Packing/Unpacking**: Convert between byte components and packed uint32 - **Parsing**: Parse various hex color formats - **Color Space Conversion**: RGB HSL HSV - **Interpolation**: Lerp colors in RGB or HSL space - **Luminance/Contrast**: Calculate relative luminance and contrast ratios (WCAG) - **Merging**: Cluster similar colors within a tolerance
All methods are thread-safe (pure functions with no shared state). Methods marked with [AggressiveInlining] are optimized for performance in hot paths.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Coloring.Helpers.ColorUtil.MergeNearColors(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.UInt32},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Merges similar colors within a tolerance using simple clustering.
member.param: Maximum per-channel difference (0-255) to consider colors similar. Uses Chebyshev distance (max of R, G, B differences).
Maximum number of output colors to retain.
member.returns: A list of merged colors, with similar colors averaged together.

remarks.para: Algorithm: For each input color, find the first result color within tolerance. If found, average the two colors. Otherwise, add as new color.
This is a greedy O(n*m) algorithm where n=input count, m=output count. Not suitable for large datasets without optimization. Useful for palette quantization and color deduplication.

member.summary: Packs byte components into a BGRA uint32 (preferred canonical method).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Coloring.Helpers.ColorUtil.TryParseHex(System.String,Windows.UI.Color@)
member.summary: Parses a hex color string in various formats: #RGB, #RRGGBB, #ARGB, #AARRGGBB (with optional '#' or '0x' prefix).
member.returns: true if parsing succeeded; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Supported formats: - #RGB #RRGGBB (each digit doubled) - #RRGGBB opaque RGB - #ARGB #AARRGGBB (each digit doubled) - #AARRGGBB ARGB with alpha
Case-insensitive. Prefix '#' or '0x' is optional.

member.summary: Interpolates between two packed BGRA colors in HSL space using shortest hue path.
member.returns: Interpolated color (packed BGRA).
member.remarks: Uses to avoid hue wrapping artifacts (e.g., red to orange goes through yellows, not through blues/purples).

member.summary: Interpolates between two hue values using the shortest angular path.
member.returns: Interpolated hue (0-360).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Coloring.Helpers.ColorUtil.LerpRGBA(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Byte)
member.summary: Linearly interpolates all four RGBA channels between two colors.
member.param: Interpolation factor (0-255), where 0 returns and 255 returns .
member.returns: Interpolated BGRA color.
member.remarks: Uses floating-point interpolation with rounding for accuracy. This is NOT premultiplied alpha blending; it's a direct channel-wise lerp. For compositing, use instead.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Coloring.Helpers.ColorUtil.LerpRgbKeepAlpha(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Byte)
member.summary: Linearly interpolates RGB channels while preserving the destination alpha.
member.param: Foreground color (BGRA) - only RGB channels are used.
member.returns: Color with interpolated RGB and original destination alpha.
member.remarks: Uses integer math with rounding bias (+127/255) for speed. This is commonly used for opacity-based color replacement without affecting existing alpha.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Coloring.Helpers.ColorUtil.BlendOver(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Composites a source color over a destination using Porter-Duff "over" operator with premultiplied alpha.
member.returns: Composited color (BGRA, straight alpha).

remarks.para:
Implements the standard alpha compositing formula:
= + (1 - ) C = (C + C(1 - )) /
Colors are converted to premultiplied alpha internally, composited, then unpremultiplied for the result. This ensures mathematically correct blending of semi-transparent layers.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Coloring.Helpers.ColorUtil.CompositeOverWhite(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Composites a semi-transparent pixel over a white background (alpha flattening).
member.returns: Opaque color (BGRA with alpha=255) representing the visual appearance over white.

remarks.para: Used for export operations where transparency must be removed. Common for formats that don't support alpha channels (JPEG) or when exporting with background preservation.
Formula: C = C_src + 255 (1 - )

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Coloring.Helpers.ColorUtil.CompositeOverColor(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Composites a semi-transparent pixel over a specified background color.
member.returns: Opaque color (BGRA with alpha=255).

member.summary: Tests if two colors are exactly equal (all channels including alpha).

member.remarks: Faster than Euclidean distance and sufficient for color similarity comparisons in palette extraction and clustering algorithms.

member.summary: Computes the Manhattan (L1) distance between two packed BGRA colors (RGB only).

member.summary: Computes the Chebyshev (L) distance between two packed BGRA colors (max channel difference).

member.remarks: Returns squared distance to avoid sqrt calculation. Compare against tolerance for similarity testing.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Coloring.Helpers.ColorUtil.RelativeLuminance(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Calculates the relative luminance of a color according to WCAG 2.0 specification.
member.returns: Relative luminance (0-1), where 0 is black and 1 is white.

remarks.para: Uses the WCAG formula: L = 0.2126*R + 0.7152*G + 0.0722*B, with sRGB to linear conversion.
This is used for calculating contrast ratios and determining whether to use light or dark text over a background color.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Coloring.Helpers.ColorUtil.HighContrastInk(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Determines the optimal foreground color (black or white) for maximum contrast against a background.
member.returns: White (255,255,255) or black (0,0,0) depending on which provides better contrast.
member.remarks: Uses WCAG contrast ratio formula: (L1 + 0.05) / (L2 + 0.05), where L1/L2 are relative luminances. Returns the color with the higher contrast ratio.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Coloring.Swatch
member.summary: Represents a single color swatch in a palette picker UI with highlighting and selection state.

remarks.para: Swatch provides UI-bindable state for color palette display, tracking whether a swatch is the currently selected color () and whether it matches a search or filter criterion (). Implements for WinUI 3 data binding support.

list.item: Color: The immutable BGRA color value this swatch represents.
IsCenter: True if this is the active/selected swatch in a palette picker. Used for visual highlighting (e.g., bold border, different background).
IsMatch: Dynamic property indicating whether this swatch matches current search/filter criteria. Can be updated at runtime to highlight relevant colors.

remarks.para:
- Color picker UI where one swatch is "active" (IsCenter)
- Palette search/filter where matching swatches are highlighted (IsMatch)
- Quick swatch panels with selection state tracking
- Gradient stops or color ramp visualization

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.ChromaticAberrationEffect
member.summary: Simulates lens chromatic aberration by radially displacing red and blue color channels.

remarks.para: This effect mimics the optical distortion caused by lens imperfections where different wavelengths of light refract at slightly different angles. Red and blue channels are shifted outward/inward from the image center while green remains fixed, creating colored fringes around high-contrast edges.

list.item: OffsetPixels (0..8 px): Radial displacement distance for red and blue channels. Red shifts outward (away from center) while blue shifts inward (toward center).
Strength (0..1): Blend factor between original color and shifted channels. At 0, no aberration. At 1, full channel displacement.
For each pixel, compute normalized direction vector from image center: (dx, dy) / distance.
Sample red channel from position shifted outward along radial direction by OffsetPixels.
Sample blue channel from position shifted inward along radial direction by OffsetPixels.
Keep green channel unchanged (acts as luminance anchor).
Blend sampled channels with original based on Strength parameter.

remarks.para: Creates colorful fringing on edges and details, particularly visible in high-contrast areas. Commonly used for artistic "lens distortion" effects or to simulate vintage camera optics.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.ColorAdjustEffect
member.summary: Adjusts layer colors by modifying hue, saturation, and brightness (value) in HSV color space.

remarks.para: This effect provides independent control over three fundamental color properties: hue (color wheel rotation), saturation (color purity/intensity), and value (brightness). All adjustments are performed in HSV color space which separates these perceptual attributes, making intuitive color corrections possible without affecting alpha channel.

list.item: HueShiftDegrees (-180..180): Rotates colors around the color wheel. 180 inverts hue (red cyan, green magenta, blue yellow). Useful for colorizing, creating duotone effects, or correcting color casts.
SaturationScale (0..2): Multiplies color saturation. At 0, produces grayscale. At 1, no change. At 2, doubles saturation (oversaturated/neon colors).
ValueScale (0..2): Multiplies brightness. At 0, pure black. At 1, no change. At 2, doubles brightness (may clip to white).
Hue (H): Angular position on color wheel (0-360). 0=red, 120=green, 240=blue.
Saturation (S): Color purity (0..1). 0 = gray, 1 = pure spectral color.
Value (V): Brightness (0..1). 0 = black, 1 = maximum brightness.
Convert pixel from RGB to HSV using standard conversion formulas.
Apply transformations: H' = (H + shift) mod 360, S' = clamp(S satScale, 0, 1), V' = clamp(V valScale, 0, 1).
Convert back from HSV to RGB for final output pixel.

remarks.para: Color grading, white balance correction, desaturation (grayscale), brightness adjustment, colorization effects, and complementary color shifts for artistic stylization.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.CrtEffect
member.summary: Simulates a cathode ray tube (CRT) monitor with barrel distortion and radial vignette.

remarks.para: This effect recreates the characteristic visual appearance of vintage CRT displays by combining barrel/pincushion distortion with edge darkening.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.DropShadowEffect
member.summary: Creates a shadow beneath the layer with configurable offset, blur, color, and opacity.

remarks.para: This effect generates a drop shadow by creating a duplicate of the layer's alpha channel, offsetting it, optionally blurring it, tinting it with a color, and compositing it behind the original layer. Commonly used to add depth and separation between UI elements or layers.

list.item: OffsetX/OffsetY (pixels): Shadow displacement from original layer position.
Opacity (0..1): Shadow transparency. At 1, shadow is fully opaque (respecting color alpha).
BlurRadius (0..MaxRadius pixels): Softness of shadow edges using box blur algorithm.
Color (BGRA): Shadow tint color (default: black). Alpha channel controls base shadow opacity.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.DropShadowEffect.BoxBlur(System.UInt32[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Separable box blur using O(n) running sum algorithm. Two-pass (horizontal then vertical) with running sum per scanline.
member.remarks: This implementation is O(width*height*2) regardless of blur radius, compared to the naive O(width*height*radius) approach.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.GlowBloomEffect
member.summary: Extracts and emphasizes bright regions, creating a soft glow or bloom effect.

remarks.para: This effect simulates light bleeding or lens bloom by isolating bright pixels above a threshold, blurring them extensively, and adding the result back to the original image with amplification. Commonly used in games and cinematics to create dreamy, ethereal lighting or simulate camera over-exposure around bright light sources.

list.item: Threshold (0..1): Brightness cutoff for bloom extraction. Pixels with max(R,G,B) below this value don't contribute to glow. At 0.7, only the brightest 30% of values produce bloom.
Intensity (0..2): Amplification factor for the blurred glow when added back to original. At 1.0, matched brightness. At 2.0, doubles the bloom contribution.
Radius (0..8 px): Blur kernel size for glow spread. Larger values create softer, more diffuse halos around bright regions.
Bright-pass filter: For each pixel, compute brightness = max(R,G,B). If brightness > threshold, extract color with strength = (brightness - threshold) / (1 - threshold).
Blur extracted glow: Apply two-pass box blur to glow channels (R, G, B separately) using the specified radius.
Additive composite: Add blurred glow back to original pixels scaled by intensity: result = original + glow intensity. Clamped to valid color range [0..255].

remarks.para: Processes three separate float buffers (RGB channels) for glow extraction and blurring. Box blur complexity is O((2r+1) width height 2 passes). Total memory overhead is approximately 9 width height sizeof(float) bytes for intermediate buffers.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.GlowBloomEffect.BoxBlur(System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Separable box blur using O(n) running sum algorithm for RGB float channels. Two-pass (horizontal then vertical) with running sum per scanline.
member.remarks: This implementation is O(width*height*2) regardless of blur radius, compared to the naive O(width*height*radius) approach.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.GrainEffect
member.summary: Adds film grain noise texture to the layer simulating analog film or sensor noise.

remarks.para: This effect generates pseudo-random noise using a hash-based noise function and blends it with the layer pixels. Commonly used to add texture, simulate vintage film, or match noisy footage. The noise pattern is deterministic based on pixel position and seed value.

list.item: Amount (0..1): Noise intensity. At 0, no noise. At 1, maximum 64 value deviation per channel.
Monochrome: When true, applies same noise value to all RGB channels (grayscale grain). When false, applies independent noise to each channel (colored grain).
Seed: Random seed controlling noise pattern. Different seeds produce different grain textures.

remarks.para:
Uses integer hash function combining pixel coordinates (x, y), seed, and channel index to generate pseudo-random values in range [-1..1]. The hash function is:
hash = (x 73856093) XOR (y 19349663) XOR (seed 83492791) XOR (channel 2654435761) hash = hash XOR (hash >> 13) hash = hash 1274126177 hash = hash XOR (hash >> 16) noise = ((hash AND 0xFFFF) / 65535) 2 - 1
This produces spatially-coherent noise without requiring lookup tables or perlin noise generation.
Very fast per-pixel operation using only integer arithmetic and bit operations. Processes entire frame in O(width height) with minimal overhead beyond pixel access.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.OrphanedEffect
member.summary: Represents a layer effect from a plugin that is not currently loaded.

remarks.para: When loading a .pxp file that contains effects from plugins that aren't installed or loaded, those effects are preserved as instances. This allows:

list.item: The document to load without errors
The user to see which effects are unavailable
The effect data to be preserved when re-saving
The effect to become active if the plugin is installed later

remarks.para: Orphaned effects are displayed in the UI with a warning indicator and are automatically disabled (they have no Apply implementation).

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.OutlineEffect
member.summary: Draws a colored outline around the opaque regions of the layer.

remarks.para: This effect detects edges of the layer's alpha channel and draws a solid-color border around them. The outline appears outside the layer content, expanding the visual footprint while preserving the original interior pixels.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.OutlineEffect.OutsideOnly
member.summary: If true, only adds outline outside the shape; interior pixels are not changed.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.PaletteQuantizeEffect
member.summary: Reduces layer colors to a limited palette by snapping each pixel to its nearest palette color.

remarks.para: This effect performs color quantization by replacing each pixel's RGB values with the closest color from a predefined palette. Commonly used to create retro pixel art aesthetics, enforce specific color themes, or simulate limited color hardware (Game Boy, NES, CGA, etc.).

list.item: Colors: Observable collection of BGRA palette colors. The effect searches this set to find the best match for each pixel. Empty palette results in no effect.
Palette: Array accessor for the color collection, provided for convenience.
For each non-transparent pixel, extract RGB values (alpha is preserved).
Compute Euclidean distance in RGB space to each palette color: distance = (R - R) + (G - G) + (B - B)
Select palette color with minimum distance (nearest neighbor in RGB cube).
Replace pixel RGB with selected palette color, keeping original alpha.

remarks.para: Uses squared Euclidean distance in RGB space for performance (avoids sqrt). This treats all color channels equally, which may not match perceptual color difference. For more accurate perceptual matching, consider converting to Lab color space (not currently implemented).
O(pixels paletteSize) complexity. For large palettes (>256 colors), performance may degrade. Consider using k-d trees or octrees for acceleration if palette size exceeds ~100 colors.
Retro game aesthetics, enforcing brand color palettes, posterization effects, color theme consistency, or simulating vintage hardware color limitations.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.PaletteQuantizeEffect.Palette
member.summary: Optional backing array if your quantize code expects a raw array.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.PixelateEffect
member.summary: Reduces image resolution by averaging pixels into uniform blocks, creating a mosaic effect.

remarks.para: This effect divides the image into a grid of square blocks and replaces all pixels within each block with the block's average color. Creates a "chunky pixel" aesthetic commonly used for censorship, retro game styling, or stylized low-resolution appearance.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.ScanLinesEffect
member.summary: Applies horizontal scanline overlay effect simulating CRT monitor or retro display appearance.

remarks.para: This effect draws alternating horizontal lines across the layer, creating a classic CRT television or vintage computer monitor aesthetic. The scanlines can be customized with adjustable thickness, spacing, intensity, and color tint.

list.item: Intensity (0..1): Controls blend strength between original pixel and line tint.
LineThickness (1..128 px): Height of each scanline in pixels.
LineSpacing (0..128 px): Gap between scanlines.
Color (BGRA): Tint color for the scanlines (default: black).
ApplyOnAlpha: When true, draws scanlines over fully transparent pixels.

remarks.para: For each pixel in a scanline row (determined by y % (thickness + spacing)), blends the original color toward the tint color using linear interpolation: result = original (1 - t) + tint t, where t = intensity tintAlpha. Transparent pixels are either skipped or filled with tinted color based on setting.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Effects.VignetteEffect
member.summary: Applies radial darkening/tinting from the center toward edges, creating a vignette effect.

remarks.para: This effect simulates the natural light falloff seen in camera lenses, darkening the corners and edges of the image while keeping the center bright.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Helpers.Compositor
member.summary: Provides static methods for compositing multiple raster layers with blend modes, opacity, and effects.

remarks.para: The Compositor is responsible for rendering the final image by blending all visible layers from bottom to top, applying their blend modes, opacity, and effects. It uses a scratch buffer to apply effects without modifying the original layer data.

Supported blend modes include: Normal, Multiply, Screen, Overlay, HardLight, Add, Subtract, Difference, Darken, Lighten, and Invert. All blending is performed in normalized float space (0.0-1.0) with proper alpha compositing.
The compositor uses thread-local scratch buffers to ensure thread safety when compositing from multiple threads simultaneously.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Helpers.Compositor._fxScratch
member.summary: Thread-local scratch surface for applying effects without mutating layer data. Each thread gets its own scratch buffer to ensure thread safety.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Helpers.Compositor.ByteToFloat
member.summary: Precomputed lookup table for byte to normalized float conversion (0-255 0.0-1.0).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Helpers.Compositor.#cctor
member.summary: Static constructor to initialize lookup tables.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Helpers.Compositor.CompositeLinear(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer},PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface)
member.summary: Composites multiple raster layers into a destination surface from bottom to top.
member.param: The layers to composite, in bottom-to-top order. Invisible layers are automatically skipped.
The destination surface to render into. Must not be null. The surface is cleared to transparent black before compositing begins.

remarks.para: Algorithm: 1. Clear destination to transparent (0,0,0,0) 2. For each visible layer (bottom to top): a. If layer has no enabled effects, blit directly to destination b. If layer has effects, copy to scratch buffer, apply effects in order, then blit 3. Blitting respects layer opacity, blend mode, and layer mask
Layers are skipped if they are null, invisible, have null surfaces, or have zero opacity.
Effects are applied in the order they appear in , but the list is reversed before application (so first effect in list is applied first).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Compositing.Helpers.Compositor.Blit(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface,System.Byte,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.BlendMode,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerMask)
member.summary: Blits (blends) a source surface into a destination surface with the specified opacity, blend mode, and optional mask.
member.param: Global opacity multiplier (0-255). 255 = fully opaque, 0 = fully transparent.
The blend mode to use when combining colors.
Optional layer mask. If provided, pixel alpha is multiplied by mask value.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.CanvasDocument
member.summary: Represents a multi-layer pixel art canvas with tile grid support and event-driven updates.

remarks.para: CanvasDocument is the central document model managing layers, compositing, and document-level operations. It maintains a layer stack, tracks the active layer for editing, and provides events for UI synchronization when structure or content changes.

The document has both pixel dimensions (actual drawable area) and tile dimensions (logical grid for tile-based editing). Layers are stored in bottom-to-top order internally, but can be converted to UI order (top-to-bottom) using .
All structure-modifying operations (add, remove, reorder layers) fire before the change and after, allowing observers to snapshot state or refresh UI.

Layers can be organized into folders. The flattened view (for UI display) is obtained via . Folders cascade their visibility and lock state to children without modifying individual layer properties (Photoshop-style).
The document maintains a containing all unique tiles that can be placed on the canvas. Each layer can have its own for independent tile arrangements.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.CanvasDocument.ResizeCanvas(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Resizes the canvas to new dimensions, repositioning existing content based on offset.
member.param: Horizontal offset for existing content (where to place old content in new canvas).
Vertical offset for existing content (where to place old content in new canvas).

remarks.para: This method resizes all layer surfaces and the composite surface, copying existing pixel data to the new surfaces at the specified offset. Pixels outside the old bounds are initialized to transparent (0x00000000).

The offset determines where the top-left corner of the old content appears in the new canvas: - Positive offset: old content shifted right/down (space added at left/top) - Negative offset: old content shifted left/up (content cropped from left/top) - Zero offset: old content stays at top-left corner

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.DocumentIO
member.summary: Binary serializer for PixlPunkt native document format (.pxp).

remarks.para: DocumentIO provides save/load functionality for the PixlPunkt native file format (.pxp), which uses a custom binary structure for efficient storage and fast loading.

list.item:
Header:
Magic number: 'PXP1' (0x31505850) for format identification
Version: Int32 = 3
Document name: Length-prefixed UTF-8 string

Canvas Geometry:
Pixel dimensions: width, height (Int32)
Tile size: width, height (Int32)
Tile counts: columns, rows (Int32)

Tile Set:
Tile dimensions (Int32, Int32) - 0,0 indicates no tiles
Tile count (Int32)
For each tile: ID, pixel data length, pixel data (width * height * 4 bytes)

Tile Animation State (Version 2+):
Reel count (Int32)
For each reel: GUID, name, settings, frame count, frames
Onion skin settings

Canvas Animation State (Version 3+):
Frame count, FPS, loop (Int32, Int32, bool)
Onion skin settings
Track count (Int32)
For each track: GUID, layer GUID, name, isFolder, depth, keyframe count, keyframes
Pixel data storage count and entries

Layer Structure (recursive):
Root item count (Int32)
For each item: node type (1=RasterLayer, 2=Folder), properties, effects, tile mapping, then children if folder

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.DocumentIO.Magic
member.summary: Magic number identifying PixlPunkt document format: 'PXP1' in ASCII (0x31505850).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.DocumentIO.CurrentVersion
member.summary: Current file format version. Version 1: Initial format Version 2: Added tile animation state Version 3: Added canvas animation state Version 4: Added layer IDs for animation track binding Version 5: Added stage (camera) settings and keyframes Version 6: Added effect keyframes for layer effects animation Version 7: Added audio track settings Version 8: Added multiple audio tracks support Version 9: Added layer masks Version 10: Added animation sub-routines

member.remarks: The workspace maintains an observable collection of documents for UI binding and provides events when the active document changes. This is the central coordination point for managing multiple open canvases in the application.

member.summary: Adds a document to the workspace and sets it as the active document.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.ForeignDocumentImporter
member.summary: Importers for foreign pixel art and icon file formats into native PixlPunkt documents.

remarks.para: ForeignDocumentImporter provides conversion utilities to load documents from other pixel art tools and image formats into PixlPunkt's native structure. All importers produce fully-formed documents with proper layer structure, blend modes, and canvas geometry.

list.item: .pyxel (PyxelEdit): Full layer stack import with blend modes, visibility, opacity, and tileset configuration. Handles ZIP-based file structure with JSON metadata.
.ase / .aseprite (Aseprite): Scaffolded but not yet implemented. Planned support for frame 0 layer import with full property mapping.
.ico (Windows Icon): Imports largest available icon frame as a single-layer document with automatic size detection.
.cur (Windows Cursor): Imports largest available cursor frame as a single-layer document with automatic size detection.

remarks.para: All importers follow a common pattern: detect format from extension, parse metadata, create appropriately-sized , populate layers with pixel data and properties, and regenerate the composite surface. Tile dimensions are either derived from format-specific tilesets or use sensible defaults (1616 for icons, format-specific for pixel art tools).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.ForeignDocumentImporter.ImportFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Imports a foreign file into a new CanvasDocument, auto-detecting format by extension.
member.param: Path to the foreign document file.
member.returns: A fully initialized with layers and composite surface.
member.exception: Thrown if is null or whitespace.
Thrown if the file extension is not supported.
Thrown if the file format is invalid or corrupted.

list.item: .pyxel
.ase, .aseprite
.ico
.cur
.tmx
.tsx

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.ForeignDocumentImporter.ImportPyxel(System.String)
member.summary: Imports a PyxelEdit .pyxel document with full layer support and property mapping.
member.returns: A with all layers, blend modes, and tileset configuration.
member.exception: Thrown if the file is not a valid PyxelEdit document or is missing required metadata.

list.item: Open ZIP archive and read docData.json metadata
Extract canvas dimensions (width, height) and tileset configuration (tileWidth, tileHeight)
Create with computed tile counts = canvasSize / tileSize
Sort layers by numeric key ("0", "1", "2", ...) and reverse for bottom-to-top order

For each layer:
Load pixel data from layerN.png embedded in ZIP
Create and copy pixels
Map properties: visible (inverted from 'hidden'), opacity (alpha 0-255), blend mode
Update layer preview thumbnail
Regenerate composite surface

remarks.para: Maps PyxelEdit string blend modes to enum: "normal" Normal, "multiply" Multiply, "screen" Screen, "overlay" Overlay, "add"/"addition"/"linear_dodge" Add, "subtract" Subtract. Unknown modes default to Normal.

list.item: Layer groups/folders are ignored (only flat layer list)
Tileset mapping and animation data not imported
All layers must match canvas dimensions (no offset/partial layers)

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.ForeignDocumentImporter.PyxelJsonOptions
member.summary: JSON deserialization options for PyxelEdit metadata.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.ForeignDocumentImporter.MapPyxelBlend(System.String)
member.summary: Maps PyxelEdit blend mode string to PixlPunkt enum.
member.returns: Corresponding value, or if unknown.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.ForeignDocumentImporter.LoadSurfaceFromPng(System.IO.Compression.ZipArchiveEntry)
member.summary: Loads a PixelSurface from a PNG stored within a ZIP archive entry.
member.param: ZIP entry containing PNG image data.
member.returns: A with pixels in BGRA format.

remarks.para: Reads PNG data using , locks bits as Format32bppArgb, and copies to byte array. Assumes premultiplied alpha and BGRA/ARGB memory layout matching PixlPunkt's internal format.
Performance: Uses unsafe pointer copy via for direct memory transfer without per-pixel iteration.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.ForeignDocumentImporter.ImportAseprite(System.String)
member.summary: Imports an Aseprite file, extracting frame 0 layers into a CanvasDocument.
member.returns: A with frame 0 layers.
member.exception: Thrown if the file is not a valid Aseprite document.

remarks.para: Aseprite uses a chunk-based binary format with ZLIB compression for pixel data. This importer extracts frame 0 (first frame) and creates layers from cel data.

list.item: RGBA and Indexed color modes (Grayscale not yet supported)
Layer names, visibility, opacity, and blend modes
Compressed (ZLIB) and uncompressed cel data
Linked cels (reference to previous frame cel)
Only frame 0 is imported (animations not preserved)
Layer groups are flattened
Tilemap layers not yet supported

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.ForeignDocumentImporter.ImportTmx(System.String)
member.summary: Imports a Tiled TMX tilemap file as a CanvasDocument.
member.returns: A representing the rendered tilemap.
member.exception: Thrown if the file is not a valid TMX document.

list.item: Parse TMX XML to extract map dimensions and tile size
Load embedded or external tileset images
Render each layer by placing tiles according to GID data
Create CanvasDocument with one RasterLayer per tilemap layer
CSV and base64 (uncompressed) tile data encoding
External and embedded tilesets
Multiple tile layers
Layer visibility and opacity
Object layers are ignored
Compressed tile data (gzip/zlib) requires additional handling
Animated tiles show only first frame

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.ForeignDocumentImporter.ImportTsx(System.String)
member.summary: Imports a Tiled TSX tileset file as a CanvasDocument.
member.returns: A containing the tileset image.
member.exception: Thrown if the file is not a valid TSX document.

remarks.para: TSX files define tilesets for Tiled tilemaps. This importer loads the tileset image and creates a document with the tile grid configuration matching the tileset definition.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerBase
member.summary: Abstract base class for all layer types providing common properties and change notification.

remarks.para: LayerBase defines the fundamental interface shared by all layer implementations in PixlPunkt, including (pixel layers) and (grouping containers). It implements to support data binding in the UI layer hierarchy.

list.item: Name: User-visible layer label displayed in the layers panel.
Visible: Controls whether the layer contributes to the final composite. Hidden layers are skipped during rendering but remain in the document.
Locked: When true, prevents editing of layer content (pixels, effects, etc.). Used to protect layers from accidental modification.
Parent: Reference to the containing folder, or null if at document root.
CanHaveChildren: Abstract property indicating whether this layer type supports child layers (true for , false for ).

remarks.para: Folders cascade their Locked/Visible state to children. Use and to check if a layer is truly editable/renderable considering all ancestor folders.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerBase.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for this layer.
member.value: A that uniquely identifies this layer instance. This ID is stable across the lifetime of the layer and is used for animation track binding.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerBase.RestoreId(System.Guid)
member.summary: Restores the layer ID from a saved document. This is used during deserialization to maintain animation track binding.
member.param: The saved layer ID to restore.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerBase.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the user-visible layer name.
member.value: A string representing the layer's display name. Default is "Layer".

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerBase.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this layer is visible in the final composite.
member.value: true if the layer should be rendered; otherwise, false. Default is true.
member.remarks: Hidden layers are excluded from compositing operations but remain in the document structure. Note: This is the layer's own visibility. Use to check if the layer is visible considering ancestor folders.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerBase.Locked
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this layer is locked from editing.
member.value: true if the layer is locked; otherwise, false. Default is false.
member.remarks: Locked layers cannot be modified (pixels, effects, properties) but can still be viewed and included in compositing. Note: This is the layer's own lock state. Use to check if the layer is locked considering ancestor folders.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerBase.Parent
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent folder containing this layer, or null if at document root.
member.value: The that contains this layer, or null for root layers.
member.remarks: This property is managed by when adding/removing children. It should not be set directly by external code.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerBase.CanHaveChildren
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this layer type can contain child layers.
member.value: true if children are allowed (e.g., ); false for leaf types (e.g., ).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerBase.IsEffectivelyVisible
member.summary: Determines if this layer is effectively visible considering all ancestor folder states.
member.returns: true if this layer and all ancestors are visible; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Used to determine rendering visibility. A layer with Visible=true but inside a hidden folder will return false. This implements Photoshop-style cascading visibility.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerBase.IsEffectivelyLocked
member.summary: Determines if this layer is effectively locked considering all ancestor folder states.
member.returns: true if this layer OR any ancestor is locked; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Used to determine edit permissions. A layer with Locked=false but inside a locked folder will return true. This implements Photoshop-style cascading lock state.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerFolder
member.summary: Represents a folder/group layer that can contain child layers for organizational hierarchy.

remarks.para: LayerFolder provides grouping functionality for organizing layers into hierarchical structures. Unlike , folders don't contain pixel data but serve as containers for other layers (both raster layers and nested folders).

When a folder is locked or hidden, all children are **effectively** locked/hidden for rendering and editing purposes, but their individual Locked/Visible properties remain unchanged. This allows toggling folder visibility without losing child visibility states.
Folders are displayed in a flattened ListView with indentation based on depth. The property controls whether children are visible in the UI list.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this folder is expanded in the UI layer list.
member.value: true if the folder's children should be visible in the UI list; otherwise, false. Default is true (expanded).
member.remarks: This property controls UI presentation only and does not affect rendering. Child layers within a collapsed folder still contribute to compositing if visible.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating that folders can contain child layers.
member.value: Always returns true for .

member.summary: Performs a depth-first traversal of this folder and all descendants.
member.returns: An enumerable of all layers in depth-first order (folder, then its children recursively).
member.remarks: The folder itself is yielded first, followed by each child in order. For child folders, their descendants are recursively yielded before moving to the next sibling.

member.returns: An enumerable of raster layers for compositing.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerListItem
member.summary: View model wrapper for layers in the hierarchical UI layer list, providing display properties and tree state.

remarks.para: LayerListItem bridges the gap between the core document layer structure () and the UI tree view presentation. Each item in the layers panel is represented by a LayerListItem that wraps the underlying layer data and adds UI-specific properties like depth, indentation, icons, and expand/collapse state.

list.item: Item: The wrapped (either or ).
Parent: The parent folder containing this item (null for root-level layers).
Depth: Nesting level in the hierarchy (0 = root, 1 = first level children, etc.). Drives the property for visual tree structure.
: Returns appropriate icon based on layer type and folder expansion state (folder closed, folder open, or layer/page icon).
: Chevron direction for expand/collapse UI (down when expanded, up when collapsed).
: for left margin based on (16px per level).
: Controls whether expand/collapse button is shown (visible for folders, collapsed for layers).

remarks.para: Implements to support WinUI 3 data binding. When changes, automatically raises property changed notifications for to update UI indentation.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerMask
member.summary: Represents a layer mask for non-destructive editing. The mask is a grayscale image where: - White (255) = fully visible (layer content shows through) - Black (0) = fully hidden (layer content is masked out) - Gray values = partial transparency

remarks.para: Layer masks allow non-destructive hiding of portions of a layer. Instead of erasing pixels, you can paint on the mask to show/hide areas. This is reversible - painting white on the mask reveals the original content.

The mask is stored as a single-channel (grayscale) image but internally uses a PixelSurface (BGRA) for consistency with the rendering pipeline. Only the alpha channel is used; RGB channels are set to the same value for preview display.
Mask Editing: - Painting white reveals the layer - Painting black hides the layer - Soft brushes create smooth transitions - The mask is editable just like the layer content

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerMask.Surface
member.summary: Gets the mask surface containing the mask data. Uses BGRA format but only the grayscale value is meaningful. RGB = grayscale value, A = 255 (fully opaque for preview).

member.summary: Gets the height of the mask in pixels.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the mask is currently enabled (applied during compositing).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerMask.IsInverted
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to invert the mask during application. When true, white areas hide and black areas reveal.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerMask.IsLinked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the mask is linked to the layer. When linked, moving the layer also moves the mask.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.LayerMask.Density

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer
member.summary: Represents a raster (pixel-based) layer with a surface, blend mode, opacity, effects, and preview image.

remarks.para: RasterLayer is the primary drawable layer type in PixlPunkt. It contains: - A for pixel data - Blend mode and opacity for compositing - A collection of effects applied during rendering - An auto-updating preview bitmap for UI display - A for tile-based editing (optional)
All registered effects are pre-added to the collection at construction with set to false, allowing UI to toggle them on/off.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with specified dimensions and name.
member.param: The width in pixels. Must be positive.
The height in pixels. Must be positive.

remarks.para: Creates a transparent pixel surface and initializes all available effects in disabled state. The preview bitmap is created and initially rendered. The layer subscribes to surface pixel changes to automatically update the preview.
Effects are dynamically populated from , allowing both built-in and plugin effects to be available on new layers.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer.SuppressLivePreviewUpdates
member.summary: When true, suppresses automatic preview updates during pixel changes. Used on Uno Skia platforms to defer preview updates until stroke completion.

remarks.para: On Uno Skia platforms (Desktop, Desktop WSL), WriteableBitmap updates during live painting can be expensive and may not render correctly. Setting this to true during active painting defers preview updates until is explicitly called (e.g., on stroke commit).
This is a static property because it applies to all layers during a painting operation. Set to true when painting begins, false when stroke is committed.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer.OnEffectRegistered(PixlPunkt.PluginSdk.Effects.IEffectRegistration)
member.summary: Called when a new effect is registered (e.g., plugin loaded). Adds the effect to this layer if not already present.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer.OnEffectUnregistered(System.String)
member.summary: Called when an effect is unregistered (e.g., plugin unloaded). Removes the effect from this layer if present and disabled.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer.SyncEffectsFromRegistry
member.summary: Synchronizes the effects collection with the current registry state.

remarks.para: This method ensures the layer has all registered effects from the registry. It's called at construction and can be called manually to refresh effects after bulk plugin operations.
Effects that are already in the collection (by ID) are not duplicated. New effects are added in disabled state.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer.Surface
member.summary: Gets the pixel surface containing the layer's drawable content.
member.value: A in BGRA format matching the layer dimensions.
member.remarks: This is the surface that drawing tools write to and that gets composited with other layers.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the layer opacity (0 = fully transparent, 255 = fully opaque).
member.value: A value from 0 to 255. Default is 255.
member.remarks: Fires when set to a different value. This opacity is applied as a global multiplier during layer compositing.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer.Blend
member.summary: Gets or sets the blend mode used when compositing this layer with layers below.
member.value: A value. Default is .
member.remarks: Fires when set to a different value. Blend modes determine how this layer's colors mix with the layers beneath it (e.g., Multiply, Screen, Overlay, Additive).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer.CanHaveChildren
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this layer type can contain child layers.
member.value: Always false for . Only can have children.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer.Effects
member.summary: Gets the collection of layer effects applied during compositing.
member.value: An observable collection of instances.

remarks.para: Effects in this collection are applied in order during compositing if their property is true.
All registered effects (built-in and plugin) are pre-added at construction in disabled state. UI can toggle effects on/off and configure their settings.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer.TileMapping
member.summary: Gets or sets the tile mapping for this layer.
member.value: A instance, or null if no tile mapping is associated.

remarks.para: The tile mapping stores which tile is placed at each grid position for this layer. Each layer can have independent tile mappings, allowing different tile arrangements.
The mapping is created lazily when first accessed via .

member.summary: Gets the tile mapping for this layer, creating it if necessary.

Number of tile rows (required if creating new mapping).
member.returns: The tile mapping for this layer.

member.summary: Checks if this layer has any tile mappings.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer.UpdatePreview
member.summary: Rebuilds the preview bitmap from the current surface pixels.

remarks.para: This method copies pixel data from to the preview bitmap. It's automatically called when surface pixels change via .
The preview shows raw BGRA pixel data with alpha preserved, allowing the UI to composite it over a transparency pattern background.
Includes reentrancy protection to prevent recursive updates. On Uno Skia platforms, a new WriteableBitmap is created each time to force UI invalidation.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer.NotifyPreviewChanged
member.summary: Manually triggers a notification for the property.
member.remarks: Use this when the preview bitmap content has been updated externally (e.g., effects applied) and the UI needs to refresh without a full regeneration.

member.summary: Replaces the layer's surface with new dimensions and pixel data.
member.param: The new pixel surface with resized dimensions and data.

remarks.para: This method is used during canvas resize operations. The existing object is resized in place using , preserving the object reference while updating its internal data.
After calling this method, call to regenerate the preview bitmap.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.ReferenceLayer
member.summary: Represents a reference image layer for tracing and artistic reference.

remarks.para: Reference layers display external images on the canvas to help artists trace, match colors, or maintain proportions while creating pixel art. They differ from in several key ways:

list.item: Reference layers are NOT included in exports (image, animation, etc.)
Reference layers render using smooth interpolation, not pixel-snapped
Reference layers can extend beyond canvas boundaries
Reference layers have transform properties (position, scale, rotation)
Reference layers cannot be painted on

remarks.para: Reference layers participate in the layer stack ordering, allowing them to be positioned above or below other layers as needed.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Effects.Builders.EffectBuilderExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for providing fluent effect builder access.

remarks.para: These extension methods provide the entry points to the fluent builder API, making effect registration more readable and less error-prone than direct constructor calls.

para.code: registry.Register(new BuiltInEffectRegistration( EffectIds.DropShadow, EffectCategory.Stylize, "Drop Shadow", "Adds a shadow beneath the layer...", () => new DropShadowEffect(), effect => effect is DropShadowEffect e ? new DropShadowEffectSettings(e) : null ));

registry.AddEffect(EffectIds.DropShadow) .WithCategory(EffectCategory.Stylize) .WithDisplayName("Drop Shadow") .WithDescription("Adds a shadow beneath the layer...") .WithFactory(() => new DropShadowEffect()) .WithSettings(e => e is DropShadowEffect ds ? new DropShadowEffectSettings(ds) : null) .Register();

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Effects.BuiltInEffects
member.summary: Static class for registering all built-in layer effects at application startup.

remarks.para: This class serves as the entry point for initializing the effect system. Call during application initialization (typically in App.OnLaunched) to populate the with all built-in effects.

item.description: Drop Shadow, Outline, Glow/Bloom, Chromatic Aberration
Scan Lines, Grain, Vignette, CRT, Pixelate

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Effects.BuiltInEffects.RegisterAll
member.summary: Registers all built-in effects with the shared registry.

remarks.para: This method is idempotent - calling it multiple times has no additional effect. The first call registers all 12 built-in effects and raises the event.
Effects are registered in category order: Stylize, then Filter, then Color. Uses the fluent API for consistent registration pattern.

These IDs are used to:

list.item: Register effects with
Look up effect registrations by ID
Associate effect instances with their registration metadata

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Effects.Settings.AsciiEffectSettings
member.summary: Settings provider for .

remarks.para: Generates UI options for configuring ASCII art conversion parameters:

list.item: Glyph Set - Character set used for brightness mapping (Basic, Extended, Block, etc.)
Cell Width/Height - Size of each character cell in pixels
Selection Mode - How glyphs are chosen (Luminance Ramp vs Pattern Match)
Binarize Mode - How cells are binarized for pattern matching
Foreground/Background - Color modes for glyph rendering
Contrast - Brightness mapping curve (1.0 = linear)
Invert - Reverse brightness mapping (dark areas use bright characters)
Apply on Transparent - Include transparent pixels in calculations

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Effects.Settings.EffectSettingsBase
member.summary: Base class for effect-specific settings that provides option discovery for dynamic UI generation.

remarks.para: Effect settings classes define the configurable parameters for layer effects. Each effect type has a corresponding settings class that exposes its parameters through the method for dynamic UI generation.

Unlike tool settings (which use a separate settings object), effect settings are typically bound directly to the effect instance. The settings class holds a reference to the effect and its method returns descriptors that read from and write to the effect's properties.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Effects.Settings.EffectSettingsBase.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets the display name for this effect shown in UI.
member.value: A human-readable name for the effect (e.g., "Drop Shadow", "Color Adjust").

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Effects.Settings.EffectSettingsBase.Description
member.summary: Gets a brief description of what this effect does.
member.value: A short description for tooltips or help text. Default is an empty string if not overridden.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Effects.Settings.EffectSettingsBase.GetOptions
member.summary: Returns the list of options to display in the settings panel for this effect.
member.returns: An enumerable of descriptors that the UI uses to generate controls (sliders, checkboxes, color pickers, etc.) for configuring the effect's parameters.

remarks.para: Options are typically created with callbacks that directly modify the effect's properties. The property determines the display order in the UI.
Common option types include:

list.item: - Numeric values with min/max range
- Boolean on/off settings
- Color picker with swatch
- Selection from a list
- Color palette editor
