member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.AppCursorKind
member.summary: Defines the types of custom cursors used in the application.
member.remarks: This enum specifies the visual cursor types that can be displayed during different tool operations. Additional cursor types are commented out for future expansion (movement, rotation, panning, etc.).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.AppCursorKind.Arrow
member.summary: Standard arrow pointer cursor.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.AppCursorKind.Crosshair
member.summary: Crosshair cursor for precise pixel selection and drawing.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.BlendMode
member.summary: Defines the blending modes used for layer compositing and painting operations.

remarks.para: Blend modes control how pixels from one layer combine with pixels from layers below. Each mode uses a different mathematical formula to compute the final color value.
These blend modes are commonly used in digital art applications and follow standard compositing formulas for predictable results across different tools.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.BlendMode.Normal
member.summary: Standard alpha blending with no color modification.
member.remarks: Formula: Result = Source * Alpha + Destination * (1 - Alpha)

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.BlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the source and destination colors, producing a darker result.
member.remarks: Formula: Result = Source * Destination

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.BlendMode.Add
member.summary: Adds the source and destination colors together, producing a brighter result.
member.remarks: Formula: Result = Source + Destination (clamped to maximum)

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.BlendMode.Difference
member.summary: Computes the absolute difference between source and destination colors.
member.remarks: Formula: Result = |Source - Destination|

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.BlendMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects the darker of the source and destination colors for each channel.
member.remarks: Formula: Result = min(Source, Destination)

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.BlendMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the source and destination colors for each channel.
member.remarks: Formula: Result = max(Source, Destination)

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.BlendMode.HardLight
member.summary: Combines Multiply and Screen blend modes based on the destination color.
member.remarks: Multiplies or screens colors depending on whether the destination is darker or lighter than 50% gray.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.BlendMode.Invert
member.summary: Inverts the destination color based on the source color.
member.remarks: Formula: Result = 1 - Destination (or similar inversion formula)

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.BlendMode.Overlay
member.summary: Combines Multiply and Screen blend modes based on the source color.
member.remarks: Similar to HardLight but uses the source color to determine the blend method.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.BlendMode.Screen
member.summary: Inverts both colors, multiplies them, then inverts again, producing a lighter result.
member.remarks: Formula: Result = 1 - (1 - Source) * (1 - Destination)

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.BlendMode.Subtract
member.summary: Subtracts the source color from the destination, producing a darker result.
member.remarks: Formula: Result = Destination - Source (clamped to minimum)

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.Grab
member.summary: Defines the grab handle positions for bezier curve or gradient control points.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.ImageFileFormat
member.summary: Defines the supported image file formats for import and export operations.
member.remarks: These formats are used when saving or loading images to/from disk. Each format has different characteristics regarding compression, transparency, and metadata support.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.ImageFileFormat.Png
member.summary: Portable Network Graphics format with lossless compression and full alpha transparency.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.ImageFileFormat.Jpeg
member.summary: JPEG format with lossy compression, typically used for photographs without transparency.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.ImageFileFormat.Bmp
member.summary: Bitmap format with minimal or no compression, supporting various bit depths.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.ImageFileFormat.Tiff
member.summary: Tagged Image File Format supporting multiple compression schemes and metadata.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.ImageFileFormat.Cur
member.summary: Windows cursor file format containing one or more images with hotspot information.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.PaletteSortMode
member.summary: Defines the sorting mode for palette colors.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.PaletteSortMode.Default
member.summary: Keep colors in their original order (as defined in the palette file or as added).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.PaletteSortMode.Hue
member.summary: Sort colors by hue (0-360 degrees on the color wheel). Groups colors by their base color family (reds, oranges, yellows, greens, etc.).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.PaletteSortMode.Saturation
member.summary: Sort colors by saturation (0-100%). Orders from grayscale/muted colors to vivid/pure colors.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.PaletteSortMode.Lightness
member.summary: Sort colors by lightness/brightness (0-100%). Orders from dark to light.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.PaletteSortMode.Luminance
member.summary: Sort colors by luminance (perceived brightness using WCAG formula). Orders from dark to light based on human perception.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.PaletteSortMode.Red
member.summary: Sort colors by red channel value (0-255).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.PaletteSortMode.Green
member.summary: Sort colors by green channel value (0-255).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.PaletteSortMode.Blue
member.summary: Sort colors by blue channel value (0-255).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.PaletteSortMode.Reverse
member.summary: Reverse the current palette order.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.RotationMode
member.summary: Defines the interpolation algorithms used for rotating pixel art.

remarks.para: Rotation modes control how pixels are sampled and interpolated when rotating images. Different algorithms produce varying results in terms of sharpness, smoothness, and preservation of pixel art aesthetics.
These modes are implemented in rotation methods.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.RotationMode.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: Uses the closest pixel without interpolation, preserving hard edges but producing jagged results.
member.remarks: Best for precise 90-degree rotations or when maintaining exact pixel values is critical.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.RotationMode.RotSprite
member.summary: Uses a specialized algorithm that upsamples, rotates with bilinear interpolation, and downsamples to preserve pixel art characteristics while reducing jagged edges.
member.remarks: Inspired by RotSprite algorithm, this mode provides smoother rotation while maintaining the crisp aesthetic of pixel art. Best for arbitrary angle rotations of low-resolution artwork.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.ScaleMode
member.summary: Defines the interpolation algorithms used for scaling pixel art.

remarks.para: Scale modes control how pixels are sampled and interpolated when resizing images. Different algorithms are optimized for different types of content and scaling factors.
These modes are implemented in scaling methods.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.ScaleMode.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: Uses the closest pixel without interpolation, preserving hard edges and exact colors.
member.remarks: Best for integer scaling factors (2x, 3x, 4x) where pixel art should remain crisp. Produces blocky results for non-integer scaling.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.ScaleMode.EPX
member.summary: Eric's Pixel Expansion algorithm for 2x upscaling, preserving pixel art edges and details.
member.remarks: Analyzes neighboring pixels to intelligently scale pixel art while maintaining sharp edges and reducing blocky appearance. Only works for 2x upscaling.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.ScaleMode.Bilinear
member.summary: Weighted average of surrounding pixels for smooth gradients and photographs.
member.remarks: Produces smooth results but may blur pixel art or sharp edges. Best for photographic content or smooth gradients at arbitrary scaling factors.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.ScaleMode.Scale2x
member.summary: Advanced 2x pixel art upscaling algorithm that preserves edges better than EPX.
member.remarks: Analyzes more neighbors than EPX to produce cleaner edges and better diagonal line interpolation. Only works for 2x upscaling.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.SymmetryMode
member.summary: Defines the symmetry drawing mode for stroke mirroring.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.SymmetryMode.None
member.summary: No symmetry - strokes are not mirrored.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.SymmetryMode.Horizontal
member.summary: Horizontal axis symmetry - strokes are mirrored across a vertical line. Creates left/right mirroring.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.SymmetryMode.Vertical
member.summary: Vertical axis symmetry - strokes are mirrored across a horizontal line. Creates top/bottom mirroring.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.SymmetryMode.Both
member.summary: Both horizontal and vertical symmetry - strokes are mirrored across both axes. Creates four-way mirroring (quadrants).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.SymmetryMode.Radial
member.summary: Radial symmetry - strokes are rotated around a center point. Number of segments is controlled by RadialSegments setting.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.SymmetryMode.Kaleidoscope
member.summary: Kaleidoscope symmetry - radial with mirroring within each segment. Creates kaleidoscope-like patterns.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.SymmetryModeExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for .

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.SymmetryModeExtensions.IsRadial(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.SymmetryMode)
member.summary: Gets whether the mode is a radial (mandala) symmetry mode.
member.returns: True if the mode is radial.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.SymmetryModeExtensions.GetDisplayName(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.SymmetryMode)
member.summary: Gets a human-readable display name for the symmetry mode.
member.returns: The display name.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.WindowPlacement
member.summary: Defines the placement strategies for positioning child windows relative to their parent window.

remarks.para: Window placement controls how dialogs, color pickers, and other floating windows are initially positioned when shown. This provides consistent UX for different window types.
Used by window management code to calculate initial window coordinates based on parent window location, display work area, or specific anchor elements.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.WindowPlacement.CenterOnParent
member.summary: Centers the window over its parent window.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.WindowPlacement.NearAnchor
member.summary: Positions the window near a specific anchor element with a +16,+16 pixel offset.
member.remarks: Useful for context menus or tooltips that should appear near the UI element that triggered them.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.WindowPlacement.CenterTop
member.summary: Centers the window horizontally at the top of the parent window.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.WindowPlacement.CenterBottom
member.summary: Centers the window horizontally at the bottom of the parent window.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.WindowPlacement.CenterOnScreen
member.summary: Centers the window on the current display's work area, independent of parent window location.
member.remarks: Falls back to centering on the primary display if no specific display can be determined.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Export.TimelapseExportService
member.summary: Provides timelapse export functionality by rendering history states as animation frames.

remarks.para: TimelapseExportService works with the history memory management system to support full timelapse export even when history items have been offloaded to disk.
When history items are offloaded, they are automatically reloaded during JumpTo operations, ensuring seamless timelapse rendering regardless of memory constraints.

member.summary: Provides image export functionality for saving data to various file formats.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.FIleOps.ImageExport.Save(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface,System.String,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.ImageFileFormat,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Saves a pixel surface to a file in the specified image format.
member.param: Target file path. Directory is created if it doesn't exist.
Cursor hotspot X coordinate (only used for ). Default is 0 (left edge).
Cursor hotspot Y coordinate (only used for ). Default is 0 (top edge).
member.exception: Thrown if format is not recognized.
member.remarks: Automatically creates parent directories if they don't exist. For JPEG exports, alpha is flattened over white background. For cursor exports, hotspot coordinates define the click point.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.FIleOps.ImageExport.SaveWithGdi(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface,System.String,System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat)
member.summary: Saves a surface to a file using GDI+ .
member.param: GDI+ image format (Png, Bmp, Tiff, etc.).

remarks.para: Uses unsafe memory copy to directly transfer BGRA pixels from to locked bits. Handles stride differences between source (always width 4) and destination (may have padding for DWORD alignment).
PixelSurface uses BGRA byte order which matches Format32bppArgb in memory on little-endian systems, enabling efficient direct copy without per-pixel conversion.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.FIleOps.ImageExport.SaveJpegFlattenWhite(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface,System.String)
member.summary: Saves a surface as JPEG with alpha channel flattened over white background.

remarks.para:
For each pixel, computes: result = color alpha + white (1 - alpha)
This prevents dark halos around semi-transparent edges that would appear if alpha were simply discarded. The result is a solid opaque image (alpha=255) with color values pre-composited against white.

Uses quality setting of 95 (scale 0-100) for high-quality output with minimal compression artifacts. This balances file size with visual fidelity suitable for pixel art where compression artifacts are especially visible.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.FIleOps.ImageExport.GetEncoder(System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat)
member.summary: Gets the image encoder for a specific format.
member.returns: Matching or null if not found.
member.remarks: Used to access encoder-specific parameters like JPEG quality settings.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.FIleOps.ImageExport.SaveAsCursor(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface,System.String,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Saves a surface as a Windows cursor (.cur) file with embedded hotspot coordinates.
member.param: Horizontal hotspot position in pixels from left edge.
Vertical hotspot position in pixels from top edge.

remarks.code:
ICONDIR (6 bytes): WORD reserved (0) WORD type (2 = cursor) WORD count (1 = single image)
CURSORDIRENTRY (16 bytes): BYTE width (0 = 256) BYTE height (0 = 256) BYTE colorCount (0 for 32bpp) BYTE reserved (0) WORD hotspotX WORD hotspotY DWORD bytesInRes (DIB size) DWORD imageOffset (22 = header + entry)
DIB (Device Independent Bitmap): BITMAPINFOHEADER (40 bytes) with biHeight = height 2 Pixel data: bottom-up BGRA (width height 4 bytes) AND mask: 1bpp, all zeros (width_aligned height bits)
remarks.para: The hotspot defines the precise pixel that represents the cursor's "click point". For example, an arrow cursor might have hotspot at (0,0) for top-left tip, while a crosshair would use (width/2, height/2) for center point.
Uses 32bpp BGRA format with alpha channel for modern Windows cursor support. The AND mask is all zeros since alpha provides transparency. Bottom-up DIB orientation matches Windows bitmap conventions.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Helpers.CursorImportHelper.LoadCursorBitmap(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a cursor file as a Bitmap with proper alpha channel handling.
member.returns: A Bitmap containing the largest cursor image with proper alpha.
member.remarks: System.Drawing.Icon.ToBitmap() doesn't properly handle cursor alpha channels, often resulting in all-black images. This method manually extracts the DIB/PNG image data from the CUR file and loads it directly.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Helpers.CursorImportHelper.LoadDibBitmap(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Parses a DIB (Device Independent Bitmap) from cursor image data.
member.returns: A Bitmap with proper alpha channel.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Helpers.CursorImportHelper.ConvertCursorToTempIcon(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a CUR file to a temporary ICO file for compatibility with System.Drawing.Icon.
member.returns: Path to a temporary ICO file that should be deleted after use.
member.remarks: Note: This method is deprecated in favor of LoadCursorBitmap which properly handles alpha channels. CUR files use the same format as ICO files (type=2 vs type=1). This creates a temporary ICO copy with the type byte changed. The caller is responsible for deleting the temporary file.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.CanvasResizeItem
member.summary: History item for canvas resize operations, storing complete layer snapshots to enable full undo/redo of dimension changes.

remarks.para: Canvas resize is a destructive operation that changes document dimensions and may crop or pad all layer content. This item captures the complete state (dimensions + all layer pixels) before and after the resize.
While this uses more memory than delta-based history, resize operations are relatively rare and the simplicity of full snapshots ensures correctness.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.HistoryMemoryManager
member.summary: Manages memory usage for the history stack with automatic offloading.

remarks.para: wraps a and monitors memory usage. When usage exceeds the configured limit, it offloads older history items to disk while preserving their metadata for the timeline UI.
Key behaviors:

list.item: Tracks estimated memory of all disposable history items
Offloads oldest items first when memory limit exceeded
Automatically reloads items when needed for undo/redo
Preserves full timeline for timelapse export

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.HistoryOffloadService
member.summary: Service that manages offloading history item data to disk for memory conservation.

remarks.para: provides persistent storage for history item data when memory limits are exceeded. This allows:

list.item: Unlimited undo history without unbounded memory growth
Full timelapse export even with memory-constrained history
Automatic cleanup when documents are closed

remarks.para: Data is stored in a temporary folder specific to each document session. Files are named by GUID and automatically cleaned up on disposal.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.HistoryOffloadService.TotalOffloadedBytes
member.summary: Gets the total size of offloaded data in bytes.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.HistoryOffloadService.OffloadedItemCount
member.summary: Gets the number of offloaded items.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.HistoryOffloadService.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new history offload service.
member.param: Unique identifier for the document (used for folder naming).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.HistoryOffloadService.ClearAll
member.summary: Clears all offloaded data and removes the directory.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.IDisposableHistoryItem
member.summary: Extended history item interface for items that can release memory resources.

remarks.para: extends with memory management capabilities. History items that hold significant memory (pixel data, byte arrays) should implement this interface to participate in the memory-constrained history system.
Key features:

list.item: : Reports approximate memory usage for tracking
: Indicates if data has been offloaded to disk
: Serializes heavy data to disk and releases memory
: Restores data from disk when needed for undo/redo

remarks.para: The history memory manager uses these methods to keep memory usage within configured limits while preserving the full history timeline for timelapse export.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.IDisposableHistoryItem.EstimatedMemoryBytes
member.summary: Gets the estimated memory usage of this history item in bytes.

remarks.para: This should be a reasonable approximation including: - Byte arrays (pixel data, snapshots) - Lists of indices and values - Any other significant allocations
For , this includes: - _indices list: Count * sizeof(int) - _before list: Count * sizeof(uint) - _after list: Count * sizeof(uint) - Object overhead (~40 bytes)

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.IDisposableHistoryItem.IsOffloaded
member.summary: Gets whether this item's heavy data has been offloaded to disk.
member.remarks: When true, must be called before or can execute properly.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.IDisposableHistoryItem.OffloadId
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for this history item's offloaded data.
member.remarks: This ID is used by the to locate the serialized data on disk. Only valid when is true.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.IDisposableHistoryItem.Offload(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.IHistoryOffloadService)
member.summary: Offloads heavy data to disk, releasing memory.
member.param: The service to write data to.
member.returns: True if offload succeeded; false if item cannot be offloaded.

remarks.para: After calling this method: - should return true - should return a reduced value - Internal byte arrays/lists should be cleared or set to null
Some items may not support offloading (e.g., those with references to live objects). In such cases, return false.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.IDisposableHistoryItem.Reload(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.IHistoryOffloadService)
member.summary: Reloads previously offloaded data from disk.
member.param: The service to read data from.
member.returns: True if reload succeeded.
member.remarks: After calling this method: - should return false - The item should be fully functional for undo/redo operations

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.IHistoryItem
member.summary: Base interface for all history items in the unified history stack.

remarks.para: IHistoryItem provides a polymorphic way to handle different types of undoable operations in a single history stack. This includes both pixel-level changes (painting, fills) and structural changes (canvas resize, layer operations).
Each implementation must capture enough state to fully undo and redo the operation. The property enables UI features like "Undo: Resize Canvas".

member.summary: Gets a human-readable description of the operation (for UI display).

member.summary: Undoes the operation, restoring the previous state.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.IHistoryItem.Redo
member.summary: Redoes the operation, re-applying the change.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.IRenderResult
member.summary: Marker interface for results returned from tool rendering operations.

remarks.para: provides a common abstraction for all tool operation outputs, enabling plugin extensibility while maintaining type safety. Built-in implementations:

list.item: : Tracks individual pixel changes with delta compression

remarks.para: Plugin authors can implement custom result types for specialized operations (e.g., vector path results, procedural generation metadata).
Results that should participate in undo/redo must also implement . The property indicates whether this result should be recorded.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.PixelChangeItem
member.summary: History item for pixel-level changes on a single layer.

remarks.para: PixelChangeItem tracks individual pixel changes using delta compression - only pixels that actually changed are stored, making it memory-efficient for localized edits.
Each item stores the layer reference, byte indices, and before/after values for all modified pixels.
Implements both for undo/redo support and for unified tool result handling.
Implements to support memory management: old history items can be offloaded to disk and reloaded when needed.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.PixelChangeItem.EstimatedMemoryBytes
member.summary: Gets the estimated memory usage in bytes.
member.remarks: Calculation: Each change stores an int index (4 bytes) + uint before (4 bytes) + uint after (4 bytes) = 12 bytes per change. Plus List overhead and object overhead.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.SelectionCommitItem
member.summary: History item for committing a floating selection to the canvas.

remarks.para: This item captures both the pixel changes (for canvas restoration) and the floating selection state (for restoring the selection with marquee on undo).
On Undo: Restores the canvas pixels AND restores the floating selection state. On Redo: Commits the selection again (applies pixel changes, clears floating state).

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.SelectionCommitItem.FloatingSnapshot
member.summary: Snapshot of the floating selection state before commit.
Creates a new selection commit history item.
member.param: The bounds of the pixel region affected.
The floating selection state before commit.
The selection region after commit (may be empty).
Callback to restore floating selection state.
Callback to clear floating selection state.
Callback to apply pixel data to layer.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.SelectionTransformItem
member.summary: History item that captures a selection transform operation (move, scale, or rotate).

remarks.para: SelectionTransformItem allows undo/redo of individual transform operations on floating selections without committing the selection back to the layer. This enables granular undo for: - Move operations (translation changes) - Scale operations (scale factor changes) - Rotate operations (rotation angle changes)

For scale and rotate operations, the buffer state is also captured because these operations "bake" the transform into the buffer on release. Without capturing the buffer, undo would apply the old transform parameters to the already-transformed buffer.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.TileEditHistoryItem
member.summary: History item for direct tile pixel edits (e.g., from the Tile Tessellation window).

remarks.para: TileEditHistoryItem tracks before/after pixel states for a single tile definition. Unlike TileStampHistoryItem which handles tile placement on the canvas, this handles edits to the tile definition itself.
On undo/redo, this updates the TileSet which fires TileUpdated events, causing any UI bound to the tile (TilePanel, main canvas mapped tiles) to refresh.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.TileMappedPixelChangeItem
member.summary: History item for pixel changes that affect tile-mapped regions. Tracks changes to both the canvas and the tile definition, and properly undoes/redoes across all instances of a mapped tile.

remarks.para: When painting on a mapped tile: 1. The original stroke changes the layer pixels at one location 2. These changes are extracted and applied to the tile definition 3. The tile definition change propagates to all other mapped instances
This history item tracks: - The original pixel changes (from the user's stroke) for non-tile areas - The tile definition before/after states - All tile positions that need to be updated on undo/redo

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.UnifiedHistoryStack
member.summary: Unified history stack managing all undoable operations for a document.

remarks.para: UnifiedHistoryStack provides a single point of truth for all history operations, handling both pixel-level changes () and structural changes () through the interface.

Benefits of unified history: - Single undo/redo stack with correct ordering across all operation types - Simpler serialization if history needs to be saved - Clear UI state (CanUndo/CanRedo) without checking multiple stacks - Descriptions available for "Undo: X" menu items - Dirty tracking via for unsaved changes detection
Memory management is provided via which can automatically offload old history items to disk when memory limits are exceeded.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.UnifiedHistoryStack._savedUndoCount
member.summary: Tracks the undo stack count at the last save point. -1 indicates the document has never been saved (always dirty if any changes exist).

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether undo is available.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether redo is available.

member.summary: Gets the description of the next action to undo, or null if none available.

member.summary: Gets the description of the next action to redo, or null if none available.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.UnifiedHistoryStack.UndoCount
member.summary: Gets the number of items in the undo stack.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.UnifiedHistoryStack.RedoCount
member.summary: Gets the number of items in the redo stack.

member.summary: Gets the current estimated memory usage of history in bytes.

member.summary: Gets the total bytes offloaded to disk.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.UnifiedHistoryStack.IsDirty
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the document has unsaved changes.
member.remarks: The document is considered dirty if the current undo stack count differs from the count at the last save point. This correctly handles undo/redo operations that might return the document to a saved state.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelOps
member.summary: Provides low-level pixel buffer operations including rotation, scaling, upsampling, and compositing.

remarks.para: PixelOps contains performance-critical image transformation algorithms used for selection transforms, layer effects, and export operations. All methods operate on raw pixel buffers (byte[] or uint[]) in BGRA format for maximum efficiency.

Key Functionality: - **Rotation**: Nearest-neighbor and bilinear rotation with automatic bounds expansion - **Scaling**: Nearest-neighbor, bilinear, EPX (edge-preserving), Scale2x pixel art scaling - **Hybrid Scaling**: Multi-stage upsampling (EPX rotate downsample) for pixel-art rotation - **Blitting**: Fast buffer-to-buffer copying with clipping - **Utility**: Rectangle extraction, clearing, similarity testing
Color Format: All methods use BGRA byte order unless otherwise specified: - byte[]: [B, G, R, A, B, G, R, A, ...] (4 bytes per pixel) - uint[]: packed BGRA as 32-bit integers

Performance Notes: - Nearest-neighbor methods are fastest for real-time preview - Bilinear methods produce smoother results for high-quality output - EPX/Scale2x are specialized for pixel art (preserve hard edges while interpolating)

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelOps.ResizeNearest(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Resizes an image using nearest-neighbor sampling.
member.returns: Resized buffer as byte array.
member.remarks: Fast integer-based scaling that preserves hard edges (no antialiasing). Ideal for pixel art and when crisp edges are desired.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelOps.ResizeBilinear(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Resizes an image using bilinear interpolation for smooth scaling.
member.returns: Resized buffer as byte array.
member.remarks: Produces anti-aliased results. Recommended for downscaling and general-purpose resizing.

member.returns: true if pixels are similar; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface
member.summary: Represents a 2D array of BGRA (Blue, Green, Red, Alpha) pixels stored as a contiguous byte array.

remarks.para: PixelSurface provides the foundational pixel buffer for all image data in PixlPunkt. Each pixel is represented by 4 consecutive bytes in BGRA order (0xAABBGGRR when interpreted as uint32).
Memory layout: [B, G, R, A, B, G, R, A, ...] Index for pixel (x,y): (y * Width + x) * 4
This class prioritizes performance with bounds checking and provides an event for notifying subscribers of pixel changes (useful for triggering UI updates).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface.Width
member.summary: Gets the width of the surface in pixels.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface.Height
member.summary: Gets the height of the surface in pixels.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface.Pixels
member.summary: Gets the raw pixel data in BGRA format.
member.value: A byte array of length (Width * Height * 4) containing pixel data in row-major order with BGRA byte ordering.

member.name: E:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface.PixelsChanged
member.summary: Occurs after any pixel mutation operation ( or ).

remarks.para: This event is raised after every pixel write operation, which can be high-frequency. Subscribers should consider throttling or batching updates if performance is a concern.
For batch operations, consider temporarily unsubscribing and resubscribing after completion.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified dimensions.
member.param: The width in pixels. Must be greater than 0.
The height in pixels. Must be greater than 0.
member.exception: Thrown when or is less than or equal to 0.
member.remarks: The pixel array is allocated but not initialized, so it contains undefined data until explicitly set via or .

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface.IndexOf(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the byte index in the array for a given coordinate.
member.returns: The starting byte index for the pixel at (x, y).
member.remarks: This method does not perform bounds checking. Use only when coordinates are known to be valid. Formula: (y * Width + x) * 4

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface.Clear(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Fills the entire surface with a single BGRA color.
member.remarks: This method efficiently fills all pixels with the specified color using optimized bulk memory operations and raises the event once after completion.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface.ReadBGRA(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the BGRA color at the specified coordinates.
member.returns: The BGRA color as a 32-bit unsigned integer (0xAABBGGRR), or 0 (transparent black) if the coordinates are out of bounds.
member.remarks: This method performs bounds checking. Out-of-bounds reads return 0 without throwing an exception.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface.WriteBGRA(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Writes a BGRA color to the specified coordinates.

remarks.para: This method performs bounds checking. Out-of-bounds writes are silently ignored (no-op).
The event is raised after each write. For bulk operations, consider working directly with the array and manually raising the event.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface.Resize(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Resizes the surface to new dimensions, optionally replacing pixel data.
member.param: The new pixel data array, or null to allocate a cleared buffer.
member.remarks: This method replaces the internal pixel buffer entirely. If newPixels is provided, it must have the correct size for the new dimensions. If null, a new zeroed buffer is allocated. Use this for canvas resize operations.
member.exception: Thrown if dimensions are invalid.
Thrown if pixel array size doesn't match dimensions (when provided).

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.BrushMaskCache
member.summary: Caches precomputed brush footprint pixel offsets for different brush shapes and sizes.

remarks.para: BrushMaskCache optimizes brush rendering by precomputing which pixels fall within a brush's footprint for each (shape, size) combination. Once computed, offset lists are cached to avoid redundant calculations during continuous painting strokes.

list.item: : Simple grid covering sizesize pixels.
: Uses supersampling for smooth circular edges.
: Scales a 16x16 mask from .

remarks.para:
Custom brushes use a single 16x16 master mask that is scaled to the requested size:
Size 1-16: Scale down using nearest-neighbor
Size 17-128: Scale up using nearest-neighbor

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.BrushMaskCache.SS
member.summary: Supersampling resolution per pixel dimension (88 = 64 samples per pixel).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.BrushMaskCache.COVER
member.summary: Coverage threshold for pixel inclusion (0.6 = 60% of subpixels must be inside circle).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.BrushMaskCache.MaskSize
member.summary: The standard mask size for custom brushes (16x16).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.BrushMaskCache.Shared
member.summary: Shared singleton instance used by both main canvas and preview to ensure identical masks.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.BrushMaskCache._cache
member.summary: Cache dictionary mapping (shape, size) tuples to precomputed offset lists.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.BrushMaskCache._customCache
member.summary: Cache dictionary for custom brush offsets, keyed by (brushFullName, requestedSize).

member.summary: Gets the pixel offset list for a brush with the specified shape and size.

member.param: The custom brush template containing the 16x16 mask.
member.returns: A read-only list of (dx, dy) offsets relative to brush center. Cached after first computation.

member.summary: Clears all cached custom brush offsets.

member.summary: Clears cached offsets for a specific custom brush.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.BrushStrokeShapeRenderer
member.summary: Default shape renderer that applies brush-stroked rendering to shape points.

remarks.para: This renderer stamps the current brush shape at each point in the shape geometry, with proper alpha blending and density-based falloff. It supports:

list.item: Circular and square brush shapes
Variable stroke width
Opacity and density-based soft edges
Maximum alpha accumulation (prevents over-blending)
Optimized fast-path for filled shapes

remarks.para: The renderer is stateless and can be shared across multiple render calls.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.BrushStrokeShapeRenderer.Shared
member.summary: Shared singleton instance for common usage.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.BrushStrokeShapeRenderer.RenderFilled(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.ValueTuple{System.Int32,System.Int32}},PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.ShapeRenderContext)
member.summary: Optimized rendering for filled shapes.

remarks.para: For filled shapes: - ALL pixels inside the shape get solid color with opacity (no density falloff inside) - Density-based soft falloff only extends OUTWARD from the shape boundary

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.BrushStrokeShapeRenderer.RenderOutline(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.ValueTuple{System.Int32,System.Int32}},PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.ShapeRenderContext)
member.summary: Standard brush-stroke rendering for outlined shapes.

member.summary: Computes per-pixel alpha using density-based falloff.

member.summary: Computes distance metric for brush shape (circle: Euclidean, square: Chebyshev).

member.summary: Computes per-pixel alpha for custom brushes using radial density-based falloff.
member.remarks: Custom brushes use circular distance from center for density falloff, similar to how Circle brushes work. This provides consistent soft/hard edge control across all brush types.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.DefaultToolContextProvider.ComputePerPixelAlpha(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,PixlPunkt.PluginSdk.Imaging.BrushShape,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Computes per-pixel alpha using density-based falloff.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.DefaultToolContextProvider.DistanceForShape(System.Int32,System.Int32,PixlPunkt.PluginSdk.Imaging.BrushShape)
member.summary: Computes distance metric for a brush shape (circle: Euclidean, square: Chebyshev).
member.remarks: Distance is calculated from the offset (dx, dy) to the brush center. Since offsets are computed relative to the brush center, the distance is simply the magnitude of the offset vector.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Dithering.DitherPatterns
member.summary: Provides dithering patterns and algorithms for gradient rendering.

remarks.para: Dithering creates the illusion of more colors by using patterns of available colors. This is essential for pixel art where limited palettes require smooth transitions.

Supported algorithms: - Ordered dithering (Bayer matrices): Creates regular patterns, good for retro aesthetics - Pattern-based: Checker, diagonal, crosshatch for stylized looks - Error diffusion (Floyd-Steinberg, Atkinson): Distributes quantization error for smoother results - Blue noise: Random but visually pleasing distribution

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Dithering.DitherPatterns.Bayer2x2
member.summary: Bayer 2x2 ordered dither matrix (normalized to 0-1).

member.summary: Bayer 4x4 ordered dither matrix (normalized to 0-1).

member.summary: Bayer 8x8 ordered dither matrix (normalized to 0-1).

member.summary: Pre-computed blue noise pattern (16x16, normalized to 0-1). Blue noise has a more random but visually pleasing distribution than white noise.

member.summary: Context for fill operations containing all configuration needed for the fill algorithm.

member.summary: Gets the target pixel surface for the fill operation.

member.summary: Gets the replacement color (BGRA) to fill with.

member.summary: Gets the color tolerance for matching (0 = exact match, 255 = match all).

member.summary: Gets whether to use contiguous (flood) fill or global replacement.
member.value: true for contiguous 4-neighbor flood fill; false for global color replacement across entire surface.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.FillContext.Description
member.summary: Gets the description for the history item.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.FillContext.SelectionMask
member.summary: Gets the optional selection mask delegate.

remarks.para: When non-null, the fill operation should only affect pixels where this delegate returns true. The delegate takes (x, y) document coordinates and returns whether that pixel is inside the active selection.
If null, no selection is active and all pixels can be filled.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.FillContext.IsInSelection(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if the given coordinates are inside the active selection.
member.returns: True if no selection is active or the pixel is inside the selection.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.FloodFillPainter
member.summary: Default fill painter implementing contiguous flood fill and global color replacement.

remarks.para: This painter supports two fill modes:

list.item: Contiguous: Stack-based 4-neighbor flood fill from seed point
Global: Replaces all matching pixels across the entire surface

remarks.para: Both modes support tolerance-based color matching using Chebyshev distance. When a selection is active, only pixels inside the selection are affected.
The flood fill uses a bounded stack with queue fallback to prevent stack overflow on extremely large fill regions.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.FloodFillPainter.MaxStackSize
member.summary: Maximum stack size before switching to queue-based processing. This prevents stack overflow while maintaining good performance for typical fills.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.FloodFillPainter.Shared
member.summary: Shared singleton instance for common usage.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.FloodFillPainter.FillContiguous(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.FillContext,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.History.PixelChangeItem)
member.summary: Flood fill (contiguous) using stack-based DFS with tolerance. Respects selection mask when active. Uses ArrayPool for the seen array to reduce GC pressure. Uses bounded stack with queue fallback to prevent stack overflow on large regions.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Helpers.StrokeUtil
member.summary: Provides utility methods for stroke rendering, color manipulation, blending, and statistical sampling.

remarks.para: StrokeUtil is a static helper class containing performance-critical operations used throughout the painting and compositing pipeline. Many methods are marked with for optimal performance in hot paths.

Key Functionality: - Color channel extraction (A, R, G, B from packed BGRA uint) - Color interpolation (RGBA and RGB-only lerping) - Alpha compositing (Porter-Duff "over" blending with premultiplied alpha) - Similarity testing (tolerance-based color matching for flood fill) - Pixel buffer read/write operations (BGRA byte array uint conversion) - Radial falloff and locality weighting (for brush and jumble effects) - Statistical sampling (CDF-based weighted random selection) - Luminance and contrast calculations (WCAG 2.0 relative luminance) - Mask geometry utilities (grid building for stamp patterns)
Color Format: All packed colors use BGRA 32-bit format where: - Bits 0-7: Blue - Bits 8-15: Green - Bits 16-23: Red - Bits 24-31: Alpha

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Helpers.StrokeUtil.SameEmptySide(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Determines if two colors are on the same side of the transparency threshold.
member.returns: true if both colors are below or both are above the empty threshold ().
member.remarks: Used by flood fill to prevent bleeding across transparent/opaque boundaries. The threshold is 8/255 (approximately 3% opacity).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Helpers.StrokeUtil.SimilarRGBA(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Tests if two colors are similar within a tolerance, considering transparency boundaries.
member.param: Tolerance for maximum channel difference (0 = exact match).
member.returns: true if colors are similar; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Uses Chebyshev distance (max of channel differences) rather than Euclidean distance. Alpha differences are weighted by (currently 1x).
First checks if colors are on the same side of the transparency threshold via to prevent transparent/opaque mixing during flood fill operations.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Helpers.StrokeUtil.RadialFalloffWeight(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes a radial falloff weight using a power-law (gamma) curve.
member.param: Falloff exponent (higher values concentrate weight near center).
member.returns: Weight in range [0, 1], where 1 is at center and 0 is at/beyond radius.

remarks.para: Formula: weight = (1 - distance/radius)^gamma
Used for brush intensity falloff and jumble effect probability weighting. Gamma is clamped to minimum 0.05 to prevent division-by-zero or degenerate curves.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Helpers.StrokeUtil.LocalityAcceptance(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes locality acceptance probability for pair selection in jumble operations.
member.param: Locality factor (0 = any distance accepted, 1 = very local preference).
member.returns: Acceptance probability in range [0, 1].

remarks.para: Formula: acceptance = (1 - distance/radius)^(2 + 8locality)
Higher locality values cause the jumble effect to prefer swapping nearby pixels rather than distant ones, creating more coherent scrambling patterns.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Helpers.StrokeUtil.BuildCdf(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.Double},System.Double@)
member.summary: Builds a cumulative distribution function (CDF) from a list of weights for random sampling.
member.param: Weight list (negative weights treated as zero).
Output: total sum of all weights.
member.returns: CDF array where each element is the cumulative sum up to that index.

remarks.para: Used with for weighted random selection without replacement. The CDF enables O(log n) binary search sampling from arbitrary discrete distributions.
If all weights are zero, will be 0 and sampling should be skipped.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Helpers.StrokeUtil.SampleIndex(System.Random,System.Double[],System.Double)
member.summary: Samples a random index from a cumulative distribution function using binary search.
member.returns: Sampled index (0-based), or -1 if distribution is empty ( 0).

remarks.para: Generates a uniform random value in [0, total), then finds the smallest CDF index where CDF[i] value. This gives weighted random sampling with O(log n) complexity.
Used for jumble pixel pair selection where radial falloff creates non-uniform probabilities.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Helpers.StrokeUtil.BuildMaskGrid(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.ValueTuple{System.Int32,System.Int32}},System.Boolean[0:,0:]@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Builds a 2D boolean grid from a brush footprint mask for edge detection and neighbor queries.
member.param: List of (dx, dy) offsets defining the brush shape.
Output: 2D boolean array where true indicates a mask pixel.
Output: minimum X offset in mask (grid origin X).
Output: minimum Y offset in mask (grid origin Y).

remarks.para: Converts a sparse offset list into a dense 2D grid for O(1) lookup. The grid is sized to the bounding box of all offsets, with (minDx, minDy) representing the offset of the grid origin relative to the brush center.
Used for custom brush shape rendering and edge/neighbor detection during stamping.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Helpers.StrokeUtil.Occup(System.Boolean[0:,0:],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if a grid cell is occupied (safe bounds checking).
member.returns: true if (x, y) is within bounds and the grid cell is true; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Helpers.StrokeUtil.EventsPerIteration(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the number of jumble swap events for an iteration based on eligible pixel count and strength.
member.param: Number of pixels eligible for swapping.
member.returns: Number of swap events to perform (minimum 1).
member.remarks: Formula: events = max(1, round(strength eligibleCount)) Higher strength results in more chaotic scrambling.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Helpers.StrokeUtil.ParityFrac(System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the fractional center offset for odd vs. even brush sizes.
member.returns: 0.0 for even sizes (center falls between pixels), 0.5 for odd sizes (center on pixel).

remarks.para: Ensures brush stamps are visually centered correctly: - Odd size (e.g., 5): radius = 2.5, center at integer coordinate - Even size (e.g., 4): radius = 2.0, center at half-pixel offset
Used in distance calculations for brush falloff and shape rendering.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Helpers.StrokeUtil.BrushRadius(System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the maximum pixel radius from brush center for iteration bounds.
member.returns: The maximum offset magnitude that covers the entire brush footprint. For size 4: returns 2 (offsets range from -2 to +1) For size 5: returns 2 (offsets range from -2 to +2)

remarks.para: This matches the offset calculation in which uses ox = (int)Math.Floor(size / 2.0) for centering.
For even sizes: offsets go from -sz/2 to sz/2-1 (e.g., size 4: -2 to +1) For odd sizes: offsets go from -floor(sz/2) to +floor(sz/2) (e.g., size 5: -2 to +2)
Use this for iteration bounds when painters need to manually enumerate pixels in a brush footprint area (e.g., Jumble, Blur with custom sampling).

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.IStrokePainter
member.summary: Strategy interface for tool-specific painting operations. Each brush-like tool owns an implementation of this interface to handle its unique pixel manipulation logic.

remarks.para: is the core abstraction enabling plugin-friendly tool architecture. By extracting tool-specific painting logic from into individual painter implementations, new tools can be added without modifying the engine.

list.item: - Called when stroke starts; initialize buffers
/ - Called during painting
- Called when stroke ends; return changes for history

remarks.para: Painters are stateful and hold a reference to their tool's settings object. This allows direct property access (e.g., _settings.Strength) without runtime lookups, and enables painters to own per-stroke buffers naturally (e.g., smudge's logical float channels, gradient's palette map).
Plugin authors should extend for common functionality (accumulation tracking, line stamping) and override for custom pixel operations. Return from End() for standard undo/redo support.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.IStrokePainter.NeedsSnapshot
member.summary: Gets whether this painter requires a snapshot of the surface at stroke start.

remarks.para: When true, will clone the surface pixels before calling and pass the snapshot to the painter.
Painters that sample from the original state (blur, smudge, jumble) should return true. Simple painting tools (brush, eraser) return false.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.IStrokePainter.Begin(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.Layer.RasterLayer,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Called when a stroke begins. Initialize per-stroke state here.
member.param: The target raster layer for painting.
Clone of surface pixels at stroke start, or null if is false.

remarks.para: Implementations should:

list.item: Store the layer reference for use during stamping and history creation
Clear any per-stroke accumulation structures
Initialize mode-specific buffers (e.g., smudge logical channels)

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.IStrokePainter.StampAt(System.Int32,System.Int32,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.StrokeContext)
member.summary: Stamps the tool effect at a single point.
member.param: Center X coordinate in document space.
Center Y coordinate in document space.
Shared context containing brush configuration, colors, and helper functions.

remarks.para: This is the core pixel manipulation method. Implementations iterate over and apply their effect to each pixel, using for density-aware alpha computation.
Changes should be tracked for history (typically via an accumulation dictionary mapping pixel index to before/after values).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.IStrokePainter.StampLine(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.StrokeContext)
member.summary: Stamps the tool effect along a line from (x0,y0) to (x1,y1).
member.param: Shared context containing brush configuration, colors, and helper functions.

remarks.para: Default implementations typically use Bresenham-style iteration calling at intervals based on brush size. Stride is usually Math.Max(1, size / 3) to ensure continuous coverage without gaps.
Specialized tools (like smudge) may override to track stroke direction.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.IStrokePainter.End(System.String,FluentIcons.Common.Icon)
member.summary: Called when the stroke ends. Returns accumulated changes for history.
member.param: Description of the operation for undo/redo UI.
Icon representing the tool for history display.
member.returns: An containing all modifications made during the stroke, or null if no changes were made. Typically returns for standard pixel operations.

remarks.para: Implementations should:

list.item: Collect all before/after pixel values from accumulation structures
Clear per-stroke state (buffers, tracking dictionaries)
Return a result that can be pushed directly to history

remarks.para: Returning null indicates the stroke made no actual pixel changes (e.g., user clicked but didn't move, and all pixels were unchanged).

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.IToolPainter
member.summary: Marker interface for all tool painter types in PixlPunkt's plugin architecture.

remarks.para: serves as a unifying base for the three painting strategy interfaces:

list.item: : Continuous stroke-based tools (Brush, Eraser, Blur, etc.)
: Click-to-fill tools (Flood Fill, Global Replace)
: Two-point shape tools (Rectangle, Ellipse)

remarks.para: Plugin loaders can use this interface to discover all painter types from an assembly:
remarks.code: var painters = assembly.GetTypes() .Where(t => typeof(IToolPainter).IsAssignableFrom(t) && !t.IsInterface);
remarks.para: UI components can work with painters generically when type-specific behavior isn't needed:
remarks.code: void RegisterPainter(IToolPainter painter) { ... }
remarks.para: This interface contains no members - it exists purely for type categorization and discovery.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Painters.BlurPainter
member.summary: Blur painting strategy - softens pixels by sampling a weighted 3x3 kernel from the snapshot.

remarks.para: implements a localized blur effect:

list.item: Samples a 3x3 weighted Gaussian-like kernel from the stroke-start snapshot.
Blends the blurred result with the original pixel based on brush alpha.
Uses max-alpha accumulation to control blur intensity during continuous strokes.
Requires snapshot to prevent feedback loops during iterative blurring.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Painters.BrushPainter
member.summary: Standard brush painting strategy - blends foreground color over existing pixels.

remarks.para: implements the classic paint brush behavior:

list.item: Blends foreground color over existing pixels using Porter-Duff "source over".
Respects brush opacity, density, and shape from .
Uses max-alpha accumulation to prevent over-blending during continuous strokes.
Optimizes hard-opaque brushes by skipping already-touched pixels.
Respects selection mask when active (only paints inside selection).

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Painters.EraserPainter
member.summary: Eraser painting strategy - reduces pixel alpha while preserving RGB values.

remarks.para: implements pixel erasure by reducing alpha:

list.item: Subtracts effective brush alpha from existing pixel alpha.
Preserves RGB values (doesn't change color, only transparency).
Fully erased pixels (alpha=0) become completely transparent.
Uses max-alpha accumulation to prevent over-erasing during continuous strokes.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Painters.JumblePainter
member.summary: Jumble painting strategy - randomly swaps pixel colors within the brush footprint.

remarks.para: creates a pixel-shuffling effect by randomly exchanging colors:

list.item: Collects candidate pixels within brush radius weighted by radial falloff.
Pairs pixels using locality-biased random selection (nearby pixels more likely).
Swaps colors between paired pixels, recording changes for undo.
Strength controls number of swap events per stamp.

remarks.para: Unlike other painters, JumblePainter tracks its own before/after state dictionaries instead of using the standard accumulation system, since swaps affect pairs of pixels.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Painters.ReplacerPainter
member.summary: Replacer painting strategy - conditionally replaces pixels matching a target color.

remarks.para: implements color replacement:

list.item: Only affects pixels that match the target (background) color.
Can optionally ignore alpha when matching (RGB-only comparison).
Interpolates between original and foreground based on brush alpha for soft transitions.
Uses max-alpha accumulation to prevent over-replacement during continuous strokes.

member.param: The replacer tool settings to use.

member.summary: Determines if the current pixel matches the target color for replacement.
member.returns: True if the pixel should be replaced.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.Painters.SmudgePainter
member.summary: Smudge painting strategy - pulls colors along the stroke direction.

remarks.para: creates a color-smearing effect by sampling behind the stroke:

list.item: Maintains 4 logical float buffers (R, G, B, A) for smooth progressive blending.
Samples source color from one pixel back along the stroke direction.
Blends source into destination using strength-weighted radial falloff.
Supports soft mode (smooth gradients) and hard-edge mode (pixel-art style).
Handles transparency smearing (wedge growth) when enabled.

remarks.para: Smudge requires snapshot for baseline comparison but primarily operates on logical buffers to maintain smooth progression across multiple dabs.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.PixelPerfectFilter
member.summary: Filters stroke input to produce pixel-perfect lines for 1px brushes.

remarks.para: Pixel-perfect mode eliminates diagonal "stair-stepping" artifacts by ensuring strokes only move orthogonally (horizontal or vertical) when drawing slowly. This is a common feature in pixel art editors.

The algorithm works by:
Tracking the last three points in the stroke
When a potential L-shape (corner) is detected, checking if removing the middle point would create a cleaner diagonal
If so, the middle point is skipped and only the endpoint is returned

This filter should only be applied when:
Brush size is 1 pixel
Pixel-perfect mode is enabled in settings
Drawing freehand (not shift-lines or shapes)

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.PixelPerfectFilter.Reset
member.summary: Resets the filter state. Call when starting a new stroke.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.PixelPerfectFilter.Filter(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Filters an incoming point for pixel-perfect output.
member.param: Output X coordinate (may differ from input).
Output Y coordinate (may differ from input).
member.returns: True if a point should be drawn; false if this point should be skipped (the previous point will be retroactively adjusted).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.PixelPerfectFilter.FilterWithLookahead(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Filters an incoming point with lookahead for true pixel-perfect output.
member.param: Whether a point should be drawn this frame.
X coordinate to draw (if shouldDraw is true).
Y coordinate to draw (if shouldDraw is true).
member.remarks: This version uses a one-point delay to enable true lookahead filtering. The "pending" point is only committed once we see the next point.

member.summary: Flushes any pending point at the end of a stroke.
member.param: Whether there's a final point to draw.
X coordinate of the final point.
Y coordinate of the final point.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.StrokeContext
member.summary: Shared context passed to during stamping operations. Contains brush configuration, colors, surface reference, and helper functions.

remarks.para: serves as a value bag that provides painters with everything they need to perform their pixel operations without coupling them directly to or .

Context instances are created fresh for each stamp operation and should be treated as read-only by painters. The delegate allows painters to compute per-pixel alpha without reimplementing the density falloff logic.
When is true, the contain precomputed offsets from the custom brush mask. Custom brushes use uniform alpha within their mask (no density-based falloff).
When is provided, painters should check each pixel against the mask before applying paint. Use for convenient checking that handles null masks.
When is provided and active, stroke operations automatically apply to mirrored positions. Use to obtain all target coordinates for a given input point.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.StrokeContext.Surface
member.summary: Gets the target pixel surface for painting operations.
member.remarks: Painters read from and write to this surface. For blur/smudge modes, painters should sample from instead of Surface to avoid feedback loops.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.StrokeContext.ForegroundColor
member.summary: Gets the foreground color (BGRA packed 32-bit value).
member.remarks: The alpha channel of this color represents the brush opacity. Painters typically extract RGB and combine with computed per-pixel alpha.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.StrokeContext.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets the background/target color for replacer mode (BGRA).
member.remarks: Used by to match pixels that should be replaced. Other painters may ignore this value.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.StrokeContext.BrushShape
member.summary: Gets the current brush shape.

member.summary: Gets the brush density (0-255).
member.remarks: Controls the hard-edge to soft-edge ratio. Higher values mean more of the brush radius is fully opaque.

member.summary: Gets the brush opacity (0-255).
member.remarks: Maximum alpha applied during stamping. Extracted from 's alpha channel.

member.summary: Gets whether this context is using a custom brush.
member.remarks: When true, contains custom brush mask data and returns uniform alpha (no density falloff).

member.summary: Gets the pre-computed brush mask offsets relative to center.

remarks.para: Each tuple (dx, dy) represents a pixel offset from the stamp center that falls within the brush footprint. Painters iterate over these offsets to apply their effect.
For custom brushes, offsets are computed from the brush's mask tiers by .

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.StrokeContext.ComputeAlphaAtOffset
member.summary: Gets a delegate that computes per-pixel alpha at a brush offset.

remarks.para: For built-in shapes: accounts for opacity, density-based falloff, and distance. For custom brushes: returns uniform opacity (no density falloff).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.StrokeContext.Snapshot
member.summary: Gets the optional snapshot of surface pixels at stroke start.

remarks.para: Non-null only when is true. Painters that sample from original state (blur, smudge, jumble) should read from this array instead of to avoid sampling their own modifications.
Format: BGRA bytes, same dimensions as Surface.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Painting.StrokeContext.SelectionMask
member.summary: Gets the optional selection mask delegate.

remarks.para: When non-null, painters should only modify pixels where this delegate returns true. The delegate takes (x, y) document coordinates and returns whether that pixel is inside the active selection.
If null, no selection is active and all pixels can be painted.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.Defaults.DefaultPalettes
member.summary: Provides a curated collection of predefined color palettes for pixel art and retro aesthetics.

remarks.para: DefaultPalettes contains 24 carefully selected color palettes spanning retro hardware limitations (Game Boy, NES, C64), modern pixel art standards (PICO-8, DawnBringer), thematic collections (Cyberpunk, Steampunk, Vaporwave), and utility palettes (Grayscale, Skin Tones). Each palette is optimized for specific artistic styles or technical constraints.

list.item: Retro Hardware (7 palettes): Game Boy (4 colors), NES (16), C64 (16), CGA (16), EGA/VGA (16), ZX Spectrum (16), PICO-8 (16) - Historically accurate limitations of classic systems
Artistic Themes (11 palettes): Pastelly, Dystopian, Brutal, Steampunk, Dieselpunk, Cyberpunk Neon, Vaporwave, Earthy, Cosmic, WaterWorld, Kingdom Death Monster - Curated mood palettes
Community Standards (3 palettes): DawnBringer16 (DB16), Seren-12 Midnight Orchard, Solarized - Popular palettes from pixel art community
Utility (3 palettes): Grayscale (16), Skin Tones (16), PixlPunkt Default (100) - General-purpose and specialized color sets

remarks.para:
Palettes can be accessed via:
- : Complete list for UI enumeration and palette pickers
- : Case-insensitive dictionary lookup for programmatic access

All palettes use hex string literals converted to BGRA via helper method. The method enables palette composition from multiple sub-palettes while preserving color order and eliminating duplicates (used for CGA Mode 4 merged palette).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.Defaults.DefaultPalettes.All
member.summary: Gets the complete collection of all predefined palettes.
member.value: A read-only list containing 24 instances. Order matches the initialization sequence for consistent UI presentation.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.Defaults.DefaultPalettes.ByName
member.summary: Gets a dictionary for fast case-insensitive palette lookup by name.
member.value: A dictionary keyed by palette name (case-insensitive) containing all available palettes. Useful for programmatic palette selection and deserialization scenarios.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.Defaults.DefaultPalettes.#cctor
member.summary: Static constructor initializing all palettes and lookup structures.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.Defaults.DefaultPalettes.RGB(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a hex color string (RRGGBB) to packed BGRA format.
member.param: Hex color string (with or without '#' prefix). Must be exactly 6 characters.
member.returns: Packed 32-bit BGRA color value with full opacity (alpha = 255).
member.exception: Thrown if hex string is not 6 characters (RRGGBB).
member.remarks: Parses RGB components using invariant culture hex parsing. Alpha channel is always set to 255 (fully opaque) as all default palettes use solid colors.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.Defaults.DefaultPalettes.RGBArr(System.String[])
member.summary: Converts an array of hex strings to packed BGRA color array.
member.param: Array of hex color strings in RRGGBB format.
member.returns: Array of packed BGRA color values.
member.remarks: Convenience method for palette definition using string literals. Each hex string is converted via method.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.Defaults.DefaultPalettes.DistinctStable(System.UInt32[][])
member.summary: Merges multiple color arrays into a single array with duplicates removed, preserving order.
member.param: Variable number of color arrays to merge.
member.returns: Flattened array containing unique colors in encounter order.
member.remarks: Used to construct composite palettes (e.g., CGA Mode 4 merged from multiple sub-palettes). First occurrence of each unique color is preserved; subsequent duplicates are skipped. Order stability ensures consistent palette presentation.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.Defaults.DefaultPalettes.PixlPunktPalette
member.summary: Creates the PixlPunkt Default palette (100 colors).
member.returns: A comprehensive general-purpose palette with broad color coverage.
member.remarks: Large palette suitable for general pixel art without color limitations. Includes natural tones, vivid accents, and a wide luminance range for maximum flexibility.

member.remarks: Features gentle pastel shades for creating soft and calming pixel art. Suitable for themes like spring, light-hearted content, or anything requiring a subtle and understated color scheme.

member.remarks: Contains deep, muted colors suitable for creating ominous and gritty scenes. Ideal for horror, sci-fi, or any artwork requiring a sense of foreboding.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.Defaults.DefaultPalettes.Brutal_16

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.Defaults.NamedPalette
member.summary: Immutable record representing a named color palette with a display name and color array.

remarks.para: NamedPalette provides a simple container for predefined color palettes used throughout PixlPunkt. Each palette consists of a human-readable name and an array of BGRA colors. Being a record type, instances are immutable and support value-based equality comparison.

Palettes are primarily defined in and used by the for color picking, palette cycling effects, and color quantization. The immutable nature ensures palette definitions remain consistent and can be safely shared across UI components.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.Defaults.NamedPalette.Colors
member.summary: Gets or initializes the array of colors in this palette.
member.value: An array of BGRA packed 32-bit color values (0xAARRGGBB format). Array length varies by palette (typically 4-16 colors for retro palettes, up to 100+ for extended sets).
