member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the record.
member.param: The display name for this palette.
The array of BGRA colors comprising this palette.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.PaletteExtractor
member.summary: Utilities for extracting unique color palettes from pixel surfaces, documents, and image files.

remarks.para: PaletteExtractor analyzes pixel data to build lists of unique colors, useful for palette generation, color quantization analysis, and color-picking UI. Colors are returned as packed BGRA uint values (format: 0xAARRGGBB in memory as B, G, R, A bytes).

list.item: ignoreAlpha: When true, treats all pixels as opaque (alpha=255) for uniqueness testing. This merges colors that differ only in transparency, useful for palette extraction where alpha variations should be ignored (e.g., extracting base colors independent of opacity).
includeFullyTransparent: When false, skips pixels with alpha=0 entirely. When true, includes fully transparent colors in the palette. Set false to extract only visible colors.

remarks.para: All methods return colors sorted ascending by numeric value (0xAARRGGBB) for stable, consistent ordering. This ensures palette lists remain predictable across extractions and makes comparison/diffing reliable.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.PaletteExtractor.ExtractUniqueColorsFromSurface(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Imaging.PixelSurface,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Extracts unique colors from a .
member.param: Source pixel surface with BGRA byte layout.
If true, treats all pixels as fully opaque (alpha=255) for uniqueness. This merges colors differing only by alpha channel.
If false, excludes pixels with alpha=0 from the palette. If true, includes fully transparent colors.
member.returns: A sorted list of unique BGRA packed colors (uint values).
member.remarks: Iterates all pixels in the surface, building a HashSet of unique colors. Results are sorted numerically for consistent ordering.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.PaletteExtractor.ExtractUniqueColorsFromDocument(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Document.CanvasDocument,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Extracts unique colors from all visible layers in a .
member.param: Source document with one or more layers.
If true, treats all pixels as fully opaque (alpha=255) for uniqueness. This merges colors differing only by alpha channel.
If false, excludes pixels with alpha=0 from the palette. If true, includes fully transparent colors.
member.returns: A sorted list of unique BGRA packed colors (uint values) from all layers combined.

remarks.para: Processes all layers in the document, accumulating unique colors into a single unified palette. Layer visibility, blend modes, and effects are ignored - this extracts raw pixel data from each layer's surface.
Useful for analyzing total color usage across a multi-layer document, generating master palettes, or checking color limits for export to constrained formats.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.PaletteExtractor.ExtractUniqueColorsFromFile(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Extracts unique colors from an image file on disk.
member.param: Path to an image file (PNG, BMP, JPEG, GIF, etc.) loadable by .
If true, treats all pixels as fully opaque (alpha=255) for uniqueness. This merges colors differing only by alpha channel.
If false, excludes pixels with alpha=0 from the palette. If true, includes fully transparent colors.
member.returns: A sorted list of unique BGRA packed colors (uint values).

remarks.para: Uses for simplicity and compatibility with all GDI+ supported formats. This approach is sufficient for one-off palette extraction and import operations.
For very large images (megapixels), GetPixel can be slow. If performance becomes critical, consider using with for direct memory access (similar to ).

- Importing existing artwork and generating matching palettes
- Analyzing color usage in reference images
- Building custom palettes from photo sources
- Color quantization preprocessing

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.PaletteSorter
member.summary: Provides sorting algorithms for palette colors.

remarks.para: PaletteSorter offers various sorting strategies for organizing palette colors in meaningful ways. Sorting can be based on color properties (hue, saturation, lightness), individual channels (RGB), or perceptual brightness (luminance).

list.item: Hue: Groups colors by their position on the color wheel (reds ? oranges ? yellows ? greens ? etc.)
Saturation: Orders from grayscale/muted to vivid/pure colors
Lightness: Orders from dark to light (HSL lightness)
Luminance: Orders by perceived brightness (WCAG relative luminance)
Red/Green/Blue: Orders by individual color channel values
Reverse: Reverses the current order

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.PaletteSorter.Sort(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.UInt32},PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Enums.PaletteSortMode)
member.summary: Sorts a list of colors according to the specified sort mode.
member.param: The colors to sort (packed BGRA uint values).
member.returns: A new sorted list of colors.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.PaletteSorter.SortByHue(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Sorts colors by hue (position on the color wheel, 0-360 degrees).
member.remarks: Groups colors by their base color family. Grays (low saturation) are sorted by lightness and placed at the end to keep chromatic colors together.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.PaletteSorter.SortBySaturation(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Sorts colors by saturation (0% grayscale to 100% vivid).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.PaletteSorter.SortByLightness(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Sorts colors by lightness (0% black to 100% white).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.PaletteSorter.SortByLuminance(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Sorts colors by relative luminance (perceived brightness using WCAG formula).
member.remarks: Uses the WCAG 2.0 relative luminance formula which accounts for human perception. Green contributes most to perceived brightness, followed by red, then blue.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.PaletteSorter.SortByRed(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Sorts colors by red channel value (0-255).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.PaletteSorter.SortByGreen(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Sorts colors by green channel value (0-255).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.PaletteSorter.SortByBlue(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Sorts colors by blue channel value (0-255).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.Helpers.PaletteSorter.Reverse(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Reverses the order of colors.

member.summary: Gets a human-readable display name for a sort mode.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.PaletteService
member.summary: Manages the active color palette, foreground/background colors, and palette import/export.

remarks.para: PaletteService is the central management point for the application's color palette. It maintains: - A list of palette colors (packed BGRA uint values) - The current foreground (primary) color - The current background (secondary) color - Events for UI synchronization when any of these change

The palette supports full CRUD operations (Add, Insert, Remove, Update, Move) with automatic change notifications. All colors are stored in BGRA format (0xAABBGGRR) for consistency with the rest of the imaging pipeline.

Typical usage: 1. Create service with seed colors or use default palette 2. Subscribe to events for UI binding 3. Use SetForeground/SetBackground to change active colors 4. Use Add/Remove/Update methods to modify palette 5. Export/import palettes as JSON for sharing and persistence

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.PaletteService.Colors
member.summary: Gets the read-only list of palette colors.
member.value: A list of packed BGRA values (0xAABBGGRR). Modifications must be done through the service methods to ensure proper event notification.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Palette.PaletteService.Background
member.summary: Gets the current background (secondary) color.
member.value: Packed BGRA value (0xAABBGGRR). Default is opaque white (0xFFFFFFFF). Set via .

member.summary: Default implementation of that wraps a .

remarks.para: This class provides plugins with read-only access to document data through the SDK's ICanvasContext interface. It's created on-demand by the canvas host and provided to plugins via IPluginContext.Canvas.
Thread Safety: This class should only be accessed from the UI thread. The underlying document data may change at any time due to user actions.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPlugin
member.summary: Core interface that all PixlPunkt plugins must implement.

remarks.para: defines the contract for plugin lifecycle and tool/effect registration. Plugins are loaded from .punk files (ZIP archives containing assemblies and metadata).

list.item: Plugin assembly is loaded into an isolated
is called with the host context
is called to discover tools
is called to discover effects
Tools and effects are registered with their respective global registries
is called when the plugin is unloaded
Plugins should be stateless where possible
Use for host services, not static references
Clean up all resources in
Tool IDs should use your vendor prefix (e.g., "com.mycompany.brush.sparkle")
Effect IDs should use your vendor prefix (e.g., "com.mycompany.effect.halftone")

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPlugin.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for this plugin.
member.value: A string following the convention {vendor}.{name}. For example: "com.example.sparkletools".
member.remarks: This ID must match the id field in the plugin's manifest.json.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPlugin.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets the display name for this plugin.
member.value: A human-readable name for display in the plugin manager UI.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPlugin.Version
member.summary: Gets the plugin version.
member.value: A semantic version string (e.g., "1.0.0", "2.1.3-beta").

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPlugin.Author
member.summary: Gets the plugin author or organization.
member.value: The author name or organization responsible for the plugin.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPlugin.Description
member.summary: Gets a brief description of what this plugin provides.
member.value: A short description for display in the plugin manager.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPlugin.Initialize(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPluginContext)
member.summary: Initializes the plugin with the host context.
member.param: The plugin context providing access to host services.

remarks.para: Called once after the plugin assembly is loaded. Use this to:

list.item: Store the context reference for later use
Load any plugin-specific resources
Perform one-time initialization

remarks.para: Do NOT register tools or effects here - use the Get*Registrations methods instead.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPlugin.GetToolRegistrations
member.summary: Returns all tool registrations provided by this plugin.
member.returns: An enumerable of tool registrations to add to the tool registry.

remarks.para: Called after to discover the plugin's tools. Each registration should include:

list.item: A unique tool ID with your vendor prefix
A settings object (or null for simple tools)
The appropriate factory/builder for the tool category

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPlugin.GetEffectRegistrations
member.summary: Returns all effect registrations provided by this plugin.
member.returns: An enumerable of effect registrations to add to the effect registry.

remarks.para: Called after to discover the plugin's layer effects. Each registration should include:

list.item: A unique effect ID with your vendor prefix (e.g., "com.mycompany.effect.halftone")
A factory method to create effect instances
Options provider for settings UI generation

remarks.para: Return an empty enumerable if your plugin doesn't provide any effects.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPlugin.Shutdown
member.summary: Shuts down the plugin and releases resources.

remarks.para: Called before the plugin is unloaded. Use this to:

list.item: Dispose of any managed resources
Save plugin state if needed
Unsubscribe from any events

remarks.para: After this method returns, the plugin's tools and effects will be unregistered and the assembly load context may be unloaded.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPluginContext
member.summary: Context interface providing plugins access to host services.

remarks.para: is passed to plugins during initialization and provides a safe, versioned API surface for plugins to interact with the host application.

list.item: Plugins should not access host internals directly
This interface defines the stable API contract between host and plugins
New capabilities can be added in future versions without breaking existing plugins

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPluginContext.HostVersion
member.summary: Gets the host application version.
member.value: The PixlPunkt version string (e.g., "1.0.0").
member.remarks: Plugins can use this to check compatibility or enable version-specific features.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPluginContext.ApiVersion
member.summary: Gets the plugin API version supported by the host.
member.value: The API version number. Higher versions support more features.

remarks.para: API versions:

list.item: 1: Initial plugin API (tools only)
2: Added for pixel sampling and selection access

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPluginContext.PluginDirectory
member.summary: Gets the directory where the plugin is installed.
member.value: The full path to the plugin's extracted directory.
member.remarks: Use this to load plugin-specific assets or configuration files.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPluginContext.DataDirectory
member.summary: Gets the directory for plugin-specific persistent data.
member.value: A writable directory where the plugin can store settings and cache data.
member.remarks: This directory is preserved across plugin updates and app restarts.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.IPluginContext.Canvas
member.summary: Gets the canvas context for the active document (API version 2+).
member.value: An for sampling pixels and querying document state, or null if no document is open.

remarks.para: The canvas context provides read-only access to:

list.item: Document dimensions and layer information
Current foreground/background colors
Pixel sampling from layers or composite
Selection state and mask data

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Plugins.ICanvasContext
member.summary: Provides plugins with read-only access to the active canvas/document state.

remarks.para: allows plugin tools to:

list.item: Sample pixel colors from the active layer or composite
Query document dimensions
Access current foreground/background colors
Check selection state and bounds

remarks.para: Thread Safety: Canvas context methods should only be called from the UI thread during tool operations. The pixel data may change between calls if the user performs other operations.

Entry point assembly
Tool declarations
Compatibility requirements

remarks.code: { "id": "com.example.sparkletools", "name": "Sparkle Tools", "version": "1.0.0", "author": "Example Inc.", "description": "Adds sparkle and glitter brush effects", "minApiVersion": 1, "entryPoint": "SparkleTools.dll", "pluginClass": "SparkleTools.SparklePlugin", "tools": [ { "id": "com.example.brush.sparkle", "category": "Brush", "name": "Sparkle Brush" } ] }

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Reference.ReferenceImage
member.summary: Represents a reference image overlay that can be displayed on the canvas for artistic reference while drawing.

remarks.para: Reference images are non-destructive overlays that help artists trace, match colors, or maintain proportions while creating pixel art. They are not part of the document's layer stack and are not exported with the final image.
Each reference image has its own transform properties (position, scale, rotation) and display settings (opacity, locked state) that can be adjusted independently.
Unlike layers, reference images are rendered using smooth interpolation (not pixel-snapped) and can extend beyond the canvas boundaries without being clipped.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Rendering.SkiaCanvasRenderer
member.summary: SkiaSharp implementation of . Used for cross-platform rendering on Desktop (Windows/macOS/Linux) and WebAssembly.
member.remarks: This renderer caches SKBitmap and SKPaint objects to minimize GC pressure during frequent rendering operations. Without caching, each frame would allocate new bitmaps and paints, causing significant GC pauses especially in maximized windows.

member.summary: Primary cached bitmap for DrawPixels - reused when dimensions match (document surface).

member.summary: Secondary cached bitmap for DrawPixels - for mask overlay (typically same dimensions as primary).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Rendering.SkiaCanvasRenderer._cachedBitmap3
member.summary: Tertiary cached bitmap for DrawPixels - for reference layers (may have different dimensions).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Rendering.SkiaCanvasRenderer._imagePaint
member.summary: Cached paint for image drawing operations.

member.summary: Cached paint for stroke operations.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Rendering.SkiaCanvasRenderer._fillPaint
member.summary: Cached paint for fill operations.

member.summary: Creates a renderer wrapping an existing SKCanvas (from PaintSurface event).

member.summary: Creates a renderer with its own SKSurface (for offscreen rendering).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Rendering.SkiaCanvasRenderer.DrawPixels(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,Windows.Foundation.Rect,Windows.Foundation.Rect,System.Single,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Rendering.ImageInterpolation)
member.summary: Draws pixels from a byte array. Uses cached bitmap pool to avoid per-frame allocations.
member.remarks: This method is called multiple times per frame (document surface, mask overlay, reference layers, etc.). Caching multiple SKBitmaps by dimension eliminates massive GC pressure that was causing stuttering, especially in maximized windows.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.PixelSelection
member.summary: Represents a geometric selection with pixel mask, polygon outline, and transform state.

remarks.para: PixelSelection combines a boolean pixel mask () with a vector polygon outline and 2D transform state (translation, rotation, scale). This hybrid approach enables both pixel-accurate operations (magic wand, lasso) and smooth geometric transformations.

list.item: Mask: Authoritative for hit-testing, compositing, and tool operations. Defines which pixels are "inside" the selection.
Poly: Geometric outline for rendering handles, marching ants, and transform UI. Derived from mask via or from rect operations.
Inactive: = false, no selection exists.
Active: Selection defined but not floating. Mask and poly populated.
Armed: Selection ready for transform operations (handles visible).
Floating: Selection lifted to buffer, can be moved/transformed independently.

remarks.code: 1. Create selection (mask + poly) 2. User drags handles Transform state updated 3. GetTransformMatrix() Preview transformed poly 4. Commit Rasterize transformed poly back to mask
remarks.para: When is true, contains a snapshot of selected pixels that can be moved and transformed independently of the document. Buffer uses BGRA byte format (4 bytes per pixel) with dimensions (, ).

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionEngine
member.summary: Manages interactive pixel-based selections with polygon boundaries, transform operations, and floating buffers.

remarks.para: SelectionEngine is the core controller for all selection-related operations in PixlPunkt. It coordinates: - Selection creation (rectangular marquee, magic wand integration points) - Floating selection buffers (lift pixel data from layer) - Transform operations (move, rotate, scale) with visual feedback - Hit testing for interactive handles (corners, edges, rotation handles) - Integration with undo/redo via - Rendering callbacks for UI updates

**Architecture**: This class is UI-framework-agnostic. It receives pointer events and coordinate transformations from the canvas host but contains no UI framework dependencies. All rendering is delegated via callbacks.

**Usage Flow**: 1. Create engine with layer/document providers 2. Wire up coordinate transformation functions (ViewToDoc, ViewToDocClamped) 3. Forward pointer events: PointerPressed PointerMoved PointerReleased 4. Call Draw() during render pass to visualize selection 5. Selection operations (LiftToFloating, CommitFloating, ClearSelection, SelectAll)
**Transform Model**: Supports "sticky transforms" where rotation/scale state persists across multiple operations until committed, allowing incremental adjustments.

member.summary: Lifts pixel data into a floating selection buffer with specified position.
member.param: Width of the buffer in pixels.
Height of the buffer in pixels.
X coordinate of buffer origin in document space.
Y coordinate of buffer origin in document space.

remarks.para: Creates a floating selection that can be transformed (moved, rotated, scaled) independently of the layer. The selection becomes active and floating, with transform state initialized to identity (scale=1, rotation=0).

This is typically called after the user begins dragging a selection or performs a "float" command. The buffer should contain the pixels from the selection region, and the layer's corresponding pixels should be cleared or preserved depending on the operation mode.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionEngine.CommitFloating
member.summary: Commits the floating selection back to the layer, applying all accumulated transforms.

remarks.para: Applies rotation, scaling, and translation to the floating buffer, stamps it back into the active layer, rebuilds the selection mask from the transformed result, and pushes a history entry for undo/redo.
After commit, the selection remains active with a polygon outline matching the new pixel footprint. If sticky transforms are enabled, transform state persists for subsequent operations.
No-op if no floating selection exists or no active layer is available.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionMask
member.summary: Represents a 2D boolean mask for pixel-level selection tracking.

remarks.para: SelectionMask provides a simple boolean grid where each pixel can be either selected (true) or not selected (false). It serves as the authoritative hit-test data for selection operations like flood fill, magic wand, and lasso tools.

Key features: - Fixed dimensions matching document size - Rectangle-based modification (AddRect for marquee selection) - Point containment testing - Enumeration of all selected pixels (for outline generation after transforms)

The mask uses a 2D boolean array indexed as [x, y] for efficient access. For large documents, consider using a more memory-efficient sparse representation if only a small percentage of pixels are typically selected.

member.param: The width of the mask in pixels (must match document width).
The height of the mask in pixels (must match document height).
member.remarks: Creates an empty mask (all pixels unselected). The dimensions are fixed at construction and cannot be changed. If document dimensions change, a new mask must be created.

member.summary: Clears the entire mask (deselects all pixels).

member.summary: Adds a rectangular region to the selection (marks pixels as selected).
member.param: The X coordinate of the rectangle's top-left corner.
The Y coordinate of the rectangle's top-left corner.
The width of the rectangle in pixels.
The height of the rectangle in pixels.

remarks.para: Sets all pixels within the specified rectangle to true (selected). Coordinates are automatically clamped to mask bounds; out-of-bounds pixels are ignored.
This method is typically used for marquee (rectangular) selection or for building up complex selections by combining multiple rectangles.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified pixel is selected.
member.param: The X coordinate of the pixel.
The Y coordinate of the pixel.
member.returns: true if the pixel at (x, y) is selected; otherwise, false. Returns false for out-of-bounds coordinates.
member.remarks: This is the primary hit-test method used to determine if drawing operations should affect a specific pixel. Out-of-bounds checks are performed for safety.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionMask.EnumerateFilledPixels
member.summary: Enumerates all selected pixels in the mask.
member.returns: An enumerable of (x, y) coordinate tuples for all pixels where the mask is true. Pixels are enumerated in row-major order (top-to-bottom, left-to-right).

remarks.para: This method is used after transform operations (rotate, scale) to rebuild the selection polygon outline from the transformed pixel footprint.
For large selections, this can produce many coordinates. Consider using the selection outline polygon () for visual representation instead of iterating all pixels.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionOutlineBuilder
member.summary: Builds polygon outlines from using convex hull or exact pixel tracing.

remarks.para: SelectionOutlineBuilder converts boolean pixel masks into vector polygons suitable for rendering and transform operations. Two algorithms are provided to balance simplicity vs. accuracy:

item.description: Fast Graham scan (O(N log N)). Produces minimal polygon that encloses all selected pixels. Loses concave features and holes. Ideal for simple shape transforms.
Marching squares perimeter walk (O(perimeter)). Follows exact pixel boundaries, preserving concave regions and details. Required for accurate lasso and magic wand results.

remarks.para: All polygons are returned with vertices snapped to pixel corners (integer coordinates). Exact trace mode includes polygon simplification to remove collinear points, reducing vertex count without losing shape fidelity.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionOutlineBuilder.BuildOutline(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionMask,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Builds a polygon outline from a selection mask.
member.param: If true, uses pixel-accurate tracing (marching squares). If false, uses fast convex hull approximation.
member.returns: List of polygon vertices in document pixel space, or empty list if mask is empty.

remarks.para: Vertices are snapped to pixel corners for clean rendering. Exact trace mode produces polygons that perfectly follow the mask boundary. Convex hull mode produces simpler polygons at the cost of losing concave features.

- Convex hull: O(N log N) where N = number of selected pixels
- Exact trace: O(perimeter) where perimeter = outline edge count

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionOutlineBuilder.BuildConvexHull(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.ValueTuple{System.Int32,System.Int32}})
member.summary: Builds a convex hull outline using Graham scan algorithm.
member.returns: Minimal convex polygon containing all points.

list.item: Convert pixel coords to center points (x+0.5, y+0.5)
Find lowest Y point (bottom-most, then left-most) as pivot
Sort remaining points by polar angle from pivot
Graham scan: iteratively build hull by removing right turns
Snap final vertices to pixel corners

remarks.para: Cross product test determines turn direction: positive = left turn (keep), negative/zero = right turn or collinear (remove). Results in CCW-oriented polygon.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionOutlineBuilder.Cross(System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Numerics.Vector2)
member.summary: Computes 2D cross product (Z component) for turn direction test.
member.returns: Positive = left turn, negative = right turn, zero = collinear.
member.remarks: Formula: (b.X - a.X) (c.Y - a.Y) - (b.Y - a.Y) (c.X - a.X). Used by Graham scan to determine if point C is left or right of line AB.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionOutlineBuilder.BuildExactPixelOutline(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.ValueTuple{System.Int32,System.Int32}})
member.summary: Builds exact pixel outline using marching squares perimeter tracing.
member.returns: Polygon following exact pixel boundaries.

list.item: Find starting pixel (lowest Y, then leftmost X)
Begin at pixel's bottom-left corner, facing right

At each step:
Try turning right (follow outer edge)
If blocked, continue forward
If blocked again, turn left (inner corner)
Record corner positions until returning to start
Simplify polygon to remove collinear points

remarks.para: This "wall-following" approach produces a CCW-oriented polygon that traces the selection's outer perimeter. Works correctly for concave shapes and preserves pixel-accurate boundaries.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionOutlineBuilder.Neighbor(System.ValueTuple{System.Int32,System.Int32},System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets neighboring pixel in specified direction.
member.returns: Neighbor pixel coordinates.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionOutlineBuilder.SnapToPixel(System.Numerics.Vector2)
member.summary: Snaps a vector to nearest integer pixel corner coordinates.
member.returns: Vector with X and Y rounded to nearest integer.
member.remarks: Ensures polygon vertices align with pixel grid for clean rendering and consistent hit-testing. Uses for banker's rounding.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionOutlineBuilder.Simplify(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Numerics.Vector2})
member.summary: Removes collinear points from polygon to reduce vertex count.
member.returns: Simplified polygon with collinear points removed.

remarks.para: Tests each triple of consecutive points using cross product. If points are nearly collinear (area < 0.001), the middle point is removed. This reduces polygon complexity without losing shape accuracy.
Essential for marching squares output which can produce many redundant vertices along straight edges.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionOutlineBuilder.IsCollinear(System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Single)
member.summary: Tests if three points are approximately collinear.
member.param: Epsilon threshold for area test. Default is 0.001.
member.returns: true if triangle ABC has negligible area; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Computes triangle area via cross product. If area is below epsilon, points are considered collinear and B can be safely removed.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionRegion
member.summary: Represents a pixel-based selection region using a boolean mask with marching-ants rendering.

remarks.para: SelectionRegion provides a lightweight pixel mask for rectangular selection operations with efficient add/subtract operations and tight bounds tracking. Unlike , this class focuses on simple rectangle-based operations and includes rendering support for animated marching-ants outlines.

list.item: Boolean Mask: Byte array where 0 = unselected, 1 = selected.
Tight Bounds: Automatically tracks minimal bounding rectangle of selected pixels. Recomputed after subtractions to maintain accuracy.
Rectangle Operations: Add/subtract axis-aligned rectangles with efficient clipping.
Marching Ants: Renders animated boundary outline with alternating black/white segments.

remarks.para: The method traces the outer boundary of the selection by detecting edge pixels (selected pixel adjacent to unselected). Horizontal and vertical edges are traced separately, with alternating black/white segments drawn using phase animation. Corner edges use inverted patterns to create seamless checkerboard effect at intersections.
Add operations expand bounds in O(1) by unioning rectangles. Subtract operations trigger O(WH) bounds recomputation to tighten after potential holes. Point containment is O(1) with bounds culling.

member.summary: Tests whether a specific pixel is selected (in world space).

remarks.para: Performs fast rejection using before testing the mask. Out-of-bounds coordinates return false. This is an O(1) operation with bounds culling.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionRegion.DrawAnts(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Rendering.ICanvasRenderer,Windows.Foundation.Rect,System.Double,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Renders animated marching-ants outline along the outer boundary of the selection.
member.param: Zoom scale factor (document pixels view pixels).
Animation phase offset in pixels. Increment over time to animate.
Length of white segments in pixels.
Length of black segments in pixels.

remarks.para: Scans the selection bounds to identify edge pixels (selected with unselected neighbor). Four passes detect top, bottom, left, and right edges separately. Consecutive edge pixels are coalesced into line segments for efficient rendering.
Horizontal edges use normal phase; vertical edges use inverted phase (offset by antsOn). This creates a checkerboard pattern at corners where edges meet, ensuring seamless animation.
Complexity is O(boundsArea), only scanning tight bounds rather than full mask. Segment coalescing minimizes draw calls for continuous edges.

member.exception: Thrown if dimensions don't match.
member.remarks: Performs bitwise AND of both masks. Triggers bounds recomputation since intersection may create gaps or shrinkage.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionRegion.SubtractRegion(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionRegion)
member.summary: Subtracts another region from this selection.
member.exception: Thrown if dimensions don't match.
member.remarks: Performs bitwise AND NOT (clears bits where other is set). Triggers bounds recomputation.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionRegion.RecomputeBounds
member.summary: Recomputes tight bounding rectangle by scanning entire mask.
member.remarks: O(WH) operation. Called after subtract operations that may shrink the selection. Finds minimal rectangle containing all selected pixels.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionRegion.At(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Safely reads a mask pixel, returning 0 for out-of-bounds coordinates.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionRegion.SubtractPixelFast(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Clears a single pixel in the mask without triggering bounds recomputation.
member.remarks: This is a performance optimization for batch subtract operations (e.g., paint selection tool). After calling this multiple times, you MUST call to update bounds.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionRegion.RecomputeBoundsIfNeeded
member.summary: Recomputes bounds if they were invalidated by batch operations.
member.remarks: Call this after a series of operations to finalize bounds.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionRegion.Invert(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inverts the selection within the specified document bounds.

remarks.para: Flips all pixels within the document bounds: selected becomes unselected, and vice versa. Pixels outside the current mask buffer (if any) are treated as unselected and become selected.
The region's offset is reset to (0, 0) since the inverted selection covers the full document.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState
member.summary: Manages selection state for "floating" selection operations with cut/paste semantics.

remarks.para: SelectionState implements the classic image editor pattern where a rectangular selection can be "lifted" from the canvas into a floating buffer, moved around, and either committed back or canceled. This enables non-destructive repositioning of selected content.

list.item: Inactive: No selection exists ( = false).
Active: Rectangle selected but not floating. Pixels remain in place.
Floating: Selection lifted to buffer. Original pixels cleared. Can be moved freely.

remarks.code: 1. Begin(rect) Active, not floating 2. Lift(pixels) Floating (copies pixels, clears original) 3. MoveTo(x, y) Updates float position 4. Commit(pixels) Blits back to new position, Active OR Cancel(pixels) Restores original position, clears state
remarks.para:
- Marquee selection with drag-to-move
- Cut and reposition operations
- Temporary layer-like manipulation of regions
- Undo-friendly pixel transforms (backup preserved until commit)
When is called, original pixels are copied to internal backup before clearing. This enables to restore the original state if the operation is aborted.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState.Active
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a selection exists.
member.value: true if a selection rectangle is defined; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState.Rect
member.summary: Gets the current selection rectangle in document pixel coordinates.
member.value: Normalized rectangle (non-negative width/height) defining the selection bounds.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState.IsFloating
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the selection is floating (lifted from document).
member.value: true if selection is in floating buffer; false if pixels remain in place.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState.FloatX
member.summary: Gets the X coordinate of the floating buffer's top-left corner.
member.value: Document pixel X position. Only valid when is true.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState.FloatY
member.summary: Gets the Y coordinate of the floating buffer's top-left corner.
member.value: Document pixel Y position. Only valid when is true.

member.summary: Gets the floating pixel buffer (BGRA format).
member.value: Array of packed BGRA pixels, or null if not floating. Length = 4.

member.summary: Gets the width of the floating buffer in pixels.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState.FloatH
member.summary: Gets the height of the floating buffer in pixels.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState.Begin(Windows.Graphics.RectInt32)
member.summary: Begins a new selection with the specified rectangle.
member.param: Selection rectangle (will be normalized to positive width/height).
member.remarks: Sets to true and to false. Rectangle dimensions are normalized to ensure non-negative width/height.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState.Update(Windows.Graphics.RectInt32)
member.summary: Updates the selection rectangle (e.g., during interactive drag).
member.remarks: Only updates . Does not affect floating state or buffers. Useful for live-updating marquee selection during drag operations.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState.Clear
member.summary: Clears the selection and discards all state.
member.remarks: Resets and to false. Releases floating buffer and backup references. No pixels are modified.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState.Lift(System.UInt32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Lifts the selected rectangle from the layer into a floating buffer.
member.param: Source layer pixel array (BGRA packed uint).

list.item: Copies pixels from within to internal backup
Clears the original rectangle (replaces with transparent pixels)
Sets to true and populates
Initializes float position to original location

remarks.para: Does nothing if already floating or not active. The backup enables to restore original pixels if the operation is aborted.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState.MoveTo(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the floating buffer to a new position.
member.param: New X coordinate for top-left corner.
New Y coordinate for top-left corner.
member.remarks: Updates and . Only affects position; pixel content is unchanged. Does nothing if not floating.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState.Commit(System.UInt32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Commits the floating buffer back to the layer at its current position.
member.param: Target layer pixel array (BGRA packed uint).

list.item: Blits to at (, )
Sets to false
Updates to new position/size
Releases floating buffer and backup references

remarks.para: Selection remains active after commit but is no longer floating. Does nothing if not floating.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState.Cancel(System.UInt32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Cancels the floating operation and restores original pixels.
member.param: Target layer pixel array (BGRA packed uint).

remarks.para: If floating, restores backup pixels to original position and calls . If not floating, simply clears the selection. This enables undo-like behavior for lift operations.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState.Delete(System.UInt32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the selected content (clears pixels to transparent).
member.param: Target layer pixel array (BGRA packed uint).

remarks.para: If floating, discards the floating buffer. Clears the rectangle at position and sets to false. Equivalent to pressing Delete key on selection.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionState.Normalize(Windows.Graphics.RectInt32)
member.summary: Normalizes a rectangle to have non-negative width and height.
member.returns: Rectangle with positive width/height, adjusting X/Y if necessary.
member.remarks: Converts rectangles created by dragging bottom-left to top-right (negative dimensions) into standard top-left anchored form. Essential for consistent rect operations.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionTransform
member.summary: Handles 2D transform operations (move, rotate, scale) on selection polygons.

remarks.para: SelectionTransform provides interactive transformation of polygons without modifying the underlying pixel mask until commit. All transforms operate in document pixel space with snap-to-grid behavior for precise positioning.

list.item: Move: Translates selection by dragging. Snaps to pixel grid for alignment.
Rotate: Rotates around polygon center. Supports angle snapping (e.g., 15 increments).
Scale: Resizes via 8 corner/edge handles. Supports uniform and non-uniform scaling.

remarks.code: 1. BeginMove/Rotate/Scale(pointerDoc) Captures initial state 2. UpdateMove/Rotate/Scale(pointerDoc) Applies delta from start 3. Commit transform Selection updates its state
remarks.para: Transforms are applied in SRT order: Scale Rotate Translate. This ensures scaling happens around the origin before rotation, and translation moves the fully-transformed shape.

- Move: Snaps delta to nearest pixel (Math.Round)
- Rotate: Optional angle snap (default 1, can use 15 for coarse snapping)
- Scale: Snaps to 0.01 increments (1% precision), clamped to minimum 0.01

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionTransform.#ctor(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.PixelSelection)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionTransform.BeginMove(System.Numerics.Vector2)
member.summary: Begins a move operation by capturing the current translation and pointer position.
member.param: Initial pointer position in document pixel coordinates.
member.remarks: Call this when user presses mouse button to start dragging the selection. Stores current translation state for delta calculation.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionTransform.UpdateMove(System.Numerics.Vector2)
member.summary: Updates the move operation by calculating and applying pixel-snapped translation delta.
member.param: Current pointer position in document pixel coordinates.
member.remarks: Calculates delta from position, snaps to pixel grid, and updates selection's . Called repeatedly during drag.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionTransform.BeginRotate(System.Numerics.Vector2)
member.summary: Begins a rotation operation by capturing the initial angle and pointer's angular position.
member.param: Initial pointer position in document pixel coordinates.

remarks.para: Computes pointer's angle relative to polygon center using . This anchor angle is used to calculate rotation delta during .
Rotation always occurs around the polygon's centroid, computed via .

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionTransform.UpdateRotate(System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Single)
member.summary: Updates the rotation by calculating angular delta and applying snap-to-grid.
member.param: Current pointer position in document pixel coordinates.
Angle snapping granularity in degrees. Default is 1 (fine). Use 15 for coarse snapping.

list.item: Compute current pointer angle from polygon center
Calculate delta from anchor angle stored in
Apply delta to starting rotation angle
Normalize to -180..180 range
Snap to increments

remarks.para: Negative angles represent clockwise rotation. Snapping helps users achieve precise alignments (0, 45, 90, etc.) without manual entry.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionTransform.ScaleHandle
member.summary: Defines the 8 scale handle positions plus None.

remarks.para: Corner handles (NW, NE, SE, SW) typically scale both axes uniformly. Edge handles (N, E, S, W) scale single axis or both depending on uniformLink flag.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionTransform.ScaleHandleActive
member.summary: Gets the currently active scale handle.
member.value: The being dragged, or if not scaling.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionTransform.UpdateScale(System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the scale by calculating distance ratio from polygon center.
member.param: Current pointer position in document pixel coordinates.
If true, scales both axes equally. If false, applies axis-specific scaling based on handle type.

list.item: Compute distance from polygon center to start pointer
Compute distance from polygon center to current pointer
Calculate scale factor = currentDist / startDist
Snap scale to 0.01 increments (1% precision)
Apply to X, Y, or both axes based on handle and uniform flag
Snap translation to pixel grid

remarks.para:
- Corners (NW, NE, SE, SW): Scale both axes
- Vertical edges (N, S): Scale Y only (unless uniform)
- Horizontal edges (E, W): Scale X only (unless uniform)
Minimum scale is clamped to 0.01 (1%) to prevent division by zero and invisibility.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Selection.SelectionTransform.ComputePolyCenter(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Numerics.Vector2})
member.summary: Computes the centroid (average position) of a polygon.
member.returns: Centroid as a . Returns if polygon is empty.
member.remarks: Simple arithmetic mean of all vertices. Used as the pivot point for rotation and scaling.

member.summary: Transforms the selection's polygon using current transform state.
member.returns: A new list of transformed vertices.
member.remarks: Applies the selection's transform matrix (from ) to each vertex. Used for preview rendering and hit-testing against transformed bounds.

member.summary: Tests whether a point falls within a square handle region.

Half-size of the handle square (e.g., 5 pixels for 1010 handle).
member.returns: true if point is inside handle bounds; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Axis-aligned bounding box test. Used by UI layer (CanvasViewHost) to determine which handle the pointer is hovering over or clicked on.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Settings.ShortcutConflictDetector
member.summary: Detects keyboard shortcut conflicts between tools (built-in and plugins).

remarks.para: The conflict detector scans all registered tools and their shortcuts to identify cases where multiple tools share the same keyboard binding. Conflicts are reported at startup so users can be warned and resolve them via the settings window.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Settings.ShortcutConflictDetector.#ctor(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolState,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Settings.ShortcutSettings)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .
member.param: The tool state containing all registered tools.
The shortcut settings with custom bindings.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Settings.ShortcutConflictDetector.GetAllEffectiveBindings
member.summary: Gets all effective shortcut bindings for registered tools.
member.returns: A dictionary mapping tool IDs to their effective shortcut bindings. Tools without shortcuts are excluded.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Settings.ShortcutConflictDetector.DetectConflicts(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Detects all shortcut conflicts among registered tools.
member.param: Whether to include plugin tools in conflict detection.
member.returns: A list of detected conflicts.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Settings.ShortcutConflictDetector.DetectUndismissedConflicts
member.summary: Detects conflicts that haven't been dismissed by the user.
member.returns: A list of undismissed conflicts.

member.returns: A list of tool IDs that would conflict, or empty if no conflict.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.Bgra
member.summary: Lightweight BGRA pixel struct for clearer pack/unpack operations.

remarks.para: This struct provides efficient byte-level access to BGRA color components with optimized methods for conversion to/from uint32 and byte arrays.
Memory layout matches Windows DIB format: Blue, Green, Red, Alpha (little-endian). As uint32: 0xAARRGGBB.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.Bgra.B
member.summary: Blue component (0-255).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.Bgra.G
member.summary: Green component (0-255).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.Bgra.R
member.summary: Red component (0-255).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.Bgra.A
member.summary: Alpha component (0-255), where 255 is fully opaque.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.Bgra.#ctor(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Creates a new BGRA color from individual components.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.Bgra.FromUInt(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a BGRA color from a packed uint32 value.
member.returns: A new Bgra struct with unpacked components.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.Bgra.ToUInt
member.summary: Packs this color into a uint32 value.
member.returns: Packed color in 0xAARRGGBB format.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.Bgra.FromBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a BGRA color from a byte array at the specified index.
member.param: Source byte array containing BGRA data.
Starting byte index (must be multiple of 4).
member.returns: A new Bgra struct with components from the array.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.Bgra.WriteTo(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes this color's components to a byte array at the specified index.
member.param: Starting byte index (must be multiple of 4).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.Bgra.ReadUIntFromBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a packed uint32 color directly from a byte array.
member.param: Source byte array containing BGRA data.
Starting byte index (must be multiple of 4).
member.returns: Packed color in 0xAARRGGBB format.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.Bgra.WriteUIntToBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Writes a packed uint32 color directly to a byte array.
member.param: Starting byte index (must be multiple of 4).

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.BrushOverlaySnapshot
member.summary: Immutable snapshot of brush overlay state for rendering the brush cursor preview.

remarks.para: This struct captures the complete state needed to render a brush preview overlay, including cursor position, brush settings, shape tool preview, and shift-line preview.
The snapshot pattern ensures thread-safe rendering - the render thread receives an immutable copy of the brush state at a specific moment in time.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.BrushOverlaySnapshot.HoverX
member.summary: Integer X coordinate of cursor hover position (document space).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.BrushOverlaySnapshot.HoverY
member.summary: Integer Y coordinate of cursor hover position (document space).

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.BrushOverlaySnapshot.Center
member.summary: Legacy float-based center position. Use HoverX/HoverY for precise coordinates.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.BrushOverlaySnapshot.Radius
member.summary: Brush radius for circular preview.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.BrushOverlaySnapshot.Mask
member.summary: Pre-computed pixel offsets relative to brush center.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.BrushOverlaySnapshot.FillGhost
member.summary: Whether to render filled preview pixels.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.BrushOverlaySnapshot.Visible
member.summary: Whether the overlay should be visible at all.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Structs.BrushOverlaySnapshot.BrushSize
member.summary: Current brush size in pixels.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Symmetry.SymmetryService
member.summary: Service for computing symmetry-mirrored points during stroke painting.

remarks.para: SymmetryService transforms input coordinates into multiple output coordinates based on the active symmetry mode. This enables live mirroring during painting operations.

Supported transformations: - Horizontal: Mirror across a vertical axis (left/right) - Vertical: Mirror across a horizontal axis (top/bottom) - Both: Mirror across both axes (four quadrants) - Radial: Rotate points around a center with n-fold symmetry - Kaleidoscope: Radial with additional mirroring within each segment

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Symmetry.SymmetryService.#ctor(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Symmetry.SymmetrySettings)

member.returns: Enumerable of all points to paint, including the original point. If symmetry is disabled, returns only the original point.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tile.TileIO
member.summary: Binary serializer for PixlPunkt tile format (.pxpt).

remarks.para: TileIO provides save/load functionality for the PixlPunkt tile file format (.pxpt), which stores tiles and their mappings independently from the main document. This allows tiles to be exported and imported between documents.

list.item:
Header:
Magic number: 'PXPT' (0x54505850) for format identification
Version: Int32 = 1

Tile Dimensions:
Tile width (Int32)
Tile height (Int32)

Tile Data:
Tile count (Int32)
For each tile: ID (Int32), pixel data length (Int32), pixel data (bytes)

Mapping Data:
Mapping count (Int32) - number of layers with mappings
For each mapping: layer name (string), width (Int32), height (Int32), sparse entries

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BrushSettings
member.summary: Represents the configuration settings for brush-based drawing tools.

remarks.para: BrushSettings controls the appearance and behavior of brush strokes in the painting system. It manages size, shape, opacity, density, and spacing parameters that affect how pixels are applied during drawing operations.

Key concepts: - **Size**: Brush diameter in pixels (1-128) - **Shape**: Geometric shape (Circle or Square) - **Opacity**: How much the brush color affects existing pixels (0-255) - **Density**: Coverage within the brush shape, creating speckled/dithered effects when low (0-255) - **Spacing**: Distance between stamp applications during stroke (1.0 = touching, <1.0 = overlap, >1.0 = gap)

The event fires whenever any setting is modified, allowing UI and rendering systems to respond immediately. Use the setter methods (SetSize, SetShape, etc.) to ensure proper validation and event notification.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BrushSettings.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush size in pixels (diameter).
member.value: An integer from 1 to 128. Default is 1. Use for automatic clamping and change notification.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BrushSettings.Shape
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush shape.
member.value: A enum value (Circle or Square). Default is Circle. Use for change notification.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BrushSettings.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush opacity (alpha value).
member.value: A byte from 0 (fully transparent) to 255 (fully opaque). Default is 255. Use for change notification.
member.remarks: Opacity is multiplied with the paint color's alpha during stroke application. This allows for semi-transparent painting and glazing effects.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BrushSettings.Density
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush density (coverage).
member.value: A byte from 0 (sparse/dithered) to 255 (fully dense). Default is 255.

remarks.para: Density controls how many pixels within the brush shape are affected. At 255, all pixels in the shape are painted. At lower values, a random subset is painted, creating a speckled or spray-paint effect.
This is distinct from opacity: density affects which pixels are touched, while opacity affects how strongly touched pixels are modified.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BrushSettings.Spacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing between brush stamps during a stroke.
member.value: A float where 1.0 means stamps touch edge-to-edge. Values less than 1.0 create overlap, values greater than 1.0 create gaps. Default is 1.0.
member.remarks: Spacing is multiplied by the brush size to determine the distance between successive stamp applications as the cursor moves. Lower values create smoother, more continuous strokes but may be slower. Higher values create dotted lines.

member.name: E:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BrushSettings.Changed
member.summary: Occurs when any brush setting changes.

remarks.para: This event is raised by all setter methods (SetSize, SetShape, SetOpacity, SetDensity). Subscribers receive the entire BrushSettings instance to read the new configuration.
UI controls typically subscribe to this event to update their display, and the brush mask cache subscribes to invalidate cached stamp bitmaps when settings change.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BrushSettings.SetSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the brush size with automatic clamping and change notification.
member.param: The desired size in pixels. Will be clamped to range [1, 128].
member.remarks: Fires the event after updating the value. Prefer this method over directly setting the property to ensure proper validation and event notification.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BrushSettings.SetShape(PixlPunkt.PluginSdk.Imaging.BrushShape)
member.summary: Sets the brush shape and fires the change notification.
member.param: The new brush shape (Circle or Square).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BrushSettings.SetOpacity(System.Byte)
member.summary: Sets the brush opacity and fires the change notification.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BrushSettings.SetDensity(System.Byte)
member.summary: Sets the brush density and fires the change notification.

member.summary: Registration record for brush-category tools that paint strokes on the canvas.

remarks.para: Brush tools use instances to apply pixel operations along stroke paths. This includes standard brushes, erasers, blur, smudge, jumble, replacer, and fill tools.
Some brush tools (like Fill) don't use continuous stroke painting and have a null . These tools use specialized methods in StrokeEngine.

member.param: Factory to create stroke painter, or null for non-stroke tools like Fill.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BuiltInBrushTools
member.summary: Registers all built-in brush tools with the tool registry.

remarks.para: Brush tools paint pixels along stroke paths using implementations. This category includes:

list.item: Brush: Standard painting brush
Eraser: Removes pixels (paints transparency)
Replacer: Replaces foreground color with background
Blur: Applies gaussian blur along stroke
Jumble: Randomizes/scrambles pixels
Smudge: Smears colors along stroke direction
Gradient: Cycles through palette colors for highlights/shadows
Fill: Flood fill or global color replacement

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BuiltInBrushTools.RegisterAll(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolRegistry,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolState)
member.summary: Registers all built-in brush tools with the specified registry.
member.param: The ToolState instance containing settings objects.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BuiltInSelectionTools
member.summary: Registers all built-in selection tools with the tool registry.

remarks.para: Selection tools create and manipulate pixel selections on the canvas. This category includes:

list.item: Rectangle Select: Marquee selection of rectangular regions
Magic Wand: Color-based flood selection
Lasso: Freehand polygon selection
Paint Select: Brush-based selection painting

remarks.para: Selection tools use instances created via factory functions that receive a for dependency injection.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BuiltInSelectionTools.RegisterAll(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolRegistry,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolState)
member.summary: Registers all built-in selection tools with the specified registry.
member.param: The ToolState instance containing settings objects.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BuiltInShapeTools
member.summary: Registers all built-in shape tools with the tool registry.

remarks.para: Shape tools draw geometric primitives on the canvas. This category includes:

list.item: Rectangle: Draws axis-aligned rectangles (filled or outlined) via
Ellipse: Draws ellipses and circles (filled or outlined) via

remarks.para: Shape tools use for geometry generation and for pixel application. The default renderer () provides brush-stroked rendering with proper alpha blending and density falloff.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BuiltInShapeTools.RegisterAll(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolRegistry,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolState)
member.summary: Registers all built-in shape tools with the specified registry.
member.param: The ToolState instance containing settings objects.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BuiltInTileTools
member.summary: Registers all built-in tile tools with the tool registry.

remarks.para: Tile tools perform tile-based editing operations on the canvas. This category includes:

list.item: TileStamper: Places tiles with optional mapping via
TileModifier: Offsets, rotates, and scales tile content via
TileAnimation: Paints tile selections for animation reels via

remarks.para: Each tile tool provides an that encapsulates its input handling logic, following the same pattern as brush painters and shape builders.
All tile tools support RMB tile sampling. When the user right-clicks, the tile under the cursor and its mapping are captured for subsequent operations.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BuiltInTileTools.RegisterAll(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolRegistry,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolState)
member.summary: Registers all built-in tile tools with the specified registry.
member.param: The ToolState instance containing settings objects.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BuiltInUtilityTools
member.summary: Registers all built-in utility tools with the tool registry.

remarks.para: Utility tools perform viewport or state operations without modifying pixel data. This category includes:

list.item: Pan: Scrolls the canvas viewport via
Zoom: Changes canvas magnification via
Dropper: Samples colors from the canvas via
Symmetry: Toggles live stroke mirroring modes

remarks.para: Each utility tool provides an that encapsulates its input handling logic, following the same pattern as brush painters and shape builders.

member.param: The ToolState instance containing settings objects.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolBehavior
member.summary: Defines tool-specific behavior hints that the UI consults for routing and display.

remarks.para: provides declarative metadata about how a tool interacts with input and renders overlays. This enables the UI layer to:

list.item: Route pointer events without hardcoded tool ID checks
Determine overlay visibility and style dynamically
Support plugin tools with consistent behavior

remarks.para: Tool registrations implement this interface alongside .

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolBehavior.ToolId
member.summary: Gets the tool ID this behavior describes.
member.value: The same ID as the associated .

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolBehavior.InputPattern
member.summary: Gets the input interaction pattern for this tool.
member.value: A indicating how pointer events should be routed (click, stroke, two-point drag, etc.).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolBehavior.HandlesRightClick
member.summary: Gets whether the tool handles right-click specially.
member.value: true if the tool has custom RMB behavior (e.g., Dropper BG sampling); false if RMB should trigger momentary dropper for FG sampling.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolBehavior.SuppressRmbDropper
member.summary: Gets whether the tool suppresses the RMB momentary dropper behavior.
member.value: true to disable RMB dropper (e.g., for utility tools like Pan, Zoom); false (default) to allow RMB dropper for quick color sampling.
member.remarks:
This is separate from . A tool may:
Handle RMB (HandlesRightClick=true) and NOT suppress dropper - RMB does tool action
NOT handle RMB (HandlesRightClick=false) and suppress dropper - RMB does nothing
Both false - RMB triggers momentary dropper (default brush tool behavior)
Typically set to true for utility tools and selection tools where RMB dropper would be unexpected.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolBehavior.SupportsModifiers
member.summary: Gets whether the tool supports Shift/Ctrl modifiers for constraints.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolBehavior.UsesPainter

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolBehavior.ModifiesPixels
member.summary: Gets whether the tool modifies pixel data.
member.value: true for painting/editing tools; false for viewport-only tools (Pan, Zoom, Dropper).

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolLifecycle
member.summary: Lifecycle interface for tools that need to respond to activation and deactivation events.

remarks.para: provides hooks for tools that need to perform setup or cleanup when the user switches tools. This is optional - implement only if your tool requires it.

list.item: Selection tools: Reset drag state, clear preview geometry
Custom tools: Start/stop timers, subscribe/unsubscribe from events
Resource-heavy tools: Load/unload assets on demand
Stateful tools: Save/restore tool state across activations

remarks.para:
Lifecycle Order:
1. Previous tool's is called
2. ToolState updates active tool ID
3. New tool's is called
4. ToolActivated event fires

list.item: may be called multiple times if tool is reselected
is guaranteed before unload (app close, plugin unload)
Implementations should be idempotent (safe to call multiple times)

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolLifecycle.OnActivate
member.summary: Called when the tool becomes the active tool.

remarks.para: Use this to:

list.item: Subscribe to canvas events
Initialize tool-specific state
Load resources needed during tool use
Show tool-specific UI overlays

remarks.para: This method should be safe to call multiple times (idempotent).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolLifecycle.OnDeactivate
member.summary: Called when the tool is no longer the active tool.

remarks.para: Use this to:

list.item: Unsubscribe from canvas events
Clear any in-progress operations
Release resources not needed when inactive
Hide tool-specific UI overlays

remarks.para: This method should be safe to call multiple times (idempotent). It will be called before the app closes or the plugin is unloaded.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolRegistration
member.summary: Base interface for all tool registrations in the unified tool registry.

remarks.para: provides a common interface for all tool types, enabling a unified registry that can store utility, selection, brush, and shape tools.
Each tool category has a specific implementation:

list.item: - Brush tools with
- Selection tools with

remarks.para: The property determines which engine handles the tool at runtime.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolRegistration.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for the tool.
member.value: A string following the convention {vendor}.{category}.{name}. For example: "pixlpunkt.brush.brush" or "com.plugin.select.smartedge".
member.remarks: Use constants for built-in tools to avoid magic strings. Plugin tools should use their vendor namespace prefix.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolRegistration.Category
member.summary: Gets the category that determines engine routing.
member.value: A value indicating which system handles this tool: Utility (no engine), Select (selection engine), Brush (stroke engine), or Shape (shape engine).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolRegistration.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets the human-readable display name for UI.
member.value: A localized string suitable for display in menus, tooltips, and tool panels.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolRegistration.Settings
member.summary: Gets the tool-specific settings object.
member.value: The settings instance for this tool, or null for tools without configurable settings (e.g., Pan, Zoom, Dropper).
member.remarks: Settings are typically subclasses of and may implement for brush-style tools.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.IToolRegistry
member.summary: Interface for unified tool registration and discovery.

remarks.para: provides a single registry for all tool types:

list.item: - Brush tools with stroke painters
- Tile tools for tile-based editing
- Shape tools for geometric primitives
- Selection tools with interactive UI
- Utility tools (pan, zoom, dropper)

remarks.para: All registration types implement for unified lookup, with category-specific queries available for type-safe access.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Selection.SelectionToolContext
member.summary: Context passed to selection tool factories for dependency injection.

remarks.para: provides all dependencies needed by selection tools without requiring constructor parameter sprawl. Tools receive this context when created by the factory and use it to interact with the document and UI.

list.item: GetSelectionRegion: Access to the current selection mask.
RequestRedraw: Trigger canvas invalidation for preview updates.
GetDocumentSize: Current document dimensions for bounds checking.
GetActiveLayer: Access to active raster layer for pixel sampling (wand tool).
GetBrushOffsets: Brush shape offsets for paint selection tool.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Selection.SelectionToolContext.GetSelectionRegion
member.summary: Gets the function to retrieve the current selection region.
member.remarks: Selection tools use this to add/subtract from the selection mask.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Selection.SelectionToolContext.RequestRedraw
member.summary: Gets the action to request a canvas redraw.
member.remarks: Called when preview geometry changes to trigger visual update.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Selection.SelectionToolContext.GetDocumentSize
member.summary: Gets the function to retrieve document pixel dimensions.
member.remarks: Returns (width, height) tuple for bounds checking and region sizing.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Selection.SelectionToolContext.GetActiveLayer
member.summary: Gets the function to retrieve the active raster layer.
member.remarks: Used by wand tool for pixel sampling. Returns null if no raster layer is active.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Selection.SelectionToolContext.GetBrushOffsets
member.summary: Gets the function to retrieve current brush shape offsets.
member.remarks: Used by paint selection tool to determine which pixels to select based on brush shape. Returns empty collection if no brush configuration is available.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Selection.WandSelectionTool
member.summary: Magic wand selection tool for selecting regions of similar color.

remarks.para: WandSelectionTool allows users to click on a pixel to select all similar colors. Configuration includes: - Tolerance: Color distance threshold (0-255) - Contiguous: Flood-fill vs. global selection - UseAlpha: Include alpha channel in comparison - EightWay: 8-way vs. 4-way connectivity
The tool reads settings directly from to ensure UI changes are immediately reflected in tool behavior.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.GradientFillToolSettings
member.summary: Settings for the Gradient Fill tool.

remarks.para: The Gradient Fill tool creates gradients by dragging from a start point to an end point. Supports linear, radial, angular, and diamond gradient types with various dithering styles.
Dithering is essential for pixel art to create smooth color transitions with limited palettes. The tool supports ordered dithering (Bayer matrices), pattern-based dithering, and error diffusion.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.SymmetryToolSettings
member.summary: Settings for the Symmetry utility tool.

remarks.para: The symmetry tool controls live stroke mirroring during painting operations. When active, all brush strokes are automatically mirrored across the configured axes.
Supports horizontal/vertical axis mirroring, both axes combined, and radial (mandala) symmetry with configurable segment counts.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.TileModifierToolSettings
member.summary: Settings for the Tile Modifier tool.

remarks.para: The Tile Modifier edits tile content in place with offset, rotate, and scale operations.

list.item: LMB drag: Offset tile content (tessellating wrap)
Ctrl + LMB drag: Rotate tile content within bounds
Shift + LMB drag: Scale tile content in drag direction
RMB: Sample tile and mapping (tile dropper)

remarks.para: On release, content outside tile bounds is clipped. Only pixels within the tile boundary are preserved.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.TileModifierToolSettings.Shortcut
member.summary: Gets the default keyboard shortcut for the Tile Modifier tool (Ctrl+T).

member.summary: Gets whether offset operations wrap content around tile edges (tessellation).

member.summary: Gets whether rotation is constrained to 15-degree increments.

member.summary: Gets the rotation interpolation mode.

member.summary: Gets the scale interpolation mode.

member.summary: Sets whether offset operations wrap content.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.TileStamperToolSettings
member.summary: Settings for the Tile Stamper tool.

remarks.para: The Tile Stamper places tiles on the canvas with optional mapping data.

list.item: LMB: Place tile with mapping
Shift + LMB: Place tile without mapping (when snap enabled)
Ctrl + LMB: Create new tile from area under stamp
RMB: Sample tile and mapping (tile dropper)

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.TileStamperToolSettings.SnapToGrid
member.summary: Gets whether tile placement snaps to the tile grid.
member.remarks: When true, tiles align to grid positions and mapping data is written. When false, tiles can be placed freely (stamper mode) without mapping.

member.summary: Gets the currently selected tile ID for stamping.
member.value: The tile ID, or -1 if no tile is selected.

member.summary: Sets the selected tile ID for stamping.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.CustomWindowOption
member.summary: Custom window option for opening a tool-specific configuration window.

remarks.para: Renders as a button that opens a custom WinUI window using . Use this as an "escape hatch" for complex configuration that can't be expressed as simple toolbar controls.
Note: This option type is Core-only because it requires which is not available in the SDK. Plugin developers should use with custom dialog handling instead.

member.param: Optional FluentUI icon for the button.
Factory function that creates the window instance.
Title for the window. If null, uses Label.
Whether the window can be resized. Default is false.
Whether the window can be minimized. Default is false.
Minimum window width in logical pixels. Default is 400.
Minimum window height in logical pixels. Default is 300.
Maximum fraction of screen to occupy (0.0-1.0). Default is 0.90.
