member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.ToolSettingsBase
member.summary: Base class for tool-specific settings with change notification and dynamic UI generation.

remarks.para: provides the foundation for all tool settings classes with:

list.item: Identity: Icon, display name, description, and keyboard shortcut
Change Notification: event for settings updates
Dynamic UI: for toolbar control generation

remarks.para: Keyboard shortcuts use SDK's type which supports matching against both SDK and integer key codes (for platform interop).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.ToolSettingsBase.Icon
member.summary: Gets the icon representing this tool in the UI.
member.value: A value. Default is .
member.remarks: Override in derived classes to provide a tool-specific icon that appears in the tool rail and toolbar.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.ToolSettingsBase.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets the display name for this tool.
member.value: A human-readable name shown in tooltips and labels. Default is "Tool".

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.ToolSettingsBase.Description
member.summary: Gets a brief description of what this tool does.
member.value: A short description for tooltips and help text. Default is empty string.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.ToolSettingsBase.Shortcut
member.summary: Gets the keyboard shortcut to activate this tool.
member.value: A for the shortcut, or null if no shortcut is assigned. Use SDK's enum for the key parameter.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.ToolSettingsBase.TooltipText
member.summary: Gets a formatted tooltip string including name, shortcut, and description.
member.value: A multi-line string suitable for tooltip display, formatted as: "Tool Name (Shortcut)\nDescription"

member.name: E:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.ToolSettingsBase.Changed
member.summary: Occurs when any setting in this tool configuration changes.

remarks.para: Subscribe to this event to respond to settings changes (e.g., update brush preview, refresh UI, persist settings).
Derived classes should call in property setters.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.ToolSettingsBase.RaiseChanged
member.summary: Raises the event to notify listeners of a setting change.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.ToolSettingsBase.GetOptions
member.summary: Returns the list of options to display in the toolbar for this tool.
member.returns: An enumerable of descriptors that the converts to WinUI controls.

remarks.para: Override in derived classes to expose tool settings to the dynamic toolbar. The options are ordered by their property.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.WandToolSettings
member.summary: Settings for the Wand (magic wand) selection tool.

remarks.para: The wand tool selects pixels by color similarity. Settings control: - Tolerance: How much color deviation is allowed (0 = exact, 255 = all colors) - Contiguous: Whether to flood-fill (connected only) or select all matching globally - UseAlpha: Whether to include alpha channel in color comparison - EightWay: Whether to use 8-way connectivity (diagonals) or 4-way (orthogonal only)

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.WandToolSettings.SelectionSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the shared selection settings (injected by ToolState).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.WandToolSettings.Tolerance
member.summary: Gets the color tolerance for wand selection (0-255).
member.remarks: 0 = exact color match only, 255 = matches all colors. Higher values select a wider range of similar colors.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.WandToolSettings.Contiguous
member.summary: Gets whether wand uses contiguous (flood-fill) mode.
member.remarks: When true, only connected pixels are selected (flood-fill). When false, all matching pixels in the entire image are selected.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.WandToolSettings.UseAlpha
member.summary: Gets whether alpha channel is included in color comparison.
member.remarks: When true, transparency differences affect color matching. When false, only RGB values are compared (ignoring alpha).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.WandToolSettings.EightWay
member.summary: Gets whether 8-way connectivity is used for contiguous selection.
member.remarks: When true, diagonal neighbors are considered connected (8-way). When false, only orthogonal neighbors count (4-way: up/down/left/right). Only applies when Contiguous is true.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.WandToolSettings.SetTolerance(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the wand tolerance (0-255).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.WandToolSettings.SetContiguous(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether wand uses contiguous (flood-fill) mode.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.WandToolSettings.SetUseAlpha(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether alpha channel is included in color comparison.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.WandToolSettings.SetEightWay(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether 8-way connectivity is used.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.ZoomToolSettings
member.summary: Settings for the Zoom utility tool.

remarks.para: Zoom allows viewport magnification. Settings include:

list.item: Icon and shortcut for toolbar

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Shapes.EllipseShapeBuilder
member.summary: Shape builder for ellipses and circles.

remarks.para:
Generates pixel sets for ellipses using the midpoint ellipse algorithm. Supports:
Filled mode: All pixels within the ellipse boundary
Outline mode: Only the 1-pixel ellipse perimeter
Shift modifier: Constrains to perfect circles
Ctrl modifier: Draws from center outward
The algorithm uses integer arithmetic for pixel-perfect rendering suitable for pixel art.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Shapes.EllipseShapeBuilder.RasterizeEllipse(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.ValueTuple{System.Int32,System.Int32}})
member.summary: Rasterizes an ellipse using the midpoint algorithm.
member.param: True to fill, false for outline only.
Output set to populate with pixel coordinates.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Shapes.EllipseShapeBuilder.AddHorizontalSpan(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.ValueTuple{System.Int32,System.Int32}})
member.summary: Adds all points in a horizontal span to the point set.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Shapes.RectangleShapeBuilder
member.summary: Shape builder for rectangles and squares.

remarks.para:
Generates pixel sets for axis-aligned rectangles. Supports:
Filled mode: All pixels within the bounding box
Outline mode: Only the 1-pixel border
Shift modifier: Constrains to perfect squares
Ctrl modifier: Draws from center outward

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ShapeToolRegistration
member.summary: Registration record for shape-category tools that draw geometric primitives.

remarks.para: Shape tools create geometric forms like rectangles, ellipses, and custom shapes. The architecture separates geometry generation () from pixel rendering (), enabling plugin extensibility:

list.item: Custom shapes: Provide an with default renderer
Custom rendering: Provide an for special effects
Full control: Provide both builder and renderer

remarks.para: For line-based tools like Gradient, use instead.

member.param: Shape renderer for pixel application (null = use default).
Factory to create painter for line-based shapes (e.g., Gradient).

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.TileToolRegistration
member.summary: Registration record for tile-category tools.

remarks.para: Tile tools perform tile-based editing operations:

list.item: TileStamper: Places tiles with optional mapping data.
TileModifier: Offsets, rotates, and scales tile content.

remarks.para: Each tile tool provides an that encapsulates its input handling logic, following the same pattern as:

list.item: for brush tools
for shape tools
for selection tools
for utility tools

remarks.para: All tile tools support RMB tile sampling. When the user right-clicks, the tile under the cursor and its mapping are captured for subsequent operations.

member.param: Factory function to create the tile handler.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Tile.TileAnimationHandler
member.summary: Handler for the Tile Animation tool.

list.item: LMB drag: Select tile positions on canvas for animation frames (row-major order)
Shift + LMB: Add to existing frames instead of replacing
RMB: Sample tile (tile dropper)

remarks.para: Tiles are selected based on their grid position on the canvas (row-major order). Each frame stores a tile position (tileX, tileY) which references pixels drawn at that grid location - NOT necessarily mapped TileSet tiles.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Tile.TileModifierHandler
member.summary: Handler for the Tile Modifier tool.

list.item: LMB drag: Offset tile content (tessellating wrap)
Ctrl + LMB drag: Rotate tile content within bounds
Shift + LMB drag: Scale tile content in drag direction
RMB: Sample tile and mapping (tile dropper)

remarks.para: On release, content outside tile bounds is clipped. Only pixels within the tile boundary are preserved. Changes are propagated to all mapped instances of the tile.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolIds
member.summary: Provides string constants for all built-in tool identifiers.

remarks.para: Tool IDs follow the convention: {vendor}.{category}.{name}
Built-in tools use the pixlpunkt vendor prefix. Third-party plugins should use their own vendor prefix (e.g., com.company.category.toolname).
These constants should be used instead of string literals throughout the codebase to enable compile-time checking and easy refactoring.

member.summary: Registration record for a brush/stroke-based tool, containing all information needed to instantiate and use the tool.

remarks.para: encapsulates:

list.item: Id: Unique string identifier (e.g., "pixlpunkt.brush.brush").
Category: Tool category for engine routing.
DisplayName: Human-readable name shown in UI.
Settings: The tool's configuration object (implements IStrokeSettings if stroke-based).
PainterFactory: Factory function to create the tool's painter.

remarks.para: Built-in tools are registered at application startup via . Plugin tools can be registered dynamically through .

member.param: Unique string identifier following vendor.category.name convention.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolRegistry
member.summary: Default implementation of providing unified tool registration.

remarks.para: provides centralized tool management with:

list.item: Static Shared Property: Easy global access via ToolRegistry.Shared.
Category Queries: Type-safe access to tools by category.
Thread-Safe Registration: Uses locking for concurrent access.
String ID Lookup: Primary lookup via string IDs.
Plugin Support: Events for dynamic tool registration/unregistration.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolState
member.summary: Centralized state management for all drawing and editing tools in the application.

remarks.para: ToolState maintains the currently active tool, tool-specific settings (brush, shape, fill, etc.), and provides events for UI synchronization when settings change. It supports temporary tool overrides (e.g., holding spacebar for Pan tool) and manages state for complex tools like the gradient brush and selection transformations.
This class serves as the single source of truth for tool configuration, allowing UI panels and canvas hosts to remain synchronized without direct coupling.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolState.CurrentToolId
member.summary: Gets the base tool ID selected by the user (ignoring temporary overrides).
member.remarks: Tool IDs follow the convention vendor.category.name (e.g., "pixlpunkt.brush.brush").

member.summary: Gets the temporary tool override ID, if any (e.g., spacebar-held Pan tool).

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolState.ActiveToolId
member.summary: Gets the active tool ID, considering temporary overrides.
member.remarks: This is the preferred property for determining which tool is currently in use.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolState.TryActivateByShortcut(Windows.System.VirtualKey,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Attempts to find and activate a tool matching the given key binding. Uses custom shortcut overrides from ShortcutSettings when available.
member.returns: True if a matching tool was found and activated; false otherwise.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolState.UpdateBrush(System.Action{PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.BrushSettings})
member.summary: Updates the universal BrushSettings via a mutator action. Also synchronizes with the active tool's settings if it implements IBrushLikeSettings.
member.remarks: This method allows universal brush shortcuts (like [ ] for size, Ctrl+wheel) to affect the currently active brush-like tool. IMPORTANT: First syncs FROM the active tool to avoid desync where universal Brush has stale/default values.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolState.SyncBrushToActiveTool
member.summary: Synchronizes the universal BrushSettings to the active tool's IBrushLikeSettings.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolState.SyncBrushToSettingsViaInterfaces(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Settings.ToolSettingsBase)
member.summary: Synchronizes brush settings via interface-based duck typing. Used for plugin tools that implement IStrokeSettings, IOpacitySettings, IDensitySettings. DynamicDependency attributes ensure methods are preserved during trimming.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolState.SyncBrushFromActiveTool
member.summary: Synchronizes the universal BrushSettings from the active tool's settings. Call this when switching tools to pick up the tool's current settings.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.ToolState.SyncBrushFromActiveToolQuiet
member.summary: Synchronizes the universal BrushSettings from the active tool's settings WITHOUT firing BrushChanged. Used internally by UpdateBrush to avoid recursive event firing.
member.returns: True if sync was performed, false if active tool doesn't have stroke settings.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.UtilityToolRegistration
member.summary: Registration record for utility-category tools that don't paint pixels.

remarks.para: Utility tools perform viewport or state operations without modifying pixel data:

list.item: Pan: Scrolls the canvas viewport.
Zoom: Changes canvas magnification.
Dropper: Samples colors from the canvas.

remarks.para: Each utility tool provides an that encapsulates its input handling logic, following the same pattern as:

list.item: for brush tools
for shape tools
for selection tools

member.param: Factory function to create the utility handler.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Utility.DropperHandler
member.summary: Dropper tool handler - samples colors from the canvas.

remarks.para: handles:

list.item: Left click/drag to sample foreground color
Right click/drag to sample foreground color (momentary dropper from other tools)
Alt + Right click/drag to sample background color
Live preview during drag (fires sampling events)

remarks.para: The dropper preserves the current brush opacity when setting the foreground color, merging only the RGB portion of the sampled color.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Utility.DropperHandler.#ctor(PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Tools.Utility.IUtilityContext,System.Byte)
member.summary: Creates a new DropperHandler with the specified context.
member.param: The utility context for canvas operations.
Current brush opacity (0-255) to preserve when sampling FG.

member.summary: Gets or sets the current brush opacity to preserve when sampling foreground.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether Alt key is held (for BG sampling with RMB).

member.summary: Samples a color and sets it as background (always opaque).

for selection tools

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Viewport.ZoomController
member.summary: Manages zoom level and pan offset for viewport transformations, converting between screen coordinates and document coordinates.

remarks.para: The ZoomController maintains the transformation matrix for displaying a document within a viewport. It handles zoom-in/out, panning, fitting to view, and coordinate conversion between screen space and document space.

Typical usage: 1. Call with document pixel dimensions 2. Call with viewport pixel dimensions 3. Use or to set initial view 4. Use and for user interaction 5. Use coordinate conversion methods for hit-testing and rendering

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Viewport.ZoomController.Scale
member.summary: Gets the current zoom scale factor.
member.value: A value where 1.0 represents 100% (actual size), 0.5 is 50%, 2.0 is 200%, etc. Typically clamped between 0.05 and 64.0.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Viewport.ZoomController.Offset
member.summary: Gets the current pan offset in screen coordinates.
member.value: The offset from the screen origin (0,0) to the document origin after scaling. Positive values move the document right/down in screen space.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Viewport.ZoomController.SetDocSize(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the document dimensions in pixels.
member.param: The width of the document in pixels.
The height of the document in pixels.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Viewport.ZoomController.SetViewportSize(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the viewport dimensions in pixels.
member.param: The width of the viewport in pixels.
The height of the viewport in pixels.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Viewport.ZoomController.GetDestRect
member.summary: Calculates the destination rectangle for rendering the document in screen coordinates.
member.returns: A rectangle defining where the document should be drawn in the viewport, accounting for current scale and offset.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Viewport.ZoomController.Fit(System.Double)
member.summary: Adjusts the scale and offset to fit the entire document in the viewport with padding.
member.param: The padding in pixels to leave around the document. Default is 16.
member.remarks: Calculates the scale that will fit the document entirely within the viewport, maintaining aspect ratio, then centers the document. No action is taken if viewport or document dimensions are invalid.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Viewport.ZoomController.Actual
member.summary: Sets the scale to 1.0 (100%, actual size) and centers the document in the viewport.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Viewport.ZoomController.ZoomAt(Windows.Foundation.Point,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Zooms in or out at a specific screen point, maintaining that point's position.
member.param: The screen coordinate to zoom towards (typically mouse position).
The zoom multiplier. Values greater than 1.0 zoom in, less than 1.0 zoom out. Clamped to range [0.05, 20.0].
The minimum allowed scale. Default is 0.05 (5%).
The maximum allowed scale. Default is 64.0 (6400%).
member.remarks: This method adjusts the scale and offset such that the document point under remains at the same screen position after zooming. This creates an intuitive "zoom to cursor" behavior.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Viewport.ZoomController.Center
member.summary: Centers the document in the viewport at the current scale.
member.remarks: Calculates the offset that places the document's center at the viewport's center.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Viewport.ZoomController.PanBy(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Adjusts the pan offset by the specified delta.
member.param: The horizontal delta in screen pixels (positive = right).
The vertical delta in screen pixels (positive = down).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Viewport.ZoomController.ScreenToDoc(Windows.Foundation.Point)
member.summary: Converts a screen coordinate to document coordinate space.
member.returns: The corresponding document coordinate (may be outside document bounds).
member.remarks: Formula: docCoord = (screenCoord - offset) / scale

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Viewport.ZoomController.DocToScreen(Windows.Foundation.Point)
member.summary: Converts a document coordinate to screen coordinate space.
member.returns: The corresponding screen coordinate.
member.remarks: Formula: screenCoord = offset + (docCoord * scale)

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Viewport.ZoomController.ScreenToDocClamped(Windows.Foundation.Point,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Converts a screen coordinate to document coordinate space and clamps to document bounds.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the X coordinate in document space, floored to an integer.
When this method returns, contains the Y coordinate in document space, floored to an integer.
member.returns: true if the converted coordinate is within document bounds; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This is useful for determining if a mouse click is within the document bounds and getting the corresponding pixel coordinate for editing operations.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Animation.AnimationPanel.OrderedTrackItem.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.CanvasAnimationTrack,PixlPunkt.Uno.Core.Animation.AnimationSubRoutine)
member.summary: Represents an item in the ordered track list (either a layer or sub-routine).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Animation.AnimationPanel.BuildOrderedTrackList
member.summary:
Builds an ordered list of layers and sub-routines for display.
Tracks in CanvasAnimationState are stored in UI order (top-to-bottom, matching the Layers panel). Track 0 = top layer (e.g., Foreground), last track = bottom layer (e.g., Background).
For Z-ordering: higher Z = renders on top = should appear at TOP of timeline list. So we invert the track indices: last track (Background) gets Z=0, first track (Foreground) gets Z=N-1. Sub-routines use their explicit ZOrder property.
Final sort is DESCENDING by Z-order so highest Z appears first in the list.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.CanvasHost.CanvasViewHost
member.summary: Brush overlay subsystem for CanvasViewHost: - Brush cursor overlay rendering - OnBrushMoved snapshot management - Brush outline drawing - Tile overlay rendering
member.remarks: This class caches frequently allocated objects (Dictionaries, HashSets, arrays) to minimize GC pressure during rendering. Shift-line preview and outline rendering are called every frame during painting operations.
member.summary: Gradient fill tool subsystem for CanvasViewHost: - Gradient drag state machine - Gradient preview rendering
History, selection lift/commit, and undo/redo orchestration for CanvasViewHost. Uses the unified history stack on the document for all operations.
Input handling subsystem for CanvasViewHost: - Pointer event handlers (pressed, moved, released) - Mouse wheel handling - Keyboard state helpers - Cursor management
Partial class for interleaved rendering of layers and sub-routines.

remarks.para: This partial class extends with functionality to composite animation sub-routines at the correct Z-order relative to document layers. Sub-routines are tile animations that can be embedded within canvas animations with transform keyframes.
The Z-order system determines the visual stacking order of layers and sub-routines:

list.item: Lower Z = Behind: Items with lower Z-order values render first and appear behind items with higher Z values.
Higher Z = In Front: Items with higher Z-order values render last and appear in front of items with lower Z values.

remarks.para: Layer Z-orders are derived from their track position in :

list.item: Track 0 (top of UI, e.g., "Foreground") ? Z = trackCount - 1 (highest)
Track N-1 (bottom of UI, e.g., "Background") ? Z = 0 (lowest)

remarks.para: Sub-routines have an explicit property that can be modified via context menu (Move Up/Down, Bring to Front/Send to Back).
When items share the same Z-order value:

list.item: Sub-routines render BEFORE (behind) layers at the same Z level.
Among multiple sub-routines at the same Z, items lower in the timeline UI render first (behind).

remarks.para: This ensures the visual timeline order matches the rendered output: items appearing lower in the timeline panel are rendered behind items appearing higher.

member.summary: Painting subsystem for CanvasViewHost: - Painting state machine - Stroke begin/commit - Painter management - Tool-specific press/move handlers - Shift-line and angle snapping support - Pixel-perfect mode for 1px brushes
Reference layer interaction subsystem for CanvasViewHost: - Selection, dragging, resizing, rotating reference layers - Cursor management for reference layer handles - Hit testing and manipulation
Rendering subsystem for CanvasViewHost (SkiaSharp implementation): - Main draw pipeline - Background/surface rendering - Grid overlays (pixel, tile) - Guide overlays - Checkerboard pattern management
Ruler and guide management for CanvasViewHost.

Selection subsystem for CanvasViewHost: - Creates, previews, and edits selections (marquee, move, scale, rotate). - Supports floating selections with full history (lift/commit/cancel). - Renders marching ants and interactive handles (scale/rotate). - Integrates system clipboard for copy/cut/paste. - Keeps ToolState synchronized with selection presence and transforms.
This partial class delegates to specialized subsystem classes: - SelectionSubsystem: State management - SelectionHitTesting: Handle and body hit detection - SelectionRenderer: Visual rendering - SelectionTransformOps: Scale/rotate/pivot calculations - SelectionClipboard: Copy/cut/paste operations
Shape tool subsystem for CanvasViewHost: - Shape drag state machine - Shape preview rendering - Modifier key handling (Shift for square, Ctrl for center)

Tile tool subsystem for CanvasViewHost: - Tile handler management - ITileContext implementation - Tile overlay preview state - Tile mapping propagation after painting - Live update when tiles are modified externally (e.g., tessellation window)
Utility tool subsystem for CanvasViewHost: - IUtilityContext adapter implementation - Utility handler lifecycle management
Viewport subsystem for CanvasViewHost: - Zoom in/out/actual - Pan navigation - Fit to screen - Viewport tracking and events

Hosts an SKCanvasElement for rendering and interacting with a pixel-art document. Uses Uno's direct Skia integration for hardware-accelerated rendering.
This is the core partial class containing: - Fields and properties - Construction and initialization - Document hooks and composition - Tool state binding and synchronization - Shared utility methods used by other partials
Other functionality is split into partial classes: - CanvasViewHost.Rendering.cs: Draw methods, grids, background - CanvasViewHost.Input.cs: Pointer events, wheel, keyboard - CanvasViewHost.Painting.cs: Stroke painting, commit, painters - CanvasViewHost.Shapes.cs: Shape tools, preview, modifiers - CanvasViewHost.BrushOverlay.cs: Cursor overlay, snapshot - CanvasViewHost.Viewport.cs: Zoom, pan, fit, viewport tracking - CanvasViewHost.Selection.cs: Selection tools, transforms, ants - CanvasViewHost.History.cs: Undo/redo, lift/commit

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.CanvasHost.Selection.SelectionClipboard
member.summary: Handles clipboard operations (copy, cut, paste, delete) for selections.

remarks.para: SelectionClipboard manages the following operations: - Copy: Copies selected pixels to internal and system clipboard - Cut: Copies selected pixels then clears the selection - Paste: Creates a floating selection from clipboard data - Delete: Clears selected pixels or discards floating buffer
Clipboard Architecture: The class maintains an internal staging buffer for quick paste operations and also synchronizes with the system clipboard for cross-application support.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.CanvasHost.Selection.SelectionHitTesting
member.summary: Handles hit testing for selection handles, rotation handles, pivot, and selection body.

remarks.para: SelectionHitTesting provides coordinate-space-aware hit detection for interactive selection elements: - Scale handles (8 points: corners and edge midpoints) - Rotation handles (8 points outside the selection) - Pivot handle (center or custom position) - Selection body (inside the transformed selection area)
Coordinate Spaces: Hit testing operates in view coordinates but accounts for document-space transformations (rotation, scale) via the ZoomController.

member.summary: Gets or sets the function to retrieve the zoom controller.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.CanvasHost.Selection.SelectionInputHandler
member.summary: Handles pointer input events for selection operations.

remarks.para: SelectionInputHandler processes pointer pressed, moved, and released events to enable: - Marquee selection creation - Selection movement (dragging) - Scale handle manipulation - Rotation handle manipulation - Pivot point adjustment
Coordinate Flow: Input arrives in view coordinates and is converted to document coordinates via the provided ViewToDoc callback.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.CanvasHost.Selection.SelectionRenderer
member.summary: Handles rendering of selection visuals including marching ants, handles, and floating selections. Uses ICanvasRenderer abstraction for cross-platform compatibility (SkiaSharp).
member.remarks: This class caches frequently allocated objects (Lists, byte arrays) to minimize GC pressure during rendering. Selection visuals are drawn every frame while a selection is active.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.CanvasHost.Selection.SelectionSubsystem
member.summary: Encapsulates all selection state and coordinates selection subsystem components.

remarks.para: SelectionSubsystem is the central coordinator for selection functionality in CanvasViewHost. It manages: - Selection state (active, floating, armed) - Floating buffer data and transform parameters - Pivot point configuration for rotation - Coordination between input handling, hit testing, rendering, and clipboard operations
Architecture: This class owns the selection state and provides access to specialized handlers (input, hit testing, rendering, clipboard) that operate on that state.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.CanvasHost.Selection.SelectionTransformOps
member.summary: Handles transform operations (scale, rotate, pivot) for selections.

remarks.para: SelectionTransformOps provides the mathematical calculations for interactive transform operations: - Scale handle dragging with proper anchor-based scaling - Rotation calculations around the pivot point - Pivot point positioning and snapping
Coordinate Spaces: Transform operations work in document space but account for the cumulative rotation when computing handle positions and scale deltas.

member.summary: Gets or sets the action to request a canvas redraw.

member.summary: Gets or sets the function to get the tool state.

member.summary: Gets or sets the function to check if applying from tool state.

member.summary: Updates scale based on handle drag position.
member.remarks: Uses anchor-based scaling with proper rotation support: 1. Computes handle position in global space at drag start 2. Computes new scale based on pointer movement in local space 3. Repositions selection so anchor stays fixed in global space

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.ColorPick.Controls.TriangleCurveEditor
member.summary:
Interactive SkiaSharp control for editing a piecewise cubic Bzier curve with fixed anchors. The curve forms a triangle shape with a peak at the center, used for gradient falloff editing.
Fixed anchors: Start (-1, 0), Mid (0, 1), End (1, 0) Editable control points: Start_out, Mid_left, Mid_right, End_in
The curve is split into two cubic segments: - Left segment: Start Mid (controlled by Start_out and Mid_left) - Right segment: Mid End (controlled by Mid_right and End_in)

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.ColorPick.Controls.TriangleCurveEditor.HANDLE_OUT
member.summary: Outer (black) ring radius for control point handles.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.ColorPick.Controls.TriangleCurveEditor.HANDLE_IN
member.summary: Inner (white) ring radius for control point handles.

member.name: F:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.ColorPick.Controls.TriangleCurveEditor.INSET
member.summary: Inset from control edges to leave space for handle rendering.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.ColorPick.Controls.TriangleCurveEditor.Start_out
member.summary: Gets or sets the outgoing control point for the Start anchor. Editor space: X [-1, 0], Y [0, 1].

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.ColorPick.Controls.TriangleCurveEditor.Mid_left
member.summary: Gets or sets the left incoming control point for the Mid anchor. Editor space: X [-1, 0], Y [0, 1].

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.ColorPick.Controls.TriangleCurveEditor.Mid_right
member.summary: Gets or sets the right outgoing control point for the Mid anchor. Editor space: X [0, 1], Y [0, 1].

member.summary: Gets or sets the incoming control point for the End anchor. Editor space: X [0, 1], Y [0, 1].

member.summary: Fired when the curve shape changes due to user interaction.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.BgraToBrushConverter
member.summary: Converts packed BGRA uint values to for XAML binding.

remarks.para: BgraToBrushConverter handles PixlPunkt's internal BGRA color format (0xAARRGGBB in memory order, but B/G/R/A byte layout). Unlike which expects ARGB, this converter uses to correctly interpret BGRA-packed values.
Accepts multiple numeric types (uint, int, long, ulong) and hex strings. All are converted to uint before interpretation. Fallback is opaque black (0xFF000000) if value is invalid.
ConvertBack always returns opaque black. This converter is intended for display-only scenarios where BGRA values are shown but not edited through the brush.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.BgraToBrushConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a packed BGRA uint (or compatible numeric type) to a .
member.param: BGRA color value as uint, int, long, ulong, or hex string. Value is interpreted using which handles BGRA byte order.
member.returns: with BGRA color converted to ARGB, or opaque black if value is invalid.
member.remarks: Handles numeric boxing variations common in WinUI binding. Hex strings are parsed with invariant culture.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.BgraToBrushConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a brush back to packed BGRA uint (not implemented - returns opaque black).
member.returns: Always returns 0xFF000000 (opaque black).
member.remarks: This converter is intended for one-way binding (display only). Use dedicated color pickers for editing BGRA values.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.BoolToVisibilityConverter
member.summary: Converts boolean values to for XAML binding (true=Visible, false=Collapsed).

remarks.para:
Standard WinUI boolean-to-visibility converter implementing the common pattern:
- true
- false

- Show UI when a feature is enabled (e.g., "HasSelection" shows transform handles)
- Display content when data is present (e.g., "HasLayers" shows layer list)
- Conditional UI visibility (e.g., "IsAdmin" shows admin panel)
remarks.code: <Button Content="Save" Visibility="{Binding HasUnsavedChanges, Converter={StaticResource BoolToVisibility}}" />

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.BoolToVisibilityConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a boolean value to a value.
member.returns: if true, if false.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.BoolToVisibilityConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts back to boolean.
member.returns: True if Visible, false otherwise.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.ByteToDoubleConverter
member.summary: Converts byte values (0-255) to/from double for numeric controls like sliders.

remarks.para: ByteToDoubleConverter enables binding byte properties (e.g., opacity, color channels) to WinUI numeric controls that require double values. Handles bidirectional conversion with automatic clamping to byte range.

list.item: Forward: byte double (simple cast, preserves value)
Backward: double byte (rounded to nearest integer, clamped to 0-255)

remarks.para: Convert method accepts byte or int (clamped to 0-255). ConvertBack accepts double, float, or int and rounds to nearest integer before clamping. This handles various numeric boxings from WinUI controls.
remarks.code: <Slider Minimum="0" Maximum="255" Value="{Binding LayerOpacity, Converter={StaticResource ByteToDouble}, Mode=TwoWay}" />

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.ByteToDoubleConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a byte (or int) to double.
member.param: Byte or int value to convert. Int values are clamped to 0-255.
member.returns: Double representation of the byte value (0.0-255.0).

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.ByteToDoubleConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a double (or float/int) back to byte with rounding and clamping.
member.param: Double, float, or int value to convert.
member.returns: Byte value rounded to nearest integer and clamped to 0-255 range.
member.remarks: Uses Math.Round for nearest-integer rounding (banker's rounding). Clamps result to valid byte range to prevent overflow.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.CountToVisibilityConverter
member.summary: Converts a count to Visibility (Visible if > 0, Collapsed otherwise).

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.InverseBoolToVisibilityConverter
member.summary: Converts boolean values to with inverted logic for XAML binding.

remarks.para:
InverseBoolToVisibilityConverter implements the opposite mapping from standard bool-to-visibility:
- false
- true

- Hide UI when a feature is enabled (e.g., "IsProcessing" hides action buttons)
- Show placeholders when content is empty (e.g., "HasItems" == false shows "No items")
- Display error messages when validation fails (e.g., "IsValid" == false shows error)
remarks.code: <TextBlock Text="No layers" Visibility="{Binding HasLayers, Converter={StaticResource InverseBoolToVisibility}}" />

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.InverseBoolToVisibilityConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a boolean to with inverted logic.
member.returns: if false, if true.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.InverseBoolToVisibilityConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts back to boolean with inverted logic.
member.returns: False if Visible, true otherwise.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.LayerTypeToChevronVisibilityConverter
member.summary: Converts layer types to for expand/collapse chevron display.

remarks.para: LayerTypeToChevronVisibilityConverter determines whether a layer should display an expand/collapse chevron in tree views. Only instances (which can contain children) show chevrons; instances (leaf nodes) have chevrons collapsed.

list.item: (no chevron)
(show chevron)
Any other type (defensive default)

remarks.code: <TextBlock Text="" Visibility="{Binding Layer, Converter={StaticResource LayerTypeToChevron}}" />
remarks.para:
- Layer panel tree view chevron visibility
- Hierarchical navigation indicators
- Conditional UI based on layer type capabilities

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.LayerTypeToChevronVisibilityConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a layer object to chevron visibility.
member.returns: if value is ; otherwise.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.LayerTypeToChevronVisibilityConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts back (not supported - throws ).
member.exception: Always thrown; reverse conversion is not meaningful.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.LevelToIndentConverter
member.summary: Converts tree depth levels to for hierarchical indentation.

remarks.para: LevelToIndentConverter creates visual hierarchy in tree views by converting depth integers to left margin thickness. Each level adds configurable indent pixels, creating nested visual structure.

Margin.Left = level Indent
Example with Indent=12:
- Level 0 Thickness(0, 0, 0, 0)
- Level 1 Thickness(12, 0, 0, 0)
- Level 2 Thickness(24, 0, 0, 0)
remarks.code:
<local:LevelToIndentConverter x:Key="LevelToIndent" Indent="16" />
<TextBlock Margin="{Binding Depth, Converter={StaticResource LevelToIndent}}" />
remarks.para:
- Layer panel tree indentation (see )
- File/folder explorer hierarchies
- Nested menu structures
- Outline/document tree views

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.LevelToIndentConverter.Indent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indentation width per level in pixels.
member.value: Number of pixels to indent per depth level. Default is 12.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.LevelToIndentConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a depth level integer to left margin thickness.
member.param: Integer depth level (0 = root, 1 = first child, etc.).
member.returns: with left margin = level , other margins zero.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.LevelToIndentConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts back (not supported - returns 0).
member.returns: Always returns 0.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.LevelToIndentDoubleConverter
member.summary: Converts tree depth levels to double for width/margin binding in hierarchical layouts.

remarks.para: LevelToIndentDoubleConverter is similar to but returns a double value instead of . This enables binding to Width, Height, or numeric properties that require scalar values.

Result = level Indent
Example with Indent=14 (default):
- Level 0 0.0
- Level 1 14.0
- Level 2 28.0
remarks.code:
<local:LevelToIndentDoubleConverter x:Key="LevelToIndentDouble" Indent="16" />
<Border Width="{Binding Depth, Converter={StaticResource LevelToIndentDouble}}" />
remarks.para:
- Indent spacer widths for tree views
- Progressive disclosure animations (width transitions)
- Hierarchical spacing calculations
- Level-based sizing (e.g., progressively smaller icons at deeper levels)

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.LevelToIndentDoubleConverter.Indent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indentation width per level in pixels.
member.value: Number of pixels to indent per depth level. Default is 14.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.LevelToIndentDoubleConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a depth level integer to indentation width.
member.param: Integer depth level (0 = root, 1 = first child, etc.).
member.returns: Double value = level . Returns 0.0 if value is not an integer.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.LevelToIndentDoubleConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts back (not supported - throws ).
member.exception: Always thrown; conversion back is not meaningful.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.UIntArrayToHexListConverter
member.summary: Converts arrays of packed ARGB uint values to/from comma-separated hex color strings.

remarks.para: UIntArrayToHexListConverter enables editing of color palettes and lists through text input. Useful for palette import/export, color list configuration, and batch color editing.

Colors are separated by commas, spaces, newlines, or semicolons. Each color can be:
- AARRGGBB: Full 8-digit with alpha (e.g., "FF5533AA")
- RRGGBB: 6-digit RGB, assumes alpha=FF (e.g., "5533AA")
- #AARRGGBB or #RRGGBB: Optional '#' prefix
Invalid tokens are skipped (filtered out). Empty input returns empty array. Flexible delimiter support (comma, space, newline, semicolon) enables paste from various sources.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.UIntArrayToHexListConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a uint array to a comma-separated hex string.
member.returns: Comma-separated hex string (e.g., "FF5533AA,FF22BB44"), or empty string if array is null/empty.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.UIntArrayToHexListConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a delimited hex string back to a uint array.
member.param: String containing hex colors separated by comma, space, newline, or semicolon.
member.returns: Array of parsed ARGB uint colors. Invalid tokens are skipped. Empty input returns empty array.
member.remarks: Supports multiple delimiters for flexible paste operations. Each token is trimmed, '#' prefix is stripped, and 6-digit RGB is expanded to 8-digit with alpha=FF. Uses invariant culture parsing.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.UIntToBrushConverter
member.summary: Converts packed ARGB uint values to for XAML binding.

remarks.para: UIntToBrushConverter translates between uint color representation (0xAARRGGBB) and WinUI brushes. This enables direct binding of color uint values to visual properties like Fill, Stroke, or Background.

Input uint is interpreted as ARGB with byte layout:
- Bits 24-31: Alpha (0=transparent, 255=opaque)
- Bits 16-23: Red
- Bits 8-15: Green
- Bits 0-7: Blue
If value is not a valid uint, returns transparent black (0x00000000). ConvertBack returns 0 if brush is invalid.
remarks.code: <Rectangle Fill="{Binding CurrentColor, Converter={StaticResource UIntToBrush}}" />
remarks.para: Writes converted values to debug output in hex format (e.g., "FFAA5577") for troubleshooting color binding issues.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.UIntToBrushConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a packed ARGB uint to a .
member.param: Uint color value in ARGB format (0xAARRGGBB).
member.returns: with ARGB color, or transparent black if value is invalid.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.UIntToBrushConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a back to packed ARGB uint.
member.returns: Packed ARGB uint (0xAARRGGBB), or 0 if brush is invalid.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.UIntToHexColorConverter
member.summary: Converts packed ARGB uint values to hexadecimal color strings for XAML binding.

remarks.para: UIntToHexColorConverter enables two-way binding between uint color values (0xAARRGGBB format) and user-editable hex string representations. Supports both 6-digit RGB (assumes opaque) and 8-digit ARGB formats, with optional '#' prefix.

list.item: AARRGGBB: Full 8-digit with alpha (e.g., "FF5533AA")
RRGGBB: 6-digit RGB, assumes alpha=FF (e.g., "5533AA" ? "FF5533AA")
#AARRGGBB or #RRGGBB: Optional '#' prefix is stripped

remarks.para: Invalid input returns opaque black (0xFF000000). This preserves existing binding value rather than clearing it on parse errors.
remarks.code: <TextBox Text="{Binding CurrentColor, Converter={StaticResource UIntToHexColor}, Mode=TwoWay}" />

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.UIntToHexColorConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a packed ARGB uint to an 8-digit hexadecimal string.
member.param: Uint color value in ARGB format (0xAARRGGBB).
member.returns: 8-digit hex string (e.g., "FF5533AA"), or "FF000000" if value is invalid.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Converters.UIntToHexColorConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a hexadecimal color string back to packed ARGB uint.
member.param: Hex string in RRGGBB or AARRGGBB format, optionally with '#' prefix.
member.returns: Packed ARGB uint (0xAARRGGBB). Returns 0xFF000000 (opaque black) if parsing fails.
member.remarks: Trims whitespace and strips leading '#'. 6-digit RGB is expanded to 8-digit with alpha=FF. Uses invariant culture parsing for consistent behavior regardless of locale.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Dialogs.Import.ImageImportDialog
member.summary: Dialog for importing images with tile-based canvas configuration.

remarks.para: Allows users to choose between: - Single tile mode: Creates a 1x1 tile canvas where tile size equals image size - Custom tile mode: Specify tile dimensions, canvas expands to fit entire image
For custom tiles, the canvas grid is calculated to ensure the entire image fits: - TilesX = ceil(imageWidth / tileWidth) - TilesY = ceil(imageHeight / tileHeight)

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Dialogs.EditCanvasWindow.CalculateTileOffset(PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Dialogs.EditCanvasWindow.AnchorPosition,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the TILE offset for existing content based on anchor position and tile delta. This ensures that with odd tile deltas, the extra tile goes to right/bottom (content stays at whole-tile boundaries).
member.param: The anchor position where existing content is pinned.
Width change in tiles (positive = expand, negative = shrink).
Height change in tiles (positive = expand, negative = shrink).
member.returns: Offset (X, Y) in tile units where existing content should be placed.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Helpers.LayerTreeTemplateSelector
member.summary: Selects for items based on layer type.

remarks.para: LayerTreeTemplateSelector handles TreeView's specific data binding where items are wrapped in . Unwraps the node content before selecting template, enabling hierarchical layer panel UI with folder/layer distinction.
When using TreeView with TreeViewNode binding, the item parameter is TreeViewNode. This selector extracts TreeViewNode.Content to access the actual layer object before template selection.
remarks.code:
<local:LayerTreeTemplateSelector x:Key="LayerTreeSelector" LayerTemplate="{StaticResource RasterLayerTreeTemplate}" FolderTemplate="{StaticResource LayerFolderTreeTemplate}" />
<TreeView ItemTemplateSelector="{StaticResource LayerTreeSelector}" />

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Helpers.LayerTreeTemplateSelector.LayerTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for items.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Helpers.LayerTreeTemplateSelector.FolderTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for items.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Helpers.LayerTreeTemplateSelector.SelectTemplateCore(System.Object,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Selects template after unwrapping TreeViewNode content.
member.returns: LayerTemplate for RasterLayer, FolderTemplate for LayerFolder, or LayerTemplate as safe default.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Helpers.LayerTreeTemplateSelector.SelectTemplateCore(System.Object)
member.summary: Delegates to two-parameter overload.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Helpers.NodeTemplateSelector
member.summary: Selects based on layer type for list/grid item rendering.

remarks.para: NodeTemplateSelector enables different visual representations for and items in lists, grids, or item controls. Commonly used in layer panels to show distinct UI for leaf nodes (layers) vs. containers (folders).
remarks.code:
<local:NodeTemplateSelector x:Key="LayerNodeSelector" LayerTemplate="{StaticResource RasterLayerTemplate}" FolderTemplate="{StaticResource LayerFolderTemplate}" />
<ListView ItemTemplateSelector="{StaticResource LayerNodeSelector}" />

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Helpers.NodeTemplateSelector.LayerTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for items.

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Helpers.NodeTemplateSelector.FolderTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for items.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Helpers.NodeTemplateSelector.SelectTemplateCore(System.Object)
member.summary: Selects the appropriate template based on item type.
member.returns: LayerTemplate for RasterLayer, FolderTemplate for LayerFolder, or base template otherwise.

member.summary: Selects template (delegates to single-parameter overload).

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Helpers.SliderNumberBoxBinder
member.summary: Provides two-way binding synchronization between and controls.

remarks.para: SliderNumberBoxBinder prevents infinite update loops when synchronizing slider and number box values in two-way binding scenarios. Common pattern in settings/adjustment UI where users need both continuous slider control and precise numeric input.

Without suppression, value changes trigger:
1. User drags slider ? slider.ValueChanged fires
2. Updates number box ? numberBox.ValueChanged fires
3. Updates slider ? slider.ValueChanged fires again (infinite loop!)
Uses _suppress flag to prevent re-entrant updates. When one control changes, flag is set before updating the other control, preventing the change event from propagating back.

member.name: M:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Helpers.SliderNumberBoxBinder.BindPair(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Slider,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NumberBox,System.Action{System.Double})
member.summary: Binds a slider and number box pair with bidirectional synchronization.
member.param: Slider control for continuous value adjustment.
NumberBox control for precise numeric input.
Callback invoked when value changes from either control. Receives the new value.

remarks.para: Both controls should have matching Min/Max ranges for consistent behavior. The callback is invoked only once per user interaction (not during synchronization).
Slider and NumberBox values are automatically kept in sync. User changes to either control update the other and trigger the callback exactly once.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Layers.DynamicEffectTemplateSelector
member.summary: Dynamically generates effect settings UI from .

remarks.para: This template selector creates UI controls dynamically using the same that powers the tool options bar. This ensures consistent UI patterns across tools and effects, and automatically supports plugin effects without requiring XAML template changes.

list.item: Gets the effect's
Looks up the registration in
Calls to get option descriptors
Uses for each option
Arranges controls in a vertical StackPanel
No hardcoded XAML templates per effect type
Plugin effects automatically get settings UI
Consistent look and feel with tool options
Single point of maintenance for UI generation

member.name: P:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Layers.DynamicEffectTemplateSelector.OnEffectChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets the action to invoke when any effect property changes.
member.remarks: This is typically wired to recomposite the layer/document.

member.summary: Creates a UI panel with dynamic controls for the given effect.
member.param: The effect to create UI for.
Optional callback invoked when any effect property changes.
member.returns: A StackPanel containing all the effect's option controls.

member.summary: Attempts to find a registration by matching the effect's type.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Layers.EffectSettingsTemplateSelector
member.summary: Selects for effect settings panels based on effect type.

remarks.para: EffectSettingsTemplateSelector provides custom UI templates for editing effect parameters. Each effect type can have a dedicated settings template with specialized controls for its parameters (e.g., thickness slider for ScanLinesEffect, offset controls for DropShadowEffect).

WinUI sometimes passes null for the item parameter. When this occurs, the selector falls back to reading container.DataContext to access the actual effect object. Debug logging is included to troubleshoot binding issues.
Only has explicit template support via . Other effects return null (no custom UI), relying on default property grid or base template.

member.summary: Gets or sets the settings template for .

member.summary: Selects settings template based on effect type.
member.param: Effect instance to template (may be null).
Container element (fallback for DataContext if item is null).
member.returns: Specialized settings template, or null to use default/base template.
member.remarks: Debug logging writes selected type name to help diagnose binding/template issues during development.

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.Layers.LayersPanel
member.summary: LayersPanel partial: Drag-and-drop logic, insertion indicators, folder highlighting, and auto-scroll.
LayersPanel partial: Flyout event wiring and handlers for raster layers, folders, and reference layers.
LayersPanel partial: Visual tree helpers and UI utility methods.
LayersPanel partial: Layer mask operations and effects clipboard.
LayersPanel partial: Root drop zone for moving items out of folders to root level.

Main partial class for LayersPanel containing fields, constructor, document binding, and core event handlers. Other functionality is split into partial files: - LayersPanel.Flyouts.cs: Flyout event wiring and handlers - LayersPanel.DragDrop.cs: Drag and drop logic - LayersPanel.RootDropZone.cs: Root drop zone for moving items out of folders - LayersPanel.Helpers.cs: Visual tree helpers and UI utilities - LayersPanel.Masks.cs: Layer mask operations

member.name: T:PixlPunkt.Uno.UI.PixlPunktMainWindow
member.summary: Partial class for palette management: - Preset menu building - Custom palette menu building - Import from image/layer/document/JSON/file - Export to custom palette file - Color binding between palette and brush
Partial class for panel docking/undocking management.
Partial class for plugin import/export menu management. Builds dynamic menus for plugin-provided import/export handlers.
Partial class for reference image menu commands and operations.
Partial class for session state management (crash recovery).
Partial class for tab and document management: - Tab creation and headers - Document window detachment - Host attachment/detachment - Tab event handlers
Partial class for advanced template operations (export/import).
Partial class for theme management: - Application-wide theme control (Light/Dark/System) - Stripe/transparency pattern theme control - Theme synchronization across all hosts
Partial class for tile management operations: - Export tiles (.pxpt) - Import tiles (from .pxpt, .pxp, or open document) - Merge duplicates - Remove unused

Main application window. Hosts: - Document tab workspace (pixel canvases). - Tool rail / options bar. - Palette panel and live color bindings. - Preview panel (attached to active CanvasViewHost). - Layer panel (bound to active document). - Keyboard accelerators for tools and editing. Handles creation, attachment, and detachment of canvas hosts; custom title bar setup; palette import/export.
member.remarks: This class is split across multiple partial files: - PixlPunktMainWindow.xaml.cs: Core initialization and fields - PixlPunktMainWindow.File.cs: File import/export operations - PixlPunktMainWindow.Shortcuts.cs: Keyboard shortcuts and accelerators - PixlPunktMainWindow.Palette.cs: Palette management (presets, import, export) - PixlPunktMainWindow.Tabs.cs: Tab/document management and host attachment - PixlPunktMainWindow.Theme.cs: Theme/stripe pattern management

member.summary: Handles pointer press on Root to ensure keyboard focus is restored. On Uno Skia platforms, KeyDown events only fire when the element has focus. This handler ensures that clicking anywhere in the app restores focus to Root, enabling tool shortcuts to work properly on desktop Linux and WSL.
